Préparation et gestion de documents : création et formatage de documents et de présentations à partir des normes d’EY sur la marque

Préparatifs de voyage : recherche d’options de déplacement, réservation de voyages par transport aérien et terrestre au moyen de notre outil de réservation en ligne et gestion des aspects logistiques liés aux déplacements

Coordination de réunions et d’événements, y compris les services technologiques et de traiteurs, le cas échéant




Effectuer des heures supplémentaires, au besoin.



Compétences et qualités pour réussir



Être déterminé à favoriser une culture d’équipe forte afin d’assurer le succès

Capacité à répondre efficacement aux besoins des clients, en assumant la responsabilité de la satisfaction des clients

Capacité à maintenir son efficacité et son professionnalisme lorsque s’opère un changement de tâches ou dans le milieu de travail

Capacité à travailler dans un environnement collaboratif où les choses évoluent rapidement et sous la pression des échéances

Excellentes aptitudes en communications écrites et verbales

Aptitudes à gérer et à organiser son temps efficacement

Établir et entretenir des relations afin d’exploiter efficacement nos compétences

Faire preuve d’un bon jugement en ce qui a trait aux questions confidentielles et délicates.

Avoir une capacité éprouvée de respecter des échéances multiples ou imprévues dans un milieu exigeant

Être ouvert au changement et détenir une expérience en refonte des processus

Être motivé par l’envie de constamment s’améliorer en acquérant de nouvelles compétences 




Pour être admissible à ce poste, vous devez avoir :



un diplôme d’études postsecondaires ou de l’expérience professionnelle connexe

une excellente connaissance des logiciels Word, Excel et PowerPoint, et une capacité démontrée pour l’apprentissage de logiciels et d’outils personnalisés

d’excellentes aptitudes en communications verbales et écrites (en français et en anglais)




Idéalement, vous devez aussi avoir :



une compréhension générale des principes financiers ayant trait à la facturation d’heures recouvrables

de l’expérience au sein d’un établissement de services professionnels 




Ce que nous offrons


Nous offrons un programme de rémunération concurrentiel selon lequel vous êtes rémunéré en fonction de votre rendement et qui reconnaît la valeur que vous apportez à l’entreprise. De plus, notre programme de rémunération globale vous permet de déterminer les avantages qui vous conviennent et ceux qui vous aideront à mettre en place des assises solides pour votre avenir. Notre programme de rémunération globale comprend une couverture complète de soins médicaux, de médicaments d’ordonnance et de soins dentaires, un régime de retraite à cotisations définies, une directive en matière de vacances formidable, qui comprend des journées payées par la Société afin que vous profitiez de fins de semaine allongées réparties dans l’année, les jours fériés et des congés personnels payés (en fonction de la province de résidence), ainsi qu’un éventail de programmes et d’avantages intéressants conçus pour votre bien-être physique, financier et social. Vous bénéficierez également :


du soutien et de l’encadrement de certains des collègues les plus inspirants du secteur;

des possibilités d’apprentissage vous permettant d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences et de propulser votre carrière;

de la liberté et de la souplesse dont vous avez besoin pour jouer votre rôle de la manière qui vous convient.




La diversité et l’inclusivité chez EY


La diversité et l’inclusivité sont au cœur de qui nous sommes et de la façon dont nous travaillons. Nous avons pris l’engagement de favoriser un environnement au sein duquel les différences sont appréciées, les directives et les pratiques sont équitables, et où nos gens éprouvent un sentiment d’appartenance. Comme en témoignent les gestes que nous avons posés pour combattre le racisme systémique, notre appui aux membres de la communauté LGBT+ ainsi que des projets novateurs tels que le Centre d’excellence en neurodiversité et nos initiatives en matière d’accessibilité, nous acceptons et saluons la diversité des expériences, des habiletés, des parcours et des perspectives de nos gens, qui les rend uniques et nous aide à évoluer. Parce que nous croyons que c’est en ayant la liberté d’être fidèles à eux-mêmes au travail que nos gens donneront le meilleur d’eux-mêmes et contribueront à bâtir un monde meilleur.

Afin de favoriser un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire en personne, EY a mis en place divers niveaux de contrôle pour assurer la santé et la sécurité de tous au bureau, chez les clients et ailleurs. L’une des composantes critiques du programme de sécurité en milieu de travail de la Société est notre politique de vaccination contre la COVID-19, qui requiert que tous les membres du personnel soient pleinement vaccinés contre la COVID-19, sauf si des mesures d’adaptation ont été accordées pour des raisons protégées par la législation des droits de la personne.


Si vous pouvez affirmer que vous remplissez les critères susmentionnés, communiquez avec nous dès que possible.



L’expérience exceptionnelle d’EY. Il n’en tient qu’à vous. 



EY | Travailler ensemble pour un monde meilleur 


La raison d’être d’EY est de bâtir un monde meilleur, de créer de la valeur à long terme pour les clients, les gens et la société et de renforcer la confiance à l’égard des marchés financiers.

S’appuyant sur les données et la technologie, les équipes diversifiées d’EY présentes dans plus de 150 pays instaurent la confiance au moyen de la certification, et aident les clients à prospérer, à se transformer et à exercer leurs activités.

Que ce soit dans les services de certification, de consultation, de stratégie, de fiscalité ou de transactions, ou encore, au sein des services juridiques, les équipes d’EY posent de meilleures questions pour trouver de nouvelles réponses aux enjeux complexes du monde d’aujourd’hui.

description:
Join Canada's leading independent Investment Dealer as the Executive Assistant to their highly reputable and admired CEO. 

Interested in learning more? send me a hello and lets chat

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services

Nous avons pris l’engagement de favoriser un environnement au sein duquel les différences sont appréciées, les directives et les pratiques sont équitables, et où nos gens éprouvent un sentiment d’appartenance. Comme en témoignent les gestes que nous avons posés pour combattre le racisme systémique, notre appui aux membres de la communauté LGBT+ ainsi que des projets novateurs tels que le Centre d’excellence en neurodiversité et nos initiatives en matière d’accessibilité, nous acceptons et saluons la diversité des expériences, des habiletés, des parcours et des perspectives de nos gens, qui les rend uniques et nous aide à évoluer. Parce que nous croyons que c’est en ayant la liberté d’être fidèles à eux-mêmes au travail que nos gens donneront le meilleur d’eux-mêmes et contribueront à bâtir un monde meilleur.


Le code « Le travail chez EY » et votre santé et sécurité


Le code « Le travail chez EY » laisse place à une certaine souplesse dans la façon dont nous collaborons, innovons et assurons la prestation de nos services grâce à notre capacité de travailler en personne et à distance. Afin de favoriser un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire en personne, EY a mis en place divers niveaux de contrôle pour assurer la santé et la sécurité de tous au bureau, chez les clients et ailleurs. L’une des composantes critiques du programme de sécurité en milieu de travail de la Société est notre politique de vaccination contre la COVID-19, qui requiert que tous les membres du personnel soient pleinement vaccinés contre la COVID-19, sauf si des mesures d’adaptation ont été accordées pour des raisons protégées par la législation des droits de la personne.


Si vous pouvez affirmer que vous remplissez les critères susmentionnés, communiquez avec nous dès que possible.



L’expérience exceptionnelle d’EY. Il n’en tient qu’à vous. 



EY | Travailler ensemble pour un monde meilleur 


La raison d’être d’EY est de bâtir un monde meilleur, de créer de la valeur à long terme pour les clients, les gens et la société et de renforcer la confiance à l’égard des marchés financiers.

S’appuyant sur les données et la technologie, les équipes diversifiées d’EY présentes dans plus de 150 pays instaurent la confiance au moyen de la certification, et aident les clients à prospérer, à se transformer et à exercer leurs activités.

Que ce soit dans les services de certification, de consultation, de stratégie, de fiscalité ou de transactions, ou encore, au sein des services juridiques, les équipes d’EY posent de meilleures questions pour trouver de nouvelles réponses aux enjeux complexes du monde d’aujourd’hui.

About us





We are a Real Estate team looking for a motivated individual to join our growing team. Our team members have over 46 years of combined experience in the field. 





Duties:



Help the agents in whatever way possible to make them more efficient

Type offers, waivers and amendments as needed

Communicate with leadership group daily to see what can be done to help them

Prepare and bind CMA’s as needed

Book market review appointments for agents with client

Prepare weekly and monthly meetings for the team

Book showing appointments as needed

Install sold signs as needed

Update contact information for past clients.

Provide administrative duties where needed

Calendar management and appointment reminder

Handling the transaction and communicate with clients

Manage, clean, and maintain the database CRM

Order photography, stagings, and sings to all of the new listings and inform clients with important dates





This is not limited to the above-mentioned items but is to include any other tasks that may be needed by the company.





Qualifications



Have Knowledge of using webforms, matrix and on both MREB board and Toronto Board is an asset

Extremely detailed person and organized

Previous Real estate experience is an asset

Must have Valid G type licence and own transportation

industries: Marketing Services, Manufacturing, and Retail
description:
Description & Requirements




 Please note this role will be based in Vancouver, BC ** 




Who We Are



lululemon is a yoga-inspired technical apparel company up to big things. The practice and philosophy of yoga informs our overall purpose to elevate the world through the power of practice. We are proud to be a growing global company with locations across North America, Australia and New Zealand, Europe, and Asia. We owe our success to our innovative product, our emphasis on our stores, our commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we get to make in every community we are in.



Executive Assistant Responsibilities




 Coordinates Executive’s calendar and contacts and, according to allowed authority, manages Executives email.

 Establishes work priorities and directs assignment of work to various department staff according to scope of allowed authority.

 Coordinates and sends meeting invitations and agendas to attendees, books meeting rooms and arranges for IT resources and refreshments in support of efficient meeting facilitation.

 Maintains confidential information for the business, team and leadership and ensures information is handled appropriately.

 Coordinates multi-leg travel, often requiring continuous changes and rescheduling, in conjunction with team of Executive Assistants and according to most Senior Executive travel plan.

 Oversees the approval of department expenses, including the review of employee expense claims for accuracy and adherence to policy on behalf of Executive.

 Acts as a communications liaison with Department as required.

 Responds to inquiries or refers them to the appropriate partner.

 Prepares briefing notes and minutes of meetings, as required.

 Provides Executives with documentation needed for meetings and correspondence with the business.

 Delegates and follows up on action items that fall within realm of responsibility.

 Supports space planning needs for department growth.

 Special Projects as assigned by Executive.

 In partnership with P&C, owns and oversees onboarding of incoming Senior Executives and new members of their Leadership Team.





Qualifications




 2-5 years’ experience or equivalent in an administrative and or executive support level capacity with increasing responsibilities.

 Excellent business acumen, effective communicator, and ability to exercise tact, sound judgment and prioritization.

 Able to observe and maintain the utmost confidentiality.

 Advanced-level Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint proficiency.

 Experience working with a publicly traded company.


NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest. lululemon is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, creed, age, sex, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions or any other classification protected by federal, state or provincial and local laws and ordinances. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request. This Equal Employment Opportunity policy applies to all practices relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline, transfer, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that lululemon equal employment opportunity policies are implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective.

Park Paving Ltd. is currently hiring for the position of RECEPTIONIST / ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT.







We have been locally owned and operated for almost 50 years as one of the largest road construction contractors in Edmonton, and we are looking for someone to oversee the day-to-day operations of our font desk at our main office located in south Edmonton.







This position has a diverse range of clerical duties and responsibilities that support a wide range of company operations. If you’re someone with excellent communication skills and enjoy the challenge of being able to prioritize multiple tasks or projects in a dynamic environment, then this is the right job for you! On any given day your role might be focused on any combination of administrative/support duties in the following areas:







RECEPTION

OFFICE ADMINISTRATION

ACCOUNTING

DOCUMENT HANDLING/FILING

ADVERTISING AND COMMUNICATIONS

HUMAN RESOURCES AND SAFETY







Successful candidates will have a strong working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of programs and be comfortable working with computers and other standard office machines.







Minimum qualifications for the position are a high school diploma (or equivalent). Preference given to candidates with administrative experience and/or any kind of post-secondary education.

À propos de nous : 

RedBox Media est une entreprise spécialisé dans le Marketing digital et expérientiel dont le but est de créer et mettre en place des solutions innovatrices qui permettent d’accélérer la croissance des entreprises de nos clients. Pour nous, chaque projet est unique et nous souhaitons offrir une approche différente pour répondre précisément au besoins de chacun. RedBox Media à su s’entourer d’une équipe jeune et dynamique qui participent à la réussite de nos projets. 

Points clefs de notre environnement de travail : 

-	Des horaires de travail flexibles 
-	De nouveaux bureaux en plein coeur du Vieux-Montréal avec accès facile via les réseaux de transport
-	Un environnement de travail convivial avec des projets diverses et stimulants
-	La possibilité de participer à la création et évolution de plusieurs projets internes passionnants

Vos missions au quotidien : 

En collaboration étroite avec l’équipe de gestion, vos missions incluent : 

-	Vous tenez à jour la comptabilité clients et fournisseurs 
-	Vous préparez les paies et les soumettre à notre système de gestion de paie (Nethris)
-	Vous surveillerez les comptes bancaires et les flux de trésorerie
-	Vous réaliserez la gestion administrative des courriels de nos divisions internes
-	Vous faites le suivi de nos pages sur les medias sociaux, répondre aux questions des clients
-	Vous travaillez avec la haute direction pour les assister dans des projets et tâches administratives
-	Vous collaborez à mettre en place certaines initiatives en liens avec les ressources humaines ; recrutement, stages, activités sociales, mise en place de nouvelles initiatives, outils et ressources pour les employés.

Le profil recherché : 

-	Vous avez comme diplôme un DEC en techniques de bureautique, comptabilité de gestions ou l’équivalent 
-	Vous êtes passionné des chiffres et êtes très organisé et autodidacte
-	Vous avez un esprit logique et être très organisé dans votre travail
-	Vous avez une excellente technique pour la prise de notes et la rédaction de résumés exécutifs
-	Vous possédez un minimum de deux années d’expérience en gestion de paie, bureautique ou comptabilité
-	Vous maitrisez la suite Microsoft Office et Gsuite
-	Vous êtes familiers avec des outils comme Dropbox, Slack, Teamwork et Trello.
-	Vous avez acquis des compétences en comptabilité et en gestion 
-	Vous avez une connaissance des règles fiscales de base et de l’expérience avec la tenue de livre ainsi que les rapports TPS/TVQ, comptabilité courante.
-	Vous avez de l’expérience avec la préparation de rapport fiscaux de base et demandes des subventions
-	Vous savez travaillez en autonomie et prendre des initiatives 
-	Vous êtes à l’aise à travailler en collaboration 
-	Vous excellez dans la planification et l’organisation 
-	Vous avez une excellente maîtrise de la langue française et anglaise, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
-	Vous êtes diplomate, avez de l’entregent et digne de confiance
•	Connaissance du système de gestion de paies Nethris (un atout majeur)
•	Connaissance du logiciel de gestion comptable QuickBooks (un atout majeur)
•	Connaissance de base pour mise à jour de contenu sur site WordPress (un atout)



Type d’emploi : 

-	 Emploi à temps partiel 2@4 jours par semaine selon le niveau de responsabilité et connaissances du candidat.
-	Vous commencerez dès que possible 
-	Salaire : 18 à 25$ / heure (selon le niveau d’expérience)
-	Horaire : fléxible, 2 à 4 jours semaine 10 à 5.
-	Télétravail : possibilité de travailler en mode mixte bureau et télétravail (après la fin de la période de formation)


Ce que nous offrons  : 

Dans un espace de travail mêlant la bonne humeur et le sérieux Redbox Media vous permet de bénéficier de : 

-	rabais employés sur nos produits, plateformes et évènements ( MTLRABAIS.com, RESTOMANIA.ca, passeports découvertes, soirées AfterWork, etc.) 
-	Accès à plusieurs autres aventages exclusifs avec nos clients et partenaires.


Merci d’envoyer votre candidature à alexb@redboxmedia.ca en incluant votre CV et une lettre de motivation.

Position 

Administrative Assistant

Job Type: Full-time 







Current Opportunity  

Ginkgo Mortgage Investment Corporation is currently seeking an office administrative assistant. Good opportunity for training in financial & commercial industry.

 

Overview of Company  

Ginkgo Mortgage Investment Corporation is an established, Canada-wide alternative lender helping borrowers solve tough financial problems, while offering investors steady financial growth through high-yielding mortgages. We focus primarily in residential mortgages. Our vision is to be a prominent leader of the private mortgage industry by providing comprehensive solutions to all stakeholders.  

 

Overview of Position 

Administrative assistants carry out office support tasks to keep Company and its departments running smoothly.

In this role, you may perform various tasks related to financial reports and annual information returns and filings, to reconcile accounting statements, collect on overdue accounts via email or phone call reminders, file paperwork, and scan documents.

 

Reporting to Account Department and Collection Departments, also working with various team in Investment Department and event co-ordination etc.




Training provided with promotion opportunities. 

 




Responsibilities  

·      Prepare and post accounting entries. Reconcile various bank accounts on a daily/monthly basis. 

·      Identify discrepancies in monthly fees collections and update payment status. 

·      Prepare financial reports and annual information returns and filings. 

·      Send standard email to clients & issue certificates 

·      Maintain historical records by filing documents electronically and via hard copies  

·      Involvement with planning and organizing corporate social events  

·      Collect on overdue accounts via email or phone call reminders, or other 

·      Data entry tasks regarding mortgage/ investor information 

·      Monthly reconciliation and report to accountant 

	 







Qualifications

·      Post-secondary accounting diploma/degree 

·      Experience using QuickBooks as an asset * 

·      Bookkeeping experience is preferable  

·      Proficiency in Microsoft Office, specifically Outlook, Word, Excel  

·      Strong organizational and scheduling skills  

·      Outstanding attention to detail and ability to work independently 

·      Deadline focused and driven personality 

·      Excellent customer service skills

The Cognitive & Interpersonal Therapy Centre (CITC) is currently hiring a part-time administrative assistant (10-12 hrs/ week). In this role, the administrative assistant will work collaboratively with our associates to manage the daily activities of the practice. Duties will include clinical phone assessments, file management, appointment scheduling and all other administrative tasks. Applicants must be in the process of or have completed higher education. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and advanced communication skills are required. Please note that this is a remote position with the potential to go back into the office. 




Rate: $18/ hr




Interested applicants can apply via Linked-in or by sending a CV to office@citcassociates.com

description:
Description



We currently have a contract / temporary opening for an intelligent, highly-skilled Receptionist in a growing company. This successful and thriving company offers a career-building work environment with fulfilling challenges and is based in the Toronto, Ontario region. Are you a skilled detail oriented who can balance multiple tasks at the same time? Then this Receptionist position would be a great fit for you.

What you get to do every single day


 Perpetuate a number of different office filing processes and offer general office filing support

 Oversee various office files and provide general office filing support

 Put in orders for office and kitchen supplies

 Excellent written, verbal and social communication skills

Kuhn LLP is a team-oriented business law firm with offices in Abbotsford and Vancouver, with a focus on a wide variety of law including commercial and property litigation, construction law, employment law, family law, insolvency and charities matters. We are looking for the right person to join our team as a legal administrative assistant in our Abbotsford office. This is a full-time position.

 

The ideal candidate will possess excellent organizational, communication and computer skills and has previous experience as a legal assistant. PCLaw experience would be an asset. General responsibilities include preparation of correspondence and pleadings, document production and management, setting various court dates, preparation for court applications, mediation and trial. Strong organizational and computer skills, detail orientation and the ability to work independently are a must  as well, as a personal commitment to excellence and the ability to function effectively in a fast-paced, integrated team environment.

 

Kuhn LLP offers a competitive salary and a full range of benefits.  Please forward your cover letter and resume by email on a confidential basis to Lasmith@kuhnco.net

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Director, Administration, the Receptionist is the initial point of contact for incoming visitors. The Receptionist handles some incoming calls, answering questions or transferring callers as appropriate. The Receptionist also performs a variety of other duties to support the efficient and effective operation of the Claim Services area.

 

Position Responsibilities/Tasks:


Greets clients and visitors arriving at reception, determines nature of visit, and announces arrival of client or visitor to appropriate individual or determines who the client or visitor should see. Ensures all visitors are escorted by a staff member past secure entrance to office area

Provides information/forms to client/visitor upon request or as appropriate and answers eligibility and claims related questions. Logs information regarding member visits in DEBS

Receives incoming telephone calls by providing callers with information or transferring calls to appropriate individuals. Ensures all calls received are recorded in DEBS at the time the call or visit takes place

Receives incoming faxes and forwards to appropriate individuals. Transmits faxes as requested. Checks e-mail at the noted times outlined in the department schedule. Directs inquiries as required

Prepares address labels for outgoing mail requests and ensures all outgoing mail is forwarded to Corporate Services by a pre-determined time on daily basis

Records and distributes voicemail messages according to the department schedule

Responds to basic email and voicemail inquiries within 1 business day

Remains current on Call Centre staff schedules and breaks so that callers and visitors can be informed of staff availability

Ensures individuals show identification and provide signatures prior to picking up disability cheques

Performs administrative support tasks relating to change of addresses, eligibility letters, and self-payment notices, opening files for life insurance claims and weekly disability

Processes claims for Trust Fund and Corporate clients within the established contract service standards

Contacts providers as required to obtain missing information

The Edmonton office reception area is open from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. (MT), and the reception desk must be covered at all times. The Receptionist is responsible for ensuring appropriate coverage is available when away from the desk for even short periods of time





Position Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


Required Skills and Abilities:



Professional attitude and appearance

Attention to detail and commitment to accuracy of work

Excellent interpersonal communication skills

Good written communication skills

Good organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks, including ability to meet company service standard of one business day to respond to inquiries

Good analytical, decision making, and problem solving skills

Flexible and adaptable

Ability to perform multiple tasks at same time

Strong ability to work independently and as part of a team

Proven computer and keyboarding skills

Possess current Commissioner for Oaths appointment, or be willing to obtain and maintain same

Bilingual (English and French) an asset





Qualifications, Education and Experience Required:


Minimum of High School Diploma or equivalent

Minimum 2 years’ experience as a receptionist or customer service experience in a client-focused organization

Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook with demonstrated minimum typing speed of 60 wpm and 95% accuracy

Experience with and / or training in medical and dental terminology would be an asset but not a requirement

The Company: 
Action Center Elite is a leading child development center that utilizes martial arts and parkour training as its vehicle. We teach the ways kids want to learn using the brain in mind, and with training that targets their age-specific needs. We are committed to developing kids become the best possible version of themselves


The Position: 
We’re looking for a Full-time Office Administrator. $22.50/hour. Opportunity to be promoted to Assistant Manager within the first year of employment


Requirements



Excellent sales and customer service skills required that translate into a business mindset

Goal-oriented, and the desire to earn a professional wage is a must

Ability to learn and use our software system

Maintaining flexibility to work days, evenings, and weekends as business needs dictate

Must be fluent in English and have excellent written and verbal communication skills

Must be able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines

Must have proficient computer skills and familiar with using several Social Media platforms

A willingness to not accept mediocrity and a desire to always improve

Daily and/or occasional travel may be required RESPONSIBILITIES

Assumes responsibility for developing and improving selling & enrollment skills for self and team

Grow and develop local B2B relationships to enhance membership benefits

Build and enforce membership community mindset in studio and online

Execute our sales process for lead generation, follow up, and membership enrollment.

Present available services and products to our current members

Initiate and participate in local and corporate special events (health fairs, grand openings, contests, community and B2B events) to promote Action Center Elite.

Other duties as assigned



Responsibilities


Incoming Call Duties:


Answering the telephones for all incoming calls in an executive manner. Taking messages and delivering them in a timely fashion to the appropriate person

Checking messages and distributing them appropriately.

Keeping track of referrals, i.e. from online trials, a friend, an advertisement, etc.

Setting appointments.

Problem solve any membership questions or concerns


Outgoing Call Duties:


Calling on past due memberships or down payments and getting another method of payment.

Lead calling and setting appointments for the Introductory lessons

Every week. a non-attendance report must be run and student should be called to reinforce attendance for optimal results.


Providing Executive Assistance to Parents/Students, and Other Staff Members:


All parents/students must be greeted with a “Hello” of some kind

You must handle any membership complaints/compliments

Update any membership changes

Must be capable to fill out any membership agreement

Enter new leads into software for accurate reporting


Maintaining and Managing the Pro Shop:


The Pro Shop must be clean and organized always

Ringing up new sales / returns

Keeping track of low items / special orders and ordering with appropriate vendors


Office Maintenance:


Inventory of office supplies, and picking up what is needed

Dealing with maintenance issues, i.e. broken mirrors, office equipment, etc. and setting appointments to have them fixed

Ordering any office equipment or supplies if needed

Providing service to any employee in need of help

Make sure the front desk area is always neat and clean


Administrative Manual:


Follow and complete daily task and business statistics tracking in the Administrative Manual.


Developing Suggestions, Ideas, and Improvements:


Giving feedback from any parents/students for improvements to the school or classes

Developing strategy and bringing high level ideas to ownership



Position Overview


A martial arts and parkour studio Administrator is a person that is passionate about the value martial arts and parkour adds to a person’s life. They understand that to introduce these wonderful activities to as many people in their community as possible they must be fully invested in their education to market and sell programs.

So, before anyone should consider the position of Office Administrator they need to have an organic passion, motivation, and excitement for improving the lives of others through the vehicle of their martial arts and parkour journey.




Job Types: Full-time, Permanent




Salary: From $22.50 per hour




Additional pay:


Bonus pay





Schedule:


8 hour shift

Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality
description:
Description




Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.


Reporting to on site Management, the Receptionist will respond to all incoming calls, greet and direct all visitors, answering inquiries in a positive and professional manner, representative of Revera. Key Responsibilities - To answer all incoming calls, and respond to caller's inquiries in a positive, professional manner ; - To redirect calls as appropriate and take clear, concise messages when required; - To greet, assist and direct all visitors; - To pick up and sort internal mail; - To stamp, deliver and maintain mail machine for external mail; - To prepare packages and arrange courier pick up; - To arrange meeting room schedule and bookings; - To update phone and distribution lists; - To maintain a clean, safe, fully stocked and well organized reception area; - To assist with small projects as required by other administrative support (i.e. labels, bulk mailing, etc.); - To complete other duties as assigned; - To uphold and promote the organization's values and philosophy relating particularly to ethics, morality, and integrity as set out in Revera's Code of Conduct. Qualifications - Above average interpersonal, oral and written communication skills; - Previous experience in reception is considered an asset; - Must exhibit professional and polished telephone manner; - Ability to handle multiple tasks at once, work under pressure, and meet deadlines; - Highly organized and detail focused; - Expertise in Microsoft Office ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint, E-Mail)


Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request. 



Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

industries: Human Resources Services
description:
Build a meaningful career


At LifeWorks, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 7,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.

LifeWorks can provide clarity among plan options and take the strain out of communications between members, administrators and fund managers. Our Ariel administration system is a robust recordkeeping platform that supports membership database updates, and provides electronic data interfaces, calculations and transactions.

The incumbent provides administrative support to a team in the Defined Benefit Pension Administration practice area.


Responsibilities:




Data entry on various systems including in-house pension administration system and Excel worksheets

Performs mail merges for mass mailings to clients

Provides general administration, including faxing, photocopying, filing and ordering supplies

Monthly preparation of client billings

Opens, sorts, logs and distributes group mail

Supports other administrative assistants when required

Devises ways to continuously improve team operations

Provides call centre line phone relief when required

Assists with special projects, as required

Compile and print outbound mail packages ensuring accuracy




Your profile:




Ability to multitask

Attention to detail is essential

Post-secondary education or a minimum of two years of relevant experience

Dedicated team player, who demonstrates initiative and independence

Advanced skills with office equipment, including photocopier/colour printer

Exceptional customer focus with strong professional acumen

Excellent communication and organizational skills

A good understanding of personal computers and software, particularly MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Experience working in the group benefits or pension industry

Bilingual in English and French would be considered an asset



Where permitted by law, LifeWorks employees must be fully immunized to access a LifeWorks office or customer premises.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to talentacquisitiononboarding@lifeworks.com


Fulfilling work that matters


LifeWorks is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve. We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.

At LifeWorks, we are committed to putting our people first. Our priority is to optimize the health and productivity of our people. In light of COVID-19, our company continues to monitor the global situation and following local guidance in each of our communities to ensure the health and wellbeing of our employees. Safety is our highest priority, and while the goal is to ultimately return to the office, we are currently working remotely and are connecting with candidates through virtual interviews, recruitment events, and information sessions. We are excited to connect with you virtually, and look forward to receiving your application.

job_title: Executive Assistant, Office of the President
description:
Position Profile: Executive Assistant, Office of the President 


Start date: May 2, 2022 





About The Position: 


Loyola High School is seeking an experienced Executive Administrative Assistant to support the mission of Loyola High School by providing effective, efficient and professional support to the President of the school. This person will act with little supervision, anticipating needs while managing the day‐to‐day workflow and prioritizing various projects, which include scheduling, contact management, preparing materials for meetings, and participating in a wide range of special projects. The ideal candidate will possess a welcoming, discerning client focused personality and bring the necessary skill set to perform, coordinate and oversee administrative duties while providing an extensive level of support to the President of the school. 





Our History 


Loyola is a Jesuit, Catholic high school that challenges its students to become intellectually competent, open to growth, religious, loving and committed to doing justice. 

A university-preparatory school, Loyola is committed to the development of the whole person through a comprehensive educational experience of academic excellence, spiritual and religious formation, and co-curricular involvement. 

In the Ignatian spirit of care and concern for the individual, Loyola strives to develop the diverse and unique talents of each member of the Loyola community, and encourages the use of these talents to serve others for the greater glory of God. 





Primary Areas of Responsibility: 



Manage the President’s schedule including day-to-day and long-term management of meetings, projects, and priorities 

Coordinate the Board of Governors meetings as well as the board committee meetings, scheduling, organizing and taking minutes at all meetings

Schedule all meetings and travel, including prioritizing meetings and communicating all relevant details to participants

Balance conflicting priorities in order to manage workflow, ensure the completion of essential projects, and meet critical deadlines

Reconcile and manage the President’s office budget

Ensure President is prepared for upcoming appointments by gathering materials necessary for each meeting

Work with senior staff to collect and assemble information for board presentations, special projects and strategic planning

Serve as the first point of contact for a wide variety of high-level relationships between the President and external contacts

Facilitate, build and monitor relationships including tracking contacts in database and managing follow-up

Handle phone, email and postal mail inquiries and respond appropriately

Draft and edit correspondence, articles, reports and presentations; transcribe meeting notes

Create a warm, professional, confidential environment and provide high quality service and assistance to all school community members including administrators, board members, students, parents, teachers, staff, and visitors to the President's office.

Draft and prepare correspondence for internal announcements, board meetings, and organizations that the executive is involved with.

Commitment to excellence - perform duties at the highest level possible on a consistent basis.

Ability to function well in a high-paced environment 






Qualifications: 



Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, preferred

Bilingualism; strong written and verbal skills required in both English and French

Proven experience in an executive office setting; educational office experience preferred

Advanced experience with various software applications

Ability to demonstrate a high level of tact, discretion and diplomacy with all internal and external community members including high level maintenance of confidential/sensitive information

Familiarity and commitment to the Catholic, Jesuit tradition; primarily in an educational context is a strong asset. 





We encourage applicants to apply by March 13, 2022. While we thank all candidates for their interest, only those short-listed will be contacted. 







Send cover letter and CV to Marcelle DeFreitas, President 







http://www.loyola.ca/discover-loyola/employment-opportunities 







Loyola High School will only use and retain personal information for the purpose for which it was collected. Any personal information provided will be maintained in confidence. 





Poste : Adjoint(e) de direction, Bureau de la présidente 


Date d’entrée en service : 2 mai 2022 





À propos du poste : 


L’école secondaire Loyola est à la recherche d’un(e) adjoint(e) de direction chevronné(e) pour réaliser la mission de Loyola en fournissant un soutien efficace et professionnel à la présidente de l'établissement. Cette personne agira avec peu de supervision, en anticipant les besoins tout en gérant le flux de tâches quotidiennes et en priorisant divers projets, y compris la planification, la gestion des relations d’affaires, la préparation de documents pour les réunions et la participation à un large éventail de projets spéciaux. La personne choisie possède une personnalité accueillante et éclairée, axée sur le client, ainsi que toutes les compétences nécessaires pour effectuer, coordonner et superviser les tâches administratives tout en fournissant un appui important à la présidente de l'école. 





Notre Histoire 


Loyola est une école catholique jésuite où les élèves sont encouragés à devenir intellectuellement compétents, ouverts à la croissance, religieux, aimants et engagés envers la justice. École préparatoire à des études supérieures, Loyola s’engage à former la personne dans son ensemble en proposant une expérience éducative complète d'excellence académique, une formation spirituelle et religieuse, et des occasions d'implication communautaire. Dans l’esprit ignacien de soin et de souci de la personne, Loyola aspire à cultiver les talents uniques et divers de chaque membre de sa communauté et encourage l’utilisation de ces talents au service des autres pour une plus grande gloire de Dieu. 





Principaux secteurs de responsabilité : 



Gérer l'emploi du temps de la présidente, y compris la gestion quotidienne et à long terme des réunions, des projets et des priorités.

Coordonner les réunions du Conseil des gouverneurs ainsi que les réunions des comités du Conseil, programmer, organiser et rédiger les procès-verbaux de toutes les réunions.

Planifier toutes les réunions et les déplacements, y compris établir la priorité des réunions et communiquer tous les détails pertinents aux participants.

Concilier les priorités conflictuelles afin de gérer le flux de travail, garantir l'achèvement des projets essentiels et respecter les échéances importantes.

Rapprocher et gérer le budget du Bureau de la présidente.

S'assurer de la préparation de la présidente pour les prochaines réunions en rassemblant les documents nécessaires pour chacune d’elles.

Collaborer avec les membres de la direction pour recueillir et rassembler les renseignements nécessaires pour les présentations au Conseil, les projets spéciaux et la planification stratégique. 

Être le premier contact pour une grande variété de relations de haut niveau entre la présidente et les relations d’affaires externes.

Faciliter, établir et suivre les relations d’affaires, y compris un suivi dans la base de données et la gestion du suivi.

Traiter les demandes de renseignements par téléphone, courriel et courrier postal et y répondre de manière appropriée.

Rédiger et préparer la correspondance, les articles, les rapports et les présentations ; transcrire les notes de réunion.

Créer un cadre chaleureux, professionnel et confidentiel et fournir un service et une aide de grande qualité à tous les membres de la communauté scolaire, notamment les directeurs, les membres du Conseil, les élèves, les parents, les enseignants, le personnel et les visiteurs du Bureau de la présidente.

Rédiger et préparer la correspondance pour les annonces internes, les réunions du Conseil et les organismes dans lesquels la direction oeuvre.

S’engager envers l'excellence – garantir de manière constante la plus grande qualité possible dans l’exécution de ses tâches.

Bien fonctionner dans un environnement en constante évolution. 






Qualifications 
: 


Baccalauréat ou l’équivalent, de préférence

Bilinguisme; fortes compétences écrites et orales requises en anglais et en français.

Expérience reconnue dans un bureau de direction; expérience dans un établissement d'enseignement souhaitée.

Expérience avancée de divers logiciels.

Capacité à faire preuve d'un niveau élevé de tact, de discrétion et de diplomatie envers tous les membres de la collectivité, y compris la protection des renseignements confidentiels/de nature délicate.

Connaissance de la tradition catholique jésuite ainsi qu’un engagement envers celle-ci, principalement dans un contexte éducatif, un atout majeur. 





Nous prions les candidats.tes de postuler avant le 13 mars 2022. Nous remercions tous les candidats(tes) de leur intérêt; toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes sélectionnées. 






Envoyer votre lettre de motivation et votre c.v. à : Marcelle DeFreitas, Présidente 





http://www.loyola.ca/discover-loyola/employment-op 






L’école secondaire Loyola n'utilisera et ne conservera les renseignements personnels qu’aux fins auxquelles ils ont été recueillis. Tout renseignement personnel fourni demeurera confidentiel.

industries: Software Development, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.

At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.



About The Role



We’re looking for a 

Administrative Assistant 

to join our growing team!

We are searching for an experienced Executive Assistant reporting to an IT Director to support the management team at the Director level. This role requires a professional who is collaborative, detail oriented and has the ability to multi-task.

Providing superior support, you will be responsible for a wide range of business administration and general support of a highly confidential nature. You will bring a high level of tact and integrity due to the nature of the work performed, the frequency of internal and external contacts and exposure to confidential information.

Liaising with all functional areas on various business matters, you will implement superior organization and multitasking abilities while ensuring a strong understanding of the organizational structures.



Workplace:

 Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa) or Anjou (7101 Jean-Talon Est)



What You’ll Do Here




Process the creation and reception of PO for employees and SOW.

Oversee the fees for contractual and SOW resources.

Support the arrivals and departure of employees and contractors.

Manage equipment returns and associated costs.

Manage access requests for employees and contractors.

Manage distribution lists for various groups.

Process expense reports for Directors if necessary.

Support Directors and Managers for various purchases (ex : trainings for employees, licence renewals, etc…)

Support with the floor plans and act as a main point of contact with the building resources

Support with meeting room reservations.

Manage the vacation balance for the team.

Plan meetings for the group CPL and claims

Provide support with catering orders for meetings and events.

Support with travel planning arrangements when necessary.

Provide support with translation and editing documents.

Participate in special projects as they arise.




Qualifications




What you bring to the table:



Post-secondary education in a related field.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in a professional work environment as an Administrative Assistant or Project Coordinator.

Fluent bilingualism in English and French is an asset

Superior organization skills and a demonstrated ability to deliver results in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Outstanding interpersonal skills, tact and a proven ability to achieve goals.

Excellent listening and communication skills and the ability to tactfully foster strong working relationships.

Advanced skills in MS Office Suite. Experience with Lotus Notes preferred.

Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.



Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:



An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 

Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career



Flexible Work Arrangements


Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits. Once it’s safe to do so, we will move to a hybrid approach which will give everyone the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. Schedules will be determined in partnership between individuals, managers, and the team.

Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer


If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.


Click here to review other important information about the hiring process
, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality
description:
Description




Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible. 



Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day. 



Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions. 

The vaccine must be a 

two-dose COVID-19 

vaccination series approved by Health Canada

.
 
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.


Reporting to on site Management, the Receptionist will respond to all incoming calls, greet and direct all visitors, answering inquiries in a positive and professional manner, representative of Revera. Key Responsibilities - To answer all incoming calls, and respond to caller's inquiries in a positive, professional manner ; - To redirect calls as appropriate and take clear, concise messages when required; - To greet, assist and direct all visitors; - To pick up and sort internal mail; - To stamp, deliver and maintain mail machine for external mail; - To prepare packages and arrange courier pick up; - To arrange meeting room schedule and bookings; - To update phone and distribution lists; - To maintain a clean, safe, fully stocked and well organized reception area; - To assist with small projects as required by other administrative support (i.e. labels, bulk mailing, etc.); - To complete other duties as assigned; - To uphold and promote the organization's values and philosophy relating particularly to ethics, morality, and integrity as set out in Revera's Code of Conduct. Qualifications - Above average interpersonal, oral and written communication skills; - Previous experience in reception is considered an asset; - Must exhibit professional and polished telephone manner; - Ability to handle multiple tasks at once, work under pressure, and meet deadlines; - Highly organized and detail focused; - Expertise in Microsoft Office ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint, E-Mail)


Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request. 



Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


The opportunity


You’ll join our Enterprise Support Services (ESS) team, helping to support the important business enablement functions that keep our organization running strong. As a driven administrative professional, you will work across teams to provide the knowledge, resources, and tools that help EY deliver exceptional quality service to our clients, win in the marketplace and support EY’s growth and profitability.

The Business Services Group (BSG) Bilingual Administrative Assistant is a trusted advisor to our client-serving managers and senior managers. You are a driven administrative professional who is solution-oriented and responsible for supporting customer requests through our national queue.


Your Key Responsibilities


As a BSG Bilingual Administrative Assistant, you are an active member of BSG supporting customer service asks through our national queue while working in tandem with your colleagues to understand and anticipate customers’ needs and exceed expectations. Your key responsibilities include:


Customer support: 



Engagement support: In-depth knowledge to support the client engagement management process, including tracking and reporting time and expenses as needed

Financial management support: Pivotal role with the engagement teams to provide reports and manage the billing process

Client Relationship Management (CRM): Support EY’s CRM tool

Document preparation & management: Use EY branding standards to create and format documents/presentations

Travel arrangements: Provide travel options, book air and ground travel using our online system, as well as associated logistics

Meeting & event coordination including technology and catering where required




Overtime Required As Needed.



Skills and attributes for success 



Committed to contributing to a strong team culture to ensure success

Ability to effectively meet customer needs, taking responsibility for customer satisfaction

Ability to maintain effectiveness and professionalism when experiencing a change in work tasks and/or the work environment

Ability to work in a fast-paced, team environment and under the pressure of deadlines

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Effective time management and organizational skills

Develop and maintain relationships to efficiently leverage expertise

Sound judgment regarding confidential and sensitive matters

Proven ability to meet multiple and/or unexpected deadlines in a demanding environment

Embraces change and has experience with process redesign

Motivated and driven to continuously improve by learning new skills 




To qualify for the role, you must have 



Post-secondary education and/or equivalent relevant experience 

Proficiency in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, with proven ability to learn customized software/tools

Bilingual in French and English




Ideally, you’ll also have



General understanding of financial principles as they relate to the billing of chargeable time

Professional services firm experience 




What We Offer


We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package allows you to decide which benefits are right for you and which ones help you create a solid foundation for your future. Our Total Rewards package includes a comprehensive medical, prescription drug, and dental coverage, a defined contribution pension plan, a great vacation policy plus firm paid days that allow you to enjoy longer long weekends throughout the year, statutory holidays and paid personal days (based on province of residence), and a range of exciting programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:


Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the industry

Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career

The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you




Diversity and Inclusion at EY


Diversity and inclusiveness are at the heart of who we are and how we work. We’re committed to fostering an environment where differences are valued, policies and practices are equitable, and our people feel a sense of belonging. From our actions to combat systemic racism and our advocacy for the LGBT+ community to our innovative Neurodiversity Centre of Excellence and Accessibility initiatives, we welcome and embrace the diverse experiences, abilities, backgrounds, and perspectives that make our people unique and help guide us. Because when people feel free to be their authentic selves at work, they bring their best and are empowered to build a better working world.


EY Way of Work and your health and safety


EY Way of Work recognizes flexibility in the way we collaborate, innovate and deliver with the ability to work in-person and remotely. To support a healthy and safe in-person working environment, EY has implemented various layers of health and safety controls while working in the office or at clients or other locations. A critical component of EY’s workplace safety program includes our COVID-19 vaccination policy which requires all personnel to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless an accommodation based on a reason protected by human rights legislation is provided.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.



The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.



EY | Building a better working world 


EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.

Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.

Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Chez EY, vous aurez l’occasion de bâtir une carrière aussi unique que vous l’êtes. Et grâce au volet mondial, au soutien, à la culture inclusive et à la technologie, vous pourrez devenir la meilleure version de vous-mêmes. Nous comptons sur votre voix et votre point de vue uniques pour aider EY à devenir encore meilleure également. Joignez-vous à nous et créez une expérience exceptionnelle pour vous-mêmes et un monde meilleur pour tous.


La possibilité


Vous vous joindrez à notre équipe Services de soutien à l’entreprise (SSE) et contribuerez à soutenir les fonctions importantes de facilitation des affaires qui assurent le bon fonctionnement de notre organisation. En tant que professionnel administratif motivé, vous travaillerez auprès de l’ensemble des équipes, fournissant les connaissances, les ressources et les outils nécessaires à EY pour offrir un service à la clientèle exceptionnel, réussir sur le marché et optimiser sa croissance et sa rentabilité.

L’Adjoint(e) administrative bilingue du Groupe de services à l’entreprise (GSE) est un conseiller de confiance pour nos chefs d’équipe et chefs d’équipe seniors de service à la clientèle. Vous êtes un professionnel administratif déterminé et axé sur les solutions qui est responsable de répondre aux demandes se trouvant dans la liste d’attente nationale


Vos principales responsabilités


À titre d’adjoint(e) administrative bilingue au sein du GSE, vous êtes un membre actif du GSE qui offre un soutien aux demandes de clients se trouvant dans la liste d’attente nationale, en plus de travailler en collaboration avec vos collègues afin de comprendre et d’anticiper les besoins des clients et de surpasser leurs attentes. Parmi vos principales responsabilités, mentionnons les suivantes :


Soutien à la clientèle :



Soutien aux mandats : connaissances approfondies pour soutenir le processus de gestion d’un mandat client, y compris le suivi et la présentation de l’information des rapports de temps et de dépenses, au besoin

Soutien à la gestion financière : rôle central auprès des équipes de mandat afin de produire des rapports et de gérer le processus de facturation

Gestion des relations avec les clients (CRM) : soutien de l’outil de gestion des relations avec les clients d’EY

Préparation et gestion de documents : création et formatage de documents et de présentations à partir des normes d’EY sur la marque

Préparatifs de voyage : recherche d’options de déplacement, réservation de voyages par transport aérien et terrestre au moyen de notre outil de réservation en ligne et gestion des aspects logistiques liés aux déplacements

Coordination de réunions et d’événements, y compris les services technologiques et de traiteurs, le cas échéant




Effectuer des heures supplémentaires, au besoin.



Compétences et qualités pour réussir



Être déterminé à favoriser une culture d’équipe forte afin d’assurer le succès

Capacité à répondre efficacement aux besoins des clients, en assumant la responsabilité de la satisfaction des clients

Capacité à maintenir son efficacité et son professionnalisme lorsque s’opère un changement de tâches ou dans le milieu de travail

Capacité à travailler dans un environnement collaboratif où les choses évoluent rapidement et sous la pression des échéances

Excellentes aptitudes en communications écrites et verbales

Aptitudes à gérer et à organiser son temps efficacement

Établir et entretenir des relations afin d’exploiter efficacement nos compétences

Faire preuve d’un bon jugement en ce qui a trait aux questions confidentielles et délicates.

Avoir une capacité éprouvée de respecter des échéances multiples ou imprévues dans un milieu exigeant

Être ouvert au changement et détenir une expérience en refonte des processus

Être motivé par l’envie de constamment s’améliorer en acquérant de nouvelles compétences 




Pour être admissible à ce poste, vous devez avoir :



un diplôme d’études postsecondaires ou de l’expérience professionnelle connexe

une excellente connaissance des logiciels Word, Excel et PowerPoint, et une capacité démontrée pour l’apprentissage de logiciels et d’outils personnalisés

d’excellentes aptitudes en communications verbales et écrites (en français et en anglais)




Idéalement, vous devez aussi avoir :



une compréhension générale des principes financiers ayant trait à la facturation d’heures recouvrables

de l’expérience au sein d’un établissement de services professionnels 




Ce que nous offrons


Nous offrons un programme de rémunération concurrentiel selon lequel vous êtes rémunéré en fonction de votre rendement et qui reconnaît la valeur que vous apportez à l’entreprise. De plus, notre programme de rémunération globale vous permet de déterminer les avantages qui vous conviennent et ceux qui vous aideront à mettre en place des assises solides pour votre avenir. Notre programme de rémunération globale comprend une couverture complète de soins médicaux, de médicaments d’ordonnance et de soins dentaires, un régime de retraite à cotisations définies, une directive en matière de vacances formidable, qui comprend des journées payées par la Société afin que vous profitiez de fins de semaine allongées réparties dans l’année, les jours fériés et des congés personnels payés (en fonction de la province de résidence), ainsi qu’un éventail de programmes et d’avantages intéressants conçus pour votre bien-être physique, financier et social. Vous bénéficierez également :


du soutien et de l’encadrement de certains des collègues les plus inspirants du secteur;

des possibilités d’apprentissage vous permettant d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences et de propulser votre carrière;

de la liberté et de la souplesse dont vous avez besoin pour jouer votre rôle de la manière qui vous convient.




La diversité et l’inclusivité chez EY


La diversité et l’inclusivité sont au cœur de qui nous sommes et de la façon dont nous travaillons. Nous avons pris l’engagement de favoriser un environnement au sein duquel les différences sont appréciées, les directives et les pratiques sont équitables, et où nos gens éprouvent un sentiment d’appartenance. Comme en témoignent les gestes que nous avons posés pour combattre le racisme systémique, notre appui aux membres de la communauté LGBT+ ainsi que des projets novateurs tels que le Centre d’excellence en neurodiversité et nos initiatives en matière d’accessibilité, nous acceptons et saluons la diversité des expériences, des habiletés, des parcours et des perspectives de nos gens, qui les rend uniques et nous aide à évoluer. Parce que nous croyons que c’est en ayant la liberté d’être fidèles à eux-mêmes au travail que nos gens donneront le meilleur d’eux-mêmes et contribueront à bâtir un monde meilleur.


Le code « Le travail chez EY » et votre santé et sécurité


Le code « Le travail chez EY » laisse place à une certaine souplesse dans la façon dont nous collaborons, innovons et assurons la prestation de nos services grâce à notre capacité de travailler en personne et à distance. Afin de favoriser un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire en personne, EY a mis en place divers niveaux de contrôle pour assurer la santé et la sécurité de tous au bureau, chez les clients et ailleurs. L’une des composantes critiques du programme de sécurité en milieu de travail de la Société est notre politique de vaccination contre la COVID-19, qui requiert que tous les membres du personnel soient pleinement vaccinés contre la COVID-19, sauf si des mesures d’adaptation ont été accordées pour des raisons protégées par la législation des droits de la personne.


Si vous pouvez affirmer que vous remplissez les critères susmentionnés, communiquez avec nous dès que possible.



L’expérience exceptionnelle d’EY. Il n’en tient qu’à vous. 



EY | Travailler ensemble pour un monde meilleur 


La raison d’être d’EY est de bâtir un monde meilleur, de créer de la valeur à long terme pour les clients, les gens et la société et de renforcer la confiance à l’égard des marchés financiers.

S’appuyant sur les données et la technologie, les équipes diversifiées d’EY présentes dans plus de 150 pays instaurent la confiance au moyen de la certification, et aident les clients à prospérer, à se transformer et à exercer leurs activités.

Que ce soit dans les services de certification, de consultation, de stratégie, de fiscalité ou de transactions, ou encore, au sein des services juridiques, les équipes d’EY posent de meilleures questions pour trouver de nouvelles réponses aux enjeux complexes du monde d’aujourd’hui.

industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality

description:
CIBC Wood Gundy à Victoriaville recherche un(e) réceptionniste, agent(e) au service à la clientèle pour se joindre à son équipe en pleine expansion. La personne choisie doit être à l'aise avec les ordinateurs, offrir un service à la clientèle courtois et aider l'équipe à différents niveaux.

 


Tâches reliées à ce poste



Répondre au téléphone (transfert d'appels et prise de messages)

Recevoir les visiteurs

Dépouillement du courrier entrant et préparation du courrier sortant

Classement de dossiers

Commande de fournitures pour le bureau

Rédaction de documents et saisie de données

Soutien à l'ouverture et maintien des dossiers clients

Toute autre tâche connexe pouvant être utile à notre équipe


 


Ce que la Banque CIBC vous offre



Salaire concurrentiel

Avantages bancaires

Programme de prestations-maladie

Régime de retraite à prestations déterminées

Régime d’achat d’actions par les employés

Offre d'emploi détaillée
