job_title: Executive Assistant To Chief Executive Officer
industries: Financial Services and Investment Banking
description:
We are seeking an 
Executive Assistant
 to join our team in our downtown Vancouver office as the right hand person to the Chief Executive Officer.




In this integral role you will be primarily supporting the CEO ,with strictly EA related responsibilities and will have the opportunity to get cross trained with other departments.




This unique opportunity is suitable for someone who truly is passionate about the Financial services industry, loves administrative responsibilities, and has strong financial, writing and project coordination skills. You will be expected to commit to completing CSC/CPH and focus on understanding all aspects of the firm’s operations, and be able to assist with coverage for other EA’s when necessary.




Our CEO is looking for an Executive Assistant with a high EQ and smarts that is a great person to work with and is committed to continuous personal & professional development.





Responsibilities






Provide full administrative support

Prepare documentation relating to various corporate matters

Provide assistance with regard to human resources and related duties including

preparing of employment letters, initiating the firm’s Employee performance planning program and alike

Perform financial analysis as required

Coordinate and manage special projects

Scheduling and execution of events, lunches, meetings and corporate events as they arise

Stakeholder management ( internal and external)

Manage and supervise junior staff as required









Requirements






Post secondary education is preferred

High level of proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint;

Flexible and adaptable to a fast paced high pressure environment;

Proven experience as an administrative assistant;

Superior face-to-face, email and telephone etiquette;








Interviews are happening now! for a confidential chat, please send all inquiries to Shiva

at Shiva@aceit.work

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
For more than 20 years Global Relay has set the standard and trends in compliant communications with our multi-award winning unified communications, data capture, and data analysis platform. We securely capture and manage the world’s communications data and give its owners greater control and visibility to drive value and ensure compliance with the regulatory requirements of a large variety of industries and authorities.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits and all the other typical things you expect, but we are not your typical company. Global Relay is a career-making company. It is a place for big ideas, new challenges, and cutting-edge innovation. It is a place where you can make an impact.


Your Role:


Do you love working with customers, have strong problem-solving or troubleshooting skills, and excellent attention to detail? Are you curious in nature, self-motivated, and take pride in your work? Join the Data Services team as an Administrative Assistant!

Data Services specializes in regulatory audit and ediscovery litigation support requests and ensures that historical data from a customer’s legacy solution is migrated into Global Relay Archive. We are currently looking for analytical candidates with solid administrative experience and technical aptitude to join our bright, diligent and dynamic team.

The Administrative Assistant is a customer service role that focuses on requests related to data going in and out of customer archives as well as assisting customers with the management of that data. You will become a subject matter expert in data management and related services (e.g. Data Imports, Data Exports) within financial and compliance-regulated industries.


Your Job:




Provide exceptional first-class assistance while helping customers manage their data within their archive

Perform project coordination and administrative duties such as answering phone and email requests, CRM data entry, and billing

Organize, analyze and validate data, reports and agreements

Escalate urgent customer issues, bugs, and requests (analyzing, summarizing, and proposing plan of action)

Present solutions to our customers' needs based on Global Relay’s policies, procedures and technologies

Must be available for the occasional evening or holiday shift to ensure 7x24x365 department coverage




About You:




Post-secondary education; undergraduate degree or equivalent experience

Minimum of 1 to 2 years of experience in a dynamic office environment desired, but not essential

Previous administration experience with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously desired, but not essential

Excellent attention to detail and ability to work within defined legal policies and procedures

Strong written and verbal communication in English

Excellent time management skills

Prior experience of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel), Salesforce and Confluence(Jira) applications preferred




About Us:


At Global Relay there is no ceiling. This is the land of opportunity for the energetic, intelligent, and driven people that make this company great. The combination of the right people in the right positions and a rapidly growing company means unlimited career potential.

You will receive the mentoring, coaching, and support that you need to reach your personal and career goals. You’ll be part of a culture that promotes and rewards hard work and creativity and will grow into the new opportunities that are available to you.

To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

industries: Primary and Secondary Education
description:
An exciting opportunity exists at School District 43 (Coquitlam) for an Executive Assistant to the Secretary Treasurer/CFO. As the third largest school district in the province, we are located withing a 40-minute drive from downtown Vancouver. The school district has a population of 32,000 students with approximately 4,300 teaching, administrative, managerial and support staff. We serve the communities of Coquitlam, Port Coquitlam, Port Moody, and the villages of Anmore and Belcarra. 

 




Reporting to the Secretary Treasurer/CFO, the Executive Assistant is responsible for providing a variety of complex, and highly confidential specialized administrative and research support to the senior executive and nine members of the Board of Education. As a member of the exempt staff, key responsibilities include a wide range of administrative functions such as leading administrative projects and initiatives, receiving, reviewing, and composing of correspondence; establishing and preparing meeting agendas; prioritizing; calendar management; coordinating internal and external meetings; and attending and acting as recording secretary at regular and confidential meetings of senior staff, various committees and the Board of Education.









Specific Responsibilities




Coordinates and ensures the appropriate management of the office of the Secretary-Treasurer/CFO and Board of Education.

Organizes, prioritizes and delegates secretarial activities in accordance with the current Secretary Treasurer/CFO office procedures, including the training and supervision of secretaries and office assistants. 

Manages the corporate records depository ensuring that all appropriate record retention strategies are in place.

Enhances executives’ effectiveness by managing information and records; representing the Secretary-Treasurer/CFO and the Board to others; supporting all aspects of their roles.

Represents the Secretary Treasurer/CFO on committees relating to District level matters.

Leads administrative initiatives and projects to enhance and progress systems, resources and procedures. 

Serves as the initial point of contact for external parties, including parents and members of the general public and exercises judgement in responding and redirecting matters as appropriate. 

Receives all correspondence for Board of Education Chair, Trustees, and Secretary Treasurer/CFO and determines items/correspondence requiring action and recommend course of action.

Composes and prepares various forms of correspondence as needed, including letters, memos, emails and reports.

Researches, prioritizes and follows up on incoming issues and concerns addressed to the Secretary-Treasurer/CFO and the Board, including those of a sensitive or confidential nature. Determines appropriate course of action, referral or response. 

Assembles draft agendas for open and in-camera meetings and for Board agenda setting meetings. 

Prepares, assembles and arranges for secure distribution of final Board Meeting agendas, supporting documents and digital resources for all public, in-camera and in-service meetings of the Board of Education to Trustees and the District Leadership Team.

Uploads and maintains public board meeting schedules, agendas, minutes of public board meetings and maintain the Board of Education internal site and Secretary Treasurer/CFO departmental information on My43 and District public website.

Attend and record minutes of In-Camera, in-Service and public meetings of the Board of Education; provide and update detailed records/index of all minutes.

Advises the District Leadership Team of upcoming agenda topics for Board meeting agendas and obtain/follow up to receive supporting documents in a timely manner.

Provides confidential executive support for highly sensitive matters lead by other members of the District Leadership Team.

Manages the calendar and schedule of the Secretary Treasurer/CFO.

Schedules and coordinates meetings between Trustees and District officials, senior municipal staff and elected municipal councilors, MLA’s, Ministry staff, and BCSTA.

Registers and makes travel arrangements for attendance at local, national and international meetings and conference and school district events for trustees and senior management.

Accurately processes/reconciles payment of invoices/statements to ensure the correct information is provided to the accounting department for reporting of accurate monthly and year-end financial statements.

Establishes protocols and solutions to ensure smooth communications between the Trustees, members of the District Leadership Team and internal departments; demonstrating leadership to maintain credibility, trust, and professionalism.

Other related duties as assigned.










Required Knowledge and Abilities




Demonstrated professionalism combined with keen judgement and a resolution-based approach.

Ability to record meeting minutes in a formal setting and ability to adhere to Roberts Rules of Order.

Requires strong computer and research skills, and proficiency with Microsoft Office.

Ability to act independently with strong discretion and decision-making skills.

Knowledgeable of the role of elected officials and related governing rules and regulations.

Ability to organize and plan a variety of diverse tasks.

Proven writing and document composition skills. 

Strong interpersonal, influence and verbal communication skills.

Demonstrated professional disposition with a high degree of integrity and knowledge of protocol.

Ability to work under pressure with minimum supervision, showing initiative and flexibility. 

Experience exercising discretion and confidentiality with sensitive organizational matters.

Ability to establish and maintain positive relations with elected and senior officials, members of the general public, employees and senior administration.

Ability to interact with tact and diplomacy in a politically sensitive environment

Ability to attend evening meetings on a regular basis.










Required Education and Experience




Five to seven years of relative experience supporting senior executives in an educational or comparable public sector environment.

Completion of Grade 12 supplemented by two years post-secondary education in business or office management or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Previous supervisory experience preferred. 

Previous experience recording meeting minutes in a formal public setting and an understanding of Roberts Rules of Order.








A competitive salary is offered along with a generous benefits package. The successful applicant will be required to successfully complete two criminal record checks. 

 




Please apply 

by 4:00 pm on Friday, March 25, 2022
 
at https://bit.ly/3hQDTKI. 


Applications will be reviewed as received. We appreciate your interest but regret that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.



 




 



“The deliberations of employees, and Committees used to screen and consider job applications, shall be kept in strict confidence, and shall not be disclosed to any person except as required by law. Personal references, recommendations and evaluations collected or generated by Board employees and Committee members as part of the Board’s hiring processes (other than references whose authorship and content is already known to the job applicant) shall be treated as having been supplied in confidence to the Board for the purposes of the 
Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act
.”

Department:
 Facilities and Asset Management


Job Type:
 Limited Term


Full-time/Part-time:
 Full Time (>=1249 hrs/year)


Campus:
 Waterloo


Reports to: 
Manager, Strategic Projects and Executive Support


Employee Group:
 WLUSA


Application Deadline:
 March 15, 2022


Requisition ID: 
3142




Wilfrid Laurier University is a leading multi-campus university that excels at educating with purpose. Through its exceptional employees, students, researchers, leaders, and educators, Laurier has built a reputation as a world-class institution known for its rich student experience, academic excellence, and global impact. With a commitment to Indigenization and commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion, Laurier’s thriving community has a place for everyone.







Laurier has more than 19,000 students and 2,100 faculty and staff across campuses in Waterloo and Brantford, as well as a location in Kitchener. The university is committed to providing an inclusive workplace and employing a workforce that is reflective of local and national demographics. Our locations are situated on the traditional territories of the Neutral, Anishnawbe, and Haudenosaunee peoples. We recognize the unique heritages of Indigenous peoples and support their intentions to preserve and express their distinctive Indigenous cultures, histories, and knowledge through academic programming and co-curricular activities. Laurier’s Centre for Indigegogy is one example of how Laurier honours Indigenous knowledge.














Position Summary:





Reporting to the Manager, Strategic Projects and Executive Support, the Coordinator, Administration and Project Support, is responsible for writing, designing, researching, editing and compiling high-impact, compelling and professional briefings, reports and presentations for the Facilities and Asset Management department as assigned by the Manager. Included in this position is developing and maintaining content on department websites, coordinating executive support needs for Planning, Design and Construction, Parking and Transportation Resources, the Sustainability Office, and Real Estate, researching, synthesizing and analyzing data (both technical and financial) to contribute to reports and presentations and preparing the department annual report.







This position will be an exciting opportunity for those with strong writing and communication skills who can adhere to strict deadlines and coordinate multiple projects. The nature of the job requires knowledge of the University organization, attention to detail, organization, problem solving, accuracy and time management skills. The incumbent must be able to handle a variety of tasks simultaneously, establish priorities, collaborate with others within the department, institution and external to the University and work independently with a minimum of supervision. The incumbent must be able to work with interruptions to work flow that create changes in priorities.







This position has a university-wide mandate and is based at the Waterloo Campus. The incumbent provides subject matter expertise to all campuses, requiring regular interpersonal interactions and collaboration with departments at the Waterloo Campus, the Brantford Campus, the Kitchener location, the Milton location and external partners. Special attention is given to ensure equitable service delivery across all locations.








Accountabilities: 






Administrative Support






Consults with Planning, Design and Construction, Parking and Transportation Resources, the Sustainability Office, Real Estate and Business and Facilities Operations on executive support needs including reports, briefings, and presentations, in consultation with the Manager.

Coordinates the booking of meetings for project teams, working groups and committees led by the Manager, as assigned.

Prepares agendas, collects meeting materials and takes minutes for committees and working groups the Manager is responsible for leading.

Leads the coordination of on and off campus retreats/workshops for the department, compiling materials and arranging for guest speakers and resource people as required.

Develops and designs website content for the department's internet presence, in consultation with the Manager.

Maintains and updates content on department websites in consultation with the department management team.

Supports the Administrative Assistant, when required, with receiving, reviewing and finalizing all facilities notices for Planning, Design and Construction, including sending emails via the FacilitiesAnnouncements email account to the Laurier community, monitoring this email account and posting said notices to public website following accessibility and Laurier brand standards.






Data Collection and Analysis






Consults with the department management team to research, synthesize and analyze data, both technical and financial, in order to contribute accurate content to reports and presentations.

Identifies, collects, maintains and analyzes key performance indicators (KPIs) for all units in the department.






Reports and Presentations






Write, design, edit, research and compile high-impact, compelling and professional briefings, reports and presentations as assigned by the Manager.

Coordinates the development of various annual and risk reports, both in terms of design and in consultation with other contributors to develop content, with a keen eye towards representing departmental performance effectively.

Coordinates governance process submissions for the department working with the management team and in consultation with the Manager.

Consult with department management team to prepare legislative compliance reports and government reports when and if required.






Project Support






Research, review and collect relevant documents and resources for department projects.

Provides support on strategic projects, including the Milton Campus, as assigned by the Manager.









Qualifications



University degree in marketing/communications, business administration or related field, together with two years of related experience in senior administrative support and report/proposal writing in post-secondary, government or professional service environment.

Demonstrates strong writing skills.

Excellent computer skills, including superior knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and experience with graphics packages.

Ability to work collaboratively with all team members to deliver excellent results with accuracy and integrity.

Create professional and persuasive reports and presentations with high impact design.

Focused, detail-oriented, results driven and able to work under pressure.

Experience designing and maintaining web content.

Dependable, positive attitude, innovative thinker.

Strong sense of accountability.

Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal).

Strong ability to learn, understand and describe technical concepts.

Experience taking minutes.

Proven ability to work independently, and to problem solve to make sound decisions with strong diplomacy skills.

Strong ability to shift gears frequently due to multiple demands and frequent interruptions.

Ability to protect and maintain information in strict confidence.

Strong attention to detail.

industries: Construction, Civil Engineering, and Oil and Gas
description:
Requisition ID: 
140358
 



Job Level: 
Entry Level
 



Department: 
Communications
 



Market: 
Corporate Home Office
 



Employment Type: 
Full Time
 


Position Overview

Kiewit requires the services of a dynamic and versatile administrative assistant for its Laval, Quebec office. The ideal candidate will support the team in a variety of administrative support tasks. The Administrative Assistant must be resourceful and support the department in providing management support, be familiar with software, tools and programs used in the industry, as well as best practices in the field.

District Overview

Kiewit is a multi-service consulting and engineering firm serving the infrastructure and engineering markets. Our team of more than 1,200 engineers and design professionals has expertise in all major engineering disciplines, serving the transportation, power, water and wastewater, mining, construction, oil and gas and chemical markets. With 130 years of construction experience, our construction-focused engineering teams emphasize constructability and safety at the earliest stages of projects to ensure delivery at the best possible value.


Location


This position is based out of Kiewit's Laval, Quebec office.


Responsibilities



Provide administrative support to the Department management team in a timely and efficient manner

Support the projects team

Support the administrative support team already in place

Organize and coordinate meetings, including agendas, invitations, reservations, preparation of all required meeting items (rooms, office supplies, meals, etc.) for both in and out of office meetings

Keep up-to-date contact lists and calendars, using Outlook, for multiple team members

Organize and coordinate travel schedules, reservations, and complete expense reports

Keep various databases, reports and templates up to date

Be and stay current with industry and company software and technology

Organize and attend some conference calls

Make prints and copies, and ensure distribution

Greet visitors in a courteous manner and ensure that they are introduced to the right people at the reception desk

Assist managers with onboarding new employees, ordering materials and pre-hire follow-ups

Assist managers in the planning and organization of activities. 




Qualifications



Highly resourceful and able to complete tasks quickly

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and French

Excellent organizational and time management skills 

Ability to multi-task and manage priorities

Attention to detail and excellent analytical skills

Very good ability to work in a team environment, with different people and in different groups




Additional Requirements:



Absent an approved exemption, due to federal, state, local, provincial and/or client-requirements, this position 
requires an individual to be fully vaccinated by a Health Canada-approved or authorized COVID-19 vaccine upon hire and as a condition of continued employment.


We believe in equal opportunity in employment practices without discrimination and comply with all laws regarding human rights in the provinces where we operate.

L’équipe du Sentier des cimes Laurentides, nouvelle destination écotouristique d’envergure qui accueillera ses premiers visiteurs en début d’été à Mont-Blanc, recherche dès maintenant un ou une :






ADJOINT ADMINISTRATIF / ADJOINTE ADMINISTRATIVE






Un emploi en pleine nature au sein d’une entreprise durable, construite sur le respect de l’environnement et de l’humain.






Vos avantages :


·    Environnement de travail exceptionnel sur un site patrimonial

·    Mission diversifiée et stimulante, plaisir est rendez-vous

·    Formation continue, assurances collectives, régime de retraite, uniforme de qualité, programme de reconnaissance, rabais (restaurant et site)





En collaboration avec la direction, vous assurerez différentes tâches administratives nécessaires au bon fonctionnement des activités de l’entreprise. Avec vous, l’équipe de travail sera soutenue et bien outillée pour assurer le succès du magnifique projet du Sentier des cimes Laurentides. 






Vos responsabilités :


·    Rédiger différents types de documents

·    Coordonner la sécurité des données et l’archivage

·    Collaborer avec la firme comptable et les partenaires

·    Effectuer la gestion des fournitures et équipements de bureau

·    Accueillir les invités de la direction et coordonner les rencontres

·    Collaborer au recrutement du personnel et aux communications internes





Votre profil :


·    DEP en secrétariat ou expérience équivalente

·    2 à 3 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire

·    Maîtrise de la suite Office

·    Excellente maîtrise du français écrit

·    Bilinguisme (français et anglais) ; connaissance de l’allemand (un atout)

·    Sens du jugement, autonomie, débrouillardise

·    Sens de l’organisation et polyvalence

·    Sens des responsabilités

·    Communication, relations interpersonnelles, entregent


 



Nous serons très heureux de recevoir votre candidature à RH@sentierdescimes.ca. Pour tout renseignement : 873 229-0363.

industries: Financial Services and Government Administration
description:
Finance


The Department of Finance has the mandate to provide leadership and direction to the public service in all areas of finance and human resource management. This mandate includes negotiating major financial arrangements with the federal government, providing analysis and advice to the Financial Management Board, and ensuring that financial and information resources are managed effectively, efficiently and economically. This mandate also includes the recruitment and retention of a competent public service that is representative of the people it serves and the development of programs and services that effectively serve the human resource needs of the public service.





Education/Experience Required:


Certification in office administration (one year) and one year directly related experience that includes word processing, spreadsheets, database and records management; 


OR


Completion of Grade 12 and at least two years of directly related experience in office administration that includes word processing, spreadsheets, databases and records management.





Salary Information


The salary for this position starts at $33.70 per hour (approximately $65,715 per annum) plus an annual Northern Allowance of $3,700.





Job Information


You, the Office Administrator is located in Yellowknife and reports directly to the Assistant Comptroller General, Reporting, Treasury and Risk Management but also supports the Internal Audit Bureau and Enterprise Resource Planning, providing a critical role in the operation of these divisions through:

- Direct administrative support to the directors and staff;

- Corporate credit card administration;

- Property Tax Arrears Program monitoring and follow up;

- Back-up support to the Directorate and other divisions as required




Competition reference: 21690

Closing Date: 
March 21, 2022

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services
description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com



Job Description




What you'll be doing


CIBC’s Wood Gundy team is the full-service brokerage division of CIBC serving our high net worth clientele. As an Administrative Assistant you will be responsible for providing administrative support to the Investment Advisor team in our Wood Gundy brokerage. You’ll work closely with the team of Advisors as they plan and manage client investments. You’ll play a key part in supporting and servicing high net worth client accounts. You’ll provide ongoing support to a team that goes above and beyond for their clients. This position is a great opportunity to learn the investment business in a professional, dynamic work environment with one of Canada's leading Brokerage.



How You'll Succeed




Administrative Support - Maintain compliance standards in client dealings/client files. Conduct administrative activities and engage in administrative processes associated with supporting the IA(s) and teams. Engage in all marketing and business development activities and assist in the development of investment plans and written proposals for prospects and clients. As determined by the IA, assist in processes to direct assets into suitable financial products based on the client’s risk reward tolerances and demographic profile.

Client Engagement - Connect on a personal level to make every interaction meaningful. Enhance relationships by collaborating with your team and providing administrative support to ensure client needs are met. Respond to requests by answering questions and providing an exceptional experience.

Relationship Building - Heighten CIBC brand awareness in your community by attending local events and participating in marketing and outreach activities. Grow your network to create lasting connections that will generate future opportunities. Work closely with your team to connect clients with the right opportunities.

Organizational Skills - Support Investment Advisors by providing timely responses to client requests and maintaining compliance standards in all files. Enable team success by improving team productivity, proactively uncovering business opportunities, and helping to direct assets into the right financial products.




Who You Are




You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.

You engage with your heart and mind. You care about people and understand different perspectives. You listen and learn from the experiences of others.

You understand that success is in the details. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

You’re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partner. You build trust through respect and authenticity.

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.




What CIBC Offers



At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.


 We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program 

 Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients 

 We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development 




What You Need To Know




 CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com 

 You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit 

 CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation. 



Job Location


Toronto-181 Bay St. 6th


Employment Type


Temporary (Fixed Term)


Weekly Hours


37.5

Vous aimez les animaux et les défis? Vous aimez avoir des tâches stimulantes et diversifiées? Vous cherchez une entreprise qui mesure votre importance et s'adapte à votre mode de vie? 




Nous sommes une entreprise située à Varennes qui produit des suppléments alimentaires dont la fonction est d’améliorer la santé des animaux de ferme et domestique. L’entreprise utilise uniquement des produits naturels afin de réduire l’utilisation de médicaments conventionnels.





Durée 
: Permanant


Horaire :
 40 h/semaine, 8h00 à 16h00, du lundi au vendredi


Salaire :
 À partir de 23$/h selon l’expérience


Avantages sociaux
 : 4 semaines de vacances (2 l’hiver, 2 l’été), formations continues





Description du poste :





L’adjoint(e) administratif(ve) ou adjoint(e) de direction devra effectuer diverses tâches liées l’administration. Il/elle devra assister la direction dans son travail. Il/elle devra aussi entretenir des liens avec les clients et les fournisseurs. 





Principales tâches :






Prendre les commandes des clients et les transmettre à la production

Préparer les documents de livraison pour les commandes

Planifier les expéditions et le transport

Passer des commandes de matières premières et autres fournitures

Assister la direction dans leurs tâches, selon le besoin

Répondre au téléphone et prendre les messages

Classer les factures des fournisseurs et des clients

Classer les échantillons de produits

Imprimer et coller des étiquettes en appui à la production lorsque nécessaire

Participer à des évènements en lien avec les animaux pour promouvoir les produits (ex. : congrès, courses de chiens/chevaux, festivals, etc.)

Accounts Receivable / Administrative Assistant

Must be bilingual. 

• Posting and processing accounts of incoming payments and all follow up paper work, including mailing out receipts and license and collate majority payments with receipts, scanning of documents 

• Preparing and coordinate deposits activities 

• Provide support and accounting information to accountants 

• Preparing billing of (app 8000) 

• Issuing of reminder invoicing notices 

• Responsible in removal of unpaid membership fees 

• Maintain accounting database 

• Customer relations via phone, email or in person 

• Preparing professional correspondence 

• Verify discrepancies and resolving members queries

• Data Entry and management

• File and records management (scanning) 

• Preparing month end reports 

• Secures information by completing data base backups. 

• Maintains members confidence by keeping information confidential

• General Office duties

• Bilingual Administrative and Executive Support 

• Responsible Petty Cash 

• Represent CANB at meeting and trade shows 

• Job responsibilities may vary

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services
description:
Chez EY, vous aurez l’occasion de bâtir une carrière aussi unique que vous l’êtes. Et grâce au volet mondial, au soutien, à la culture inclusive et à la technologie, vous pourrez devenir la meilleure version de vous-mêmes. Nous comptons sur votre voix et votre point de vue uniques pour aider EY à devenir encore meilleure également. Joignez-vous à nous et créez une expérience exceptionnelle pour vous-mêmes et un monde meilleur pour tous.


La possibilité


Vous vous joindrez à notre équipe Services de soutien à l’entreprise (SSE) et contribuerez à soutenir les fonctions importantes de facilitation des affaires qui assurent le bon fonctionnement de notre organisation. En tant que professionnel administratif motivé, vous travaillerez auprès de l’ensemble des équipes, fournissant les connaissances, les ressources et les outils nécessaires à EY pour offrir un service à la clientèle exceptionnel, réussir sur le marché et optimiser sa croissance et sa rentabilité.

L’Adjoint(e) administrative bilingue du Groupe de services à l’entreprise (GSE) est un conseiller de confiance pour nos chefs d’équipe et chefs d’équipe seniors de service à la clientèle. Vous êtes un professionnel administratif déterminé et axé sur les solutions qui est responsable de répondre aux demandes se trouvant dans la liste d’attente nationale


Vos principales responsabilités


À titre d’adjoint(e) administrative bilingue au sein du GSE, vous êtes un membre actif du GSE qui offre un soutien aux demandes de clients se trouvant dans la liste d’attente nationale, en plus de travailler en collaboration avec vos collègues afin de comprendre et d’anticiper les besoins des clients et de surpasser leurs attentes. Parmi vos principales responsabilités, mentionnons les suivantes :


Soutien à la clientèle :



Soutien aux mandats : connaissances approfondies pour soutenir le processus de gestion d’un mandat client, y compris le suivi et la présentation de l’information des rapports de temps et de dépenses, au besoin

Soutien à la gestion financière : rôle central auprès des équipes de mandat afin de produire des rapports et de gérer le processus de facturation

Gestion des relations avec les clients (CRM) : soutien de l’outil de gestion des relations avec les clients d’EY

Préparation et gestion de documents : création et formatage de documents et de présentations à partir des normes d’EY sur la marque

Préparatifs de voyage : recherche d’options de déplacement, réservation de voyages par transport aérien et terrestre au moyen de notre outil de réservation en ligne et gestion des aspects logistiques liés aux déplacements

Coordination de réunions et d’événements, y compris les services technologiques et de traiteurs, le cas échéant




Effectuer des heures supplémentaires, au besoin.



Compétences et qualités pour réussir



Être déterminé à favoriser une culture d’équipe forte afin d’assurer le succès

Capacité à répondre efficacement aux besoins des clients, en assumant la responsabilité de la satisfaction des clients

Capacité à maintenir son efficacité et son professionnalisme lorsque s’opère un changement de tâches ou dans le milieu de travail

Capacité à travailler dans un environnement collaboratif où les choses évoluent rapidement et sous la pression des échéances

Excellentes aptitudes en communications écrites et verbales

Aptitudes à gérer et à organiser son temps efficacement

Établir et entretenir des relations afin d’exploiter efficacement nos compétences

Faire preuve d’un bon jugement en ce qui a trait aux questions confidentielles et délicates.

Avoir une capacité éprouvée de respecter des échéances multiples ou imprévues dans un milieu exigeant

Être ouvert au changement et détenir une expérience en refonte des processus

Être motivé par l’envie de constamment s’améliorer en acquérant de nouvelles compétences 




Pour être admissible à ce poste, vous devez avoir :



un diplôme d’études postsecondaires ou de l’expérience professionnelle connexe

une excellente connaissance des logiciels Word, Excel et PowerPoint, et une capacité démontrée pour l’apprentissage de logiciels et d’outils personnalisés

d’excellentes aptitudes en communications verbales et écrites (en français et en anglais)




Idéalement, vous devez aussi avoir :



une compréhension générale des principes financiers ayant trait à la facturation d’heures recouvrables

de l’expérience au sein d’un établissement de services professionnels 




Ce que nous offrons


Nous offrons un programme de rémunération concurrentiel selon lequel vous êtes rémunéré en fonction de votre rendement et qui reconnaît la valeur que vous apportez à l’entreprise. De plus, notre programme de rémunération globale vous permet de déterminer les avantages qui vous conviennent et ceux qui vous aideront à mettre en place des assises solides pour votre avenir. Notre programme de rémunération globale comprend une couverture complète de soins médicaux, de médicaments d’ordonnance et de soins dentaires, un régime de retraite à cotisations définies, une directive en matière de vacances formidable, qui comprend des journées payées par la Société afin que vous profitiez de fins de semaine allongées réparties dans l’année, les jours fériés et des congés personnels payés (en fonction de la province de résidence), ainsi qu’un éventail de programmes et d’avantages intéressants conçus pour votre bien-être physique, financier et social. Vous bénéficierez également :


du soutien et de l’encadrement de certains des collègues les plus inspirants du secteur;

des possibilités d’apprentissage vous permettant d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences et de propulser votre carrière;

de la liberté et de la souplesse dont vous avez besoin pour jouer votre rôle de la manière qui vous convient.




La diversité et l’inclusivité chez EY


La diversité et l’inclusivité sont au cœur de qui nous sommes et de la façon dont nous travaillons. Nous avons pris l’engagement de favoriser un environnement au sein duquel les différences sont appréciées, les directives et les pratiques sont équitables, et où nos gens éprouvent un sentiment d’appartenance. Comme en témoignent les gestes que nous avons posés pour combattre le racisme systémique, notre appui aux membres de la communauté LGBT+ ainsi que des projets novateurs tels que le Centre d’excellence en neurodiversité et nos initiatives en matière d’accessibilité, nous acceptons et saluons la diversité des expériences, des habiletés, des parcours et des perspectives de nos gens, qui les rend uniques et nous aide à évoluer. Parce que nous croyons que c’est en ayant la liberté d’être fidèles à eux-mêmes au travail que nos gens donneront le meilleur d’eux-mêmes et contribueront à bâtir un monde meilleur.


Le code « Le travail chez EY » et votre santé et sécurité


Le code « Le travail chez EY » laisse place à une certaine souplesse dans la façon dont nous collaborons, innovons et assurons la prestation de nos services grâce à notre capacité de travailler en personne et à distance. Afin de favoriser un environnement de travail sain et sécuritaire en personne, EY a mis en place divers niveaux de contrôle pour assurer la santé et la sécurité de tous au bureau, chez les clients et ailleurs. L’une des composantes critiques du programme de sécurité en milieu de travail de la Société est notre politique de vaccination contre la COVID-19, qui requiert que tous les membres du personnel soient pleinement vaccinés contre la COVID-19, sauf si des mesures d’adaptation ont été accordées pour des raisons protégées par la législation des droits de la personne.


Si vous pouvez affirmer que vous remplissez les critères susmentionnés, communiquez avec nous dès que possible.



L’expérience exceptionnelle d’EY. Il n’en tient qu’à vous. 



EY | Travailler ensemble pour un monde meilleur 


La raison d’être d’EY est de bâtir un monde meilleur, de créer de la valeur à long terme pour les clients, les gens et la société et de renforcer la confiance à l’égard des marchés financiers.

S’appuyant sur les données et la technologie, les équipes diversifiées d’EY présentes dans plus de 150 pays instaurent la confiance au moyen de la certification, et aident les clients à prospérer, à se transformer et à exercer leurs activités.

Que ce soit dans les services de certification, de consultation, de stratégie, de fiscalité ou de transactions, ou encore, au sein des services juridiques, les équipes d’EY posent de meilleures questions pour trouver de nouvelles réponses aux enjeux complexes du monde d’aujourd’hui.

industries: Software Development, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.

At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.



About The Role



We’re looking for a 

Administrative Assistant 

to join our growing team!

We are searching for an experienced Executive Assistant reporting to an IT Director to support the management team at the Director level. This role requires a professional who is collaborative, detail oriented and has the ability to multi-task.

Providing superior support, you will be responsible for a wide range of business administration and general support of a highly confidential nature. You will bring a high level of tact and integrity due to the nature of the work performed, the frequency of internal and external contacts and exposure to confidential information.

Liaising with all functional areas on various business matters, you will implement superior organization and multitasking abilities while ensuring a strong understanding of the organizational structures.



Workplace:

 Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa) or Anjou (7101 Jean-Talon Est)



What You’ll Do Here




Process the creation and reception of PO for employees and SOW.

Oversee the fees for contractual and SOW resources.

Support the arrivals and departure of employees and contractors.

Manage equipment returns and associated costs.

Manage access requests for employees and contractors.

Manage distribution lists for various groups.

Process expense reports for Directors if necessary.

Support Directors and Managers for various purchases (ex : trainings for employees, licence renewals, etc…)

Support with the floor plans and act as a main point of contact with the building resources

Support with meeting room reservations.

Manage the vacation balance for the team.

Plan meetings for the group CPL and claims

Provide support with catering orders for meetings and events.

Support with travel planning arrangements when necessary.

Provide support with translation and editing documents.

Participate in special projects as they arise.




Qualifications




What you bring to the table:



Post-secondary education in a related field.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in a professional work environment as an Administrative Assistant or Project Coordinator.

Fluent bilingualism in English and French is an asset

Superior organization skills and a demonstrated ability to deliver results in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

Outstanding interpersonal skills, tact and a proven ability to achieve goals.

Excellent listening and communication skills and the ability to tactfully foster strong working relationships.

Advanced skills in MS Office Suite. Experience with Lotus Notes preferred.

Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and deadlines.



Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:



An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 

Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career



Flexible Work Arrangements


Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits. Once it’s safe to do so, we will move to a hybrid approach which will give everyone the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays. Schedules will be determined in partnership between individuals, managers, and the team.

Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer


If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.


Click here to review other important information about the hiring process
, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.

description:
Coast Aggregates, A Division of Lafarge Canada Inc. is looking for an 
Administrative Assistant
 for our Squamish location. Coast Aggregates sell top quality construction aggregates, sand, decorative rock and organic top soil throughout the Sea to Sky Corridor.  We work in a fast paced office environment with a busy Landscape Depot.  This role will primarily involve ticketing and processing payments for our Landscape Depot pickup customers, booking delivery orders and answering any general inquiries. You must thrive in a busy environment, enjoy dealing with customers and helping out the rest of the team when needed.  




 





To apply, please send your resume to Marika at marika.maki@lafarge.com. Include the job title in your subject line.





 





Assist all Landscape Depot pick-up customers (both on the phone and in person) in a professional and courteous manner 



Remotely ticket aggregate products 



Book Landscape Depot delivery orders for customers



Communicate with Landscape Depot yard staff (via company radio)



Answer telephones and respond to, or direct inquiries



Receive and distribute packages



Check in/out Visitors



Scan, file & save documents



Data entry



 




Training and Experience: 





Previous reception, administrative, or Customer Service experience required (minimum 6 months)




 




Skills: 






Excellent computer skills. With good working knowledge of Word, Excel



Experience with G-Suite products is an asset (Gmail, Google Sheets etc)



Must have excellent telephone manner



Good organizational and time management skills 



Ability to maintain a professional demeanour at all times 



Professional attitude and willingness to assist customers and coworkers
 



This position is a full time hourly position with hours of 8am to 4pm Monday to Friday. Pay is dependent on experience.




 







As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality

description:
Summary



To provide prompt and superior customer service at the retail postal outlet.



Duties & Responsibilities



Customer ServiceProvides superior and efficient customer service

Answers enquiries and resolves customer complaints regarding postal services

Ability to upsell and recommend postal services and promotions to all customers

Loss Prevention

Ensures loss prevention systems and procedures are performed according to guidelines

Controls cash, money order, and stamp inventory in accordance with prescribed cash handling policies and procedures

Maintains proper security of cash and mail

Operations

Assists in maintaining and controlling the inventory of stamps, money orders, registered mail, etc. in compliance with the policies and procedures of Shoppers Drug Mart and Canada Post Corporation


 Maintains and controls the cash register in the department in compliance with policies and procedures General Complies with all health and safety regulations Complies with all store policies and procedures Complies with loss prevention policies and procedures and ensures they are executed in the department




Qualifications



Perform other duties as required including Cash duties

Planning, Judgement and Decision Making

Problem solving to ensure customer satisfaction

Plan work to maximize efficiency and minimize costs

Troubleshoot cash and tally differences

Experience with registration and postal authorization issues



Experience



Customer service oriented

Effective verbal and written communication skills

Computer literate

Register Skills

Organized and detailed oriented

Efficient time management skills

Ability to work in a fast pace environment

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

WORKING CONDITIONS

Ability to work flexible shifts which may include nights and weekends



Physical Requirements

Ability to climb ladder

The above statement reflects the general details considered necessary to describe the principal functions and duties as required for proper evaluation of the job and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the job.

industries: Utilities
description:
Nova Scotia Power’s greatest source of energy is our people. In a culture focused on safety, we are committed to providing exceptional service to our customers and rewarding jobs to our employees. We are hiring solution-minded people excited to help us grow into the future. We are currently looking to fill the position of 
 Administrative Assistant III (term). 



 Accountabilities: 
 You will provide administrative support to the Lingan Generating Station team. The ideal candidate will have initiative, an appreciation for confidentiality, a strong work ethic and a dedication to quality. You will be required to perform at a high level of competency and independence. You will be responsible for interacting with staff, accountable for sorting mail, tracking/reporting/follow up on current programs and metrics, word processing, maintaining bulletin boards and organizing our safety program, filing, and ordering office supplies. You will process payroll, invoices, requisitions, purchase orders. In addition, you will prepare monthly reports, and other general administrative support duties.

You will be responsible for personal safety, that of coworkers, and those under your direction by observing and ensuring compliance with all Occupational Health and Safety Rules and Regulations. You will be accountable for environmental performance as it relates to the environmental management system processes and initiatives.


 Skills, Capabilities and Experience: 
 You have a grade XII education or equivalent, office administration training, and three to five years of related administrative experience. You have effective communication and organizational skills. You are a self-starter who has the willingness and ability to learn new processes and will become competent in the applications required for this position. You have strong analytical and quantitative skills and are attentive to detail. You are a team player and possess strong interpersonal skills. You have a sound knowledge of current office procedures and possess proficient typing and computer utilization skills. You have a good working knowledge of various software packages (i.e. Word, Excel, MS Project, and Oracle). Accounting and/or knowledge of statistics would be a definite asset. You must demonstrate your commitment to personal development.

At Nova Scotia Power, our employees are our greatest strength. Our Leadership Competencies set standards that advance our business strategy, deliver results for customers, and provide career development for employees. As the ideal candidate for this position you speak up on health, safety, and environment issues, and demonstrate a belief that all injuries are preventable. You support flexibility in the workplace and embrace change. As an Administrative Assistant III you will build strong collaborative relationships with a commitment to a respectful, inclusive, and productive work environment while demonstrating integrity and a commitment to operational excellence for our customers. Lastly, we encourage you to proactively ask questions and seek information to understand how your work relates to the business goals and make well informed decisions.


 Reports to: 
 Senior Plant Manager


 Form of Application: 
 Click the APPLY button at the end of the online job posting. Complete all required information fields and copy and paste your covering letter and resume into the online form.


 Salary: 
 Commensurate with qualifications and experience.


 Must Be Received By: 
 All interested candidates should apply no later than March 21, 2022.

Late applications may not receive consideration.


 Recruitment and Promotion Policy: 
 When filling vacant positions, we are determined to hire the best candidates available. We are committed to providing employees with a fair and equal opportunity to compete for jobs. Hiring and promotion of employees is based on skills, capabilities, knowledge and demonstrated abilities.

In accordance with Emera’s occupational health and safety program and the Emera Vaccine Program, subject to any approved accommodation, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For clarity, “fully vaccinated” means 14 days since having the number of doses or combination of doses of a vaccine approved by Health Canada or local public health agencies in the jurisdiction in which they will be employed.

At Emera we value diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including persons who identify as racially visible, Indigenous, persons with disabilities, women in underrepresented roles and members of the LGBTQ+ community. Applicants from these equity groups may self-identify through the on-line application process. Emera supports candidates and employees with access and accommodation needs.

If you are selected for an interview and require a specific accommodation, please advise our Talent Acquisition team and we will support you with the recruitment process.

Share

industries: Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality

job_title: Executive Assistant To Chief Executive Officer
description:
Who we are:


FloodMapp is a rapidly growing venture backed technology company looking to expand our team to scale our product across Australia and the North America.




Flooding is the costliest natural disaster, causing billions in damage and taking thousands of lives across the globe every single year. FloodMapp offers real-time flood forecasting and mapping using cutting edge technology. We work with large organizations across the public and private sector to improve safety and prevent damage in the event of flooding.  




At FloodMapp, people are our main focus, because hard problems require an exceptional team. As a diverse team, we value empathy, integrity, accountability and communication. Everyone learns from each other. Everyone is passionate about solving a growing global problem. We all work to build a safer future. 





The Role:


This role is for someone who excels at keeping people organized. Someone that likes to get things done, no matter what the obstacles are. If you identify with the following, this role may be just right for you:

●	You have impeccable time management skills and love being two steps ahead.

●	You have initiative and are known for thinking outside the box.

●	You are tech savvy and want to work in a fast paced, growing, highly dynamic startup environment.

●	You have exceptional communication and client relationship skills, with a high level of discretion and sensitivity when dealing with sensitive matters. 

●	You get a great sense of joy from checking things off your to-do list.

●	You love learning, and having a go at new things.

●	You’re able to problem solve and work autonomously when tackling things you haven’t done before.

●	You have an ownership attitude. You’re autonomous and self-directed.

●	You’re passionate about making an impact in the face of a changing climate. 





Your Responsibilities:


The role will primarily be focused on providing personal and administrative support to our Chief Executive Officer. This will include:

●	Extensive diary and inbox management.

●	Screening telephone calls, enquiries and requests, and handling them when appropriate

●	Proactively planning and coordinating meetings, events, conferences and complex travel while anticipating and managing any potential conflicts.

●	Minuting meetings.

●	Prepare and revise documents including letters, presentations, proposals and reports.

●	Assistance with monthly Board reporting.

●	Provide support and assistance to other senior leaders as required.





Your Skills & Background:


●	You have a background in executive support for senior leadership. 

●	You are tech savvy with strong skills in Gmail and MS Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) .

●	You hold strong business acumen with the ability to make sound judgement and quick decisions whilst operating in a fast-paced environment.

●	You are calm under pressure with exceptional planning, prioritization and organization skills.

●	You are able to work autonomously as well as being part of a team

●	You are extremely organised and able to multitask and work in a constantly changing and dynamic environment

●	You are able to build effective relationships with multiple stakeholders.

●	You own pride in your work, consistently delivering high quality outcomes, and accountable for actions.

●	You are proactive, able to work calmly under pressure and to tight deadlines, and to think ahead on requests.

●	Knowledge of Zoom/Teams. Calendly and Docusign would be highly regarded.

●	You should have full working rights to live and work in Canada

 


Who we look for:


We believe that the unique ideas from all of our amazing team members are key to our success. To create an inclusive and diverse culture, we welcome, encourage and celebrate applicants of any race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. 




You don’t need to have a specific background, but ideally, you’ll have depth and experience in a similar role. This is a highly dynamic startup environment, so there will be a great deal of agility required. You should be comfortable with rapid, continuous problem-solving in an ambiguous and constantly changing environment. Working on large scale problems with novel approaches to solve huge global challenges requires talent, teamwork and determination. 

 


 We like people with:


•	Ambition, drive and opinions

•	Autonomy, and self-direction

•	An ownership attitude 

•	Curiosity and a growth mindset

•	Great communication skills

•	Humility and respect with the ability to excel in a team environment

•	The passion to create a safer future.

We like people like you.





Your Pay & Perks:


●	Remuneration of $50,000 - $70,000 based on skills, experience, and location

●	Opportunity to participate in FloodMapp's Employee Share Option Plan

●	Flexible and hybrid working options

●	Additional day off on or around your Birthday

●	Two “Reboot” days of leave per year to be used doing things you love or just recharge.





How you apply:


Please send your resume and a cover letter to careers+ea@floodmapp.com telling us why you want to join our mission.

description:
Our Mission at Vitality is to provide our clients with the best experience from the first contact with us and beyond discharge. Our goal is to make every single client feel welcomed and comfortable in the clinic by going above and beyond to provide an elevated experience. Their entire experience starts with and relies heavily on the front desk staff. From booking to billing, and from their first appointment up until graduation we always strive to make it an unforgettable experience. 

Responsibilities:

High level of professionalism over the phone, following phone procedures. 

Opening and closing the clinic. 

Checking in clients, ensuring intake forms are done.

Overseeing all billing, direct billing to insurance, co-payments, etc. 

Keeping the front area clean and presentable. 

Overseeing and contributing to development of operations in place for the front desk.

Ensuring clients are happy with their experience. If a client is unhappy, there is always a way to resolve it! 

Overseeing front desk staff, their performance and metrics.

Meeting and reporting to upper management. 

Expectations: 

Great leadership and management skills. 

Consistently contributing to the healthy and respectful environment in the clinic. 

High levels of customer service that is consistent with all clients.

Client confidentiality.

All clients and employees are treated with respect and empathy.

Initiative is shown in everyday tasks.

All aspects of the position are followed through and completed.

High attention to detail while completing tasks.

Your profile:

Proven leadership experience.

You go above and beyond for clients, ensuring them a smooth and great experience.

Detail oriented

Takes initiative

Driven by client satisfaction 

Loves working in a fun team environment. 







*Receptionist and leadership experience is strongly recommended for this position.

industries: Insurance, Financial Services, and Executive Offices
description:
Beyond Wealth





We look at the big picture to deliver long-term value. We’re focused on financial wellness but know it’s just a small part of living a full life. We go above and beyond simply investing to being invested in all of our clients’ affairs—taking a holistic approach to assisting them wherever they need help.





Job brief





As Executive Assistant to the President, you will be primarily responsible for maximizing the President’s time and promoting a positive company image. Through your duties as a liaison, you will maintain relationships between the President, his executives and his employees.





What does an Executive Assistant do?





Reporting directly to the President, the Executive Assistant provides executive support in a one-on-one working relationship. The Executive Assistant serves as the primary point of contact for internal and external constituencies on all matters pertaining to the Office of the President. The Executive Assistant also serves as a liaison to the senior management teams; organizes and coordinates executive outreach and external relations efforts; and oversees special projects.




The Executive Assistant must be creative and enjoy working within a small, entrepreneurial environment that is mission-driven, results-driven and community-oriented. The ideal individual will have the ability to exercise sound judgment in various situations, with strong written and verbal communication, administrative, and organizational skills, and the ability to maintain balance among multiple priorities.




The Executive Assistant will have the ability to work independently on projects, from conception to completion, and must be able to work under pressure at times to handle a wide variety of activities and confidential matters with discretion.

industries: Software Development, Insurance, and Financial Services
description:
D’un océan à l’autre, nos collègues inspirants sont au cœur de ce que nous faisons de mieux : aider les gens, les entreprises et la société à aller de l’avant dans les bons moments et à être résilients dans les moments difficiles. Dans notre équipe, vous contribuerez à ces efforts jour après jour en vivant nos valeurs, en étant ouverts au changement et en poursuivant vos objectifs.

Chez Intact, vous aurez d’innombrables occasions d’apprendre et de vous épanouir, aux côtés de gens expérimentés et passionnés qui sont les meilleurs de l’industrie. Vous pourrez donner le meilleur de vous-mêmes et vraiment faire bouger les choses. Ici, vous pourrez : façonner l’avenir de l’assurance, réussir en équipe et évoluer avec nous.

À propos du poste

Nous cherchons un 

Adjoint(e) administratif (ve) expérimenté(e) 

pour notre équipe grandissante!

L' 

Adjoint(e) administratif (ve) expérimenté(e)

 relèvera d’un Directeur principal et supportera l’équipe de gestion au niveau directeur principal. Ce poste requiert un professionnel collaboratif, avoir le souci du détail et une capacité de mener plusieurs tâches de front.

En fournissant un soutien de qualité supérieure, vous serez responsable d'un large éventail de tâches administratives et de soutien général de nature hautement confidentielle. Vous devrez faire preuve de beaucoup de tact et d'intégrité en raison de la nature du travail effectué, de la fréquence des contacts internes et externes et de l'exposition à des informations confidentielles.

En liaison avec plusieurs secteurs de l’entreprise, vous mettrez en œuvre des capacités supérieures d'organisation et de multitâche tout en assurant une compréhension solide des structures organisationnelles.



Lieux:

 Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa) ou Anjou (7101 Jean-Talon Est)



Ce Que Vous Accomplirez Chez Nous




Procéder à la création et réception de PO (Employés et SOW)

Gérer les courus pour les contractuels et SOW.

Coordonner les arrivées et départs des employés et contractuels.

Coordonner les retours d’équipements associé à la gestion des coûts.

Coordonner les demandes d’accès.

Gérer les listes de distribution.

Effectuer les comptes de dépenses des directeurs au besoin.

Effectuer les achats pour les gestionnaires (formations pour employés, renouvellement de licences, etc…).

Coordonner les espaces bureau et emplacements.

Agir comme point de contact avec le service des installations pour les plans de bureaux.

Effectuer les réservations de salles.

Coordonner la gestion des soldes de vacances pour l’équipe.

Planifier des rencontres sur demande (CPL Meetings/Claims).

Effectuer les commandes de lunch.

Effectuer la planification des voyages.

Procéder à des corrections et traductions de textes simples.

Participer à des projets spéciaux selon la demande.




Qualifications




Ce que vous mettrez à profit :



Formation dans un domaine connexe.

Minimum de 5 années d'expérience dans un environnement de travail professionnel en tant qu'adjoint administratif ou coordonnateur de projet.

Le bilinguisme courant en anglais et en français

Compétences supérieures en matière d'organisation et capacité à obtenir des résultats dans un environnement dynamique au rythme rapide.

Compétences interpersonnelles exceptionnelles, tact et capacité avérée d'atteindre des objectifs.

Excellentes aptitudes à l'écoute et à la communication et capacité à favoriser avec tact de solides relations de travail.

Compétences avancées dans la suite MS Office.

Capacité à gérer les priorités et les délais multiples.



Voici quelques-uns des avantages qui amènent les gens à travailler chez nous :



Un milieu de travail inspirant et maintes fois primé qui soutient ses employés et reconnaît l’excellent travail accompli 

Des projets stimulants et ambitieux et des occasions de perfectionnement qui vous aideront à développer vos compétences et à faire progresser votre carrière.



Aménagements de travail flexibles


À l'heure actuelle, nous soutenons le travail à distance à 100%, si votre travail le permet. Quand il sera sécuritaire de le faire, nous adopterons une formule de travail hybride qui combinera le meilleur du télétravail et du travail au bureau. Les horaires seront déterminés en collaboration entre les employés, les gestionnaires et l’équipe.

Énoncé fermeture


Égalité d’accès à l’emploi


Si nous pouvons rendre le processus de recrutement plus accessible pour vous, n’hésitez pas à nous dire quand nous pourrons vous faire part d’une possibilité d’emploi. Nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.


Cliquer ici pour d’autres informations importantes sur le processus d’embauche
, y compris la vérification des antécédents, les candidats internes et le droit de travailler au Canada.

Indeed Commandité


IN-QC
