description:
Forget the image of the traditional cabinet of accountants, lawyers or human resource counselors. Escient is a multidisciplinary practice located in Laval, which is distinguished by its collaborative approach, offering integrated professional accounting, certification, tax, business law, consulting and human capital management. In addition to serving a business clientele in the Greater Montreal and Laval region, it is the reference firm in Quebec for the management of health care clinics.

Recognized for his expertise as for His commitment, our team innovates constantly in order to adapt to changing needs. Each of its members is invited to contribute to the improvement of our services and systems, as well as in the influence of our employer brand, in an atmosphere where are cultivated values of respect, integrity, autonomy, collegiality. and self-realization.


 An environment that defies the expectations 



 flexible time

 social committee

 autonomy and thoroughness in the production of do Categories;

description:
Job Description



In accordance with the Vision, Purpose, and Values, and strategic direction of the Vancouver Island Health Authority (Island Health) patient and staff safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone; as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.

Reporting to the Manager or designate, and utilizing a variety of computerized applications, the Administrative Clerk, Integrated Health Network supports the multidisciplinary team by providing a communication link between patients, doctors, hospitals, long-term care facilities, and a variety community agencies, services and programs and provides clerical support, including word/data processing, typing reports and documents, referrals, data base management, answering general inquiries, and scheduling and timekeeping.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Education, Training And Experience


Secretarial or Office Administration Certificate, Medical Terminology and One (1) year recent, related experience including experience with patient scheduling and spreadsheet and database applications; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.Travel is a requirement of this position. Use of personal vehicle and a valid BC divers license is required.



Skills And Abilities




Keyboard at 40 wpm.

Operate related equipment, including a computer utilizing a variety of software applications.

Communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.

Deal with others effectively.

Organize work.

Physically carry out the duties of the position




Link To Full Job Description



https://jd.viha.ca/JD38.pdf

industries: Non-profit Organizations, Government Administration, and Truck Transportation
description:
As the Administrative Clerk II, you will support the Branch Manager's (BM) Office of the Development Services Branch, reporting to the Branch Manager's Administrative Assistant. You will assist with coordination of branch-wide events, staff engagement activities, and communications. Responsibilities will be carried out for various administrative tasks and asset management services. You will also require both team work and independent decision making regarding the diverse and varied duties and assignments. Your success will be measured by your ability to achieve results in a respectful, inclusive and service-minded way.

With a focus on the City of Edmonton's Cultural Commitments to Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will  

Assist the Branch Manager's Administrative Assistant or Strategic Coordinator with branch-wide events and staff engagement bookings.

Register events and meetings for BM attendance; maintain Meeting Log and Industry Contact Log

Assist with Communication Activities, such as the newsletter and email

Assist with the development or maintenance of branch-wide logs (Google Sheets), including Council reports, branch tracker, memberships, training and travel, sponsorships, parking, etc.

Administer the branch leave request process, including verification, approval and records retention

Work with the corporate list and the Deputy City Manager's (DCM) Office for Long Service Awards (issued annually); tracking log, orders, distribution and records

 Inquiry Management for BM Office; assign; maintain tracking log; verify instructions and access; monitor due dates; follow up for completion. Upload responses and close jobs when complete for POSSE. Liaise with the DCM Office, as required. Includes the following:


POSSE OneCity Correspondence Inquiries

Email inquiries from Councillors' Offices (not OneCity)

Phone inquiries

311 Customer Relations Management (CRM) System tickets via email; assign email; file


Review all correspondence, documentation or email drafts ensuring proper format (memo, letter), proofread and seek clarification when needed, verify instructions were followed, assess content and suggest improvement, etc.

Create POSSE OneCity Correspondence Jobs for document retention, as required

 Provide general administrative support:


IT asset management for BM Team and Branch spare assets; maintain tracking and logs; refresh process; coordinate with section administrative support

Phone lists; Google Groups; Google Contacts; Corporate Directory - coordinate and maintain updates for BM Team

Back up section administrative support - assist with IT assets; Jabber (computer, phone); Cimpl and various admin tasks, as required

Assist the Administrative Assistant, Strategic Coordinator, and Client Liaison Unit with projects and initiatives, as assigned


Document management including: branch templates, Google Page, and Google Drive

Perform other related duties as required




Qualifications




Qualifications



Grade 12 diploma, including business subjects with emphasis on general office practices OR completion of an appropriate administrative professional certificate program from an accredited business school or college

Two years of progressively responsible, diverse administrative experience in a fast-paced, schedule driven and highly political office setting, including experience providing support to a team of senior management using calendar management and maintaining records

Intermediate skills and experience in Google applications, including Docs, Sheets, Sites, Drive, Gmail, and Calendar

Knowledge of POSSE, OneCity, ARIBA, and PeopleSoft are assets

Knowledge of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FOIP) and the ability to process FOIP requests in conjunction with the City's Access and Privacy Office will be an asset.

A focus on and excellent customer service skills with the ability to remain professional in a fast paced, challenging environment

Exceptional prioritization skills, including the ability to make independent decisions regarding managing calendar requests and task management

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Independent and strong decision-making skills, including the ability to research processes to complete tasks

Familiarity with the City's policy, procedures, and formats are assets

Experience working with management positions, with the ability to maintain and influence relationships without having a formal level of authority over others

Ability to deal with confidential information using a high degree of judgment and discretion

Ability to recognize politically sensitive issues and bring matters of priority to the attention of the appropriate senior leader 

Must be self motivated and produce quality, error-free work in a busy environment 

Ability to identify key and critical items for timely response 

Strong organization skills with strong interpersonal and teamwork abilities

Demonstrated ability to achieve results in the context of a respectful, inclusive and service-minded style

Embrace the Cultural Commitments of Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, and foster an environment that encourages others to do the same

Applicants may be tested


The City of Edmonton is committed to inclusive, respectful and equitable workplaces that represent the communities we serve. We continuously improve our systems, policies and practices to remove barriers and ensure our employees, in all their diversity, can succeed. We value applicants with a diverse range of skills, experiences and competencies, and encourage you to apply. To learn more, see the Art of Inclusion: Our Diversity and Inclusion Framework here: https://bit.ly/3hd2d95.

The City of Edmonton strives to provide reasonable access and accommodations throughout the application and selection process. If you would like to request an accommodation at any stage of the process, please contact Employment@edmonton.ca


COVID-19 Notice:
 The City of Edmonton has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. Employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of vaccination. Employees who cannot be fully vaccinated on the basis of a protected legal ground (e.g. medical, religious) may request an exemption. Please note that this policy applies to all employees, including new hires, and volunteers. If your application is successful, you will be asked to provide proof of vaccination or request an exemption.

For more information, please refer to our COVID-19 Vaccination Policy (bit.ly/3lKwb6j) and COVID-19 Vaccination Procedure (bit.ly/39BICMt).



Up to 1 permanent full-time position




Hours of Work:
 33.75 hours per week, Monday to Friday

The weekly hours of work for this position are currently under review and may change at a future time. Any changes will be made in accordance with the City of Edmonton/Civic Service Union 52 collective agreement and the incumbent will be notified in advance.


Salary:
 ($41,691.23 to $51,769.73 annually)

description:
Position:
 Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify



Compensation




$75-$150 (per 1 hour session)

$300-$850 (multi-session studies)




Job Requirements




Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.

Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.

Complete written survey provided for each panel.

MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.




Qualifications




Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.

Must have access to high-speed internet

Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.

Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary

Canada residents only




Job Benefits




Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.

No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.

No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time

Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.

You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.


This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

company: Canadian Forces Morale and Welfare Services
industries: Armed Forces
description:
QUI NOUS SOMMES


Les Services de bien-être et moral des Forces canadiennes (SBMFC) appuient les membres des Forces armées canadiennes et leurs familles partout où ils se trouvent dans le monde grâce à des programmes de conditionnement physique, des activités de loisirs, du soutien aux familles et aux activités de bienfaisance, des services de vente au détail et des services financiers personnels. Nous offrons à nos employés l’occasion de travailler au quotidien vers un but, dans un milieu inclusif, sain, respectueux et enrichissant.


LE RÔLE


Sous la surveillance du Adjoint administratif du mess, la ou le titulaire du poste participer à la planification, à l’organisation et à la coordination des procédures administratives pour le bureau du mess. Elle ou il répondre aux appels téléphoniques et diriger les demandes de renseignements à la personne compétente. Elle ou il balancer la petite caisse et tous les paiements des cotisations de mess et des comptes clients. Elle ou il préparer et faire des dépôts bancaires. Elle ou il percevoir les montants et émettre des reçus pour les réceptions tenues au mess.


QUALIFICATION REQUISE



Études, certificats et permis


Diplôme ou certificat collégial en administration des affaires ET quelques années d’expérience de l’administration ou dans un domaine connexe.

OU

Diplôme d’études secondaires ET plusieurs années d’expérience de l’administration ou une combinaison acceptable d’études, de formation et d’expérience sera aussi considérée.


Expérience


De l’administration de bureau

De la comptabilité de base

De la prestation du service à la clientèle


Compétences, aptitudes et capacités


Orientation client, connaissance de l’organisation, communication, innovation, travail d’équipe et leadership


EXIGENCE LINGUISTIQUE


Anglais essentiel


AVANTAGES OFFERTS



Santé :
 Remboursement des médicaments sur ordonnance, assurance voyage, régimes de soins dentaires et de la vue, assurance vie, assurance invalidité de longue durée et assurance en cas de décès ou de mutilation par accident.


Équilibre travail/vie personnelle :
 Vaste gamme de congés payés et non payés, dont des congés annuels, personnels et pour obligations familiales payés.


Planification de la retraite
 
:
 Régime de retraite à prestations déterminées et régimes d’épargne collectifs.


Apprentissage et perfectionnement :
 Programme d’aide pour frais de scolarité et programme d’apprentissage avancé, paiement des cotisations d’associations professionnelles, cours en ligne et formation linguistique.


Autres avantages : 
 Rabais offerts par Reconnaissance FC.


AUTRES RENSEIGNEMENTS



Exigences liées à la sécurité :



Cote de fiabilité




DATE D’ENTRÉE EN FONCTION


28 mars 2022


INCLUSION ET MESURES D’ADAPTATION


Les SBMFC ont à cœur d’offrir un environnement inclusif, équitable et accessible, où tous les employés se sentent valorisés, respectés et appuyés. Nous acceptons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées qui peuvent nous aider à constituer un effectif à l’image de la diversité de nos communautés. Des mesures d’adaptation sont offertes à tous ceux et celles qui en font la demande, à n’importe quelle étape du processus de sélection.

Ontario

description:
Coquitlam School District invites applications from individuals for the position of Stores. (Regular Full Time) As the third largest school district in the province we are located within a 40-minute drive from downtown Vancouver. The school district has a population of 32,000 students with approximately 4,300 teaching, administrative, managerial and support staff.

This position reports to the Assistant Director, Operations or designate and receives some direction from the Purchasing Manager and is responsible for the operation of the districts stores and supervises the work of Security Runners and Delivery Persons.


Responsibilities include
 - Supervising, training, assigning, coordinating, scheduling, and monitoring security runners and delivery persons. Performs duties of the dayshift security runner and/or deliver person during the Monday to Friday work week if required. Controls all inventory at the maintenance facility, provides logistic and supply chain analysis of material and distribution.


The successful applicant will possess
 a certificate in light warehousing including courses in Logistic Management, Activity Analysis, costing and/or production and Inventory Management from a recognized college/institution plus one year of recent warehousing purchasing experience working with a computerized inventory control system. Or Equivalent combination of training and experience including a minimum of two years recent warehousing or purchasing experience working with a computerized inventory control system.

Supervisory skills and experience required plus technical knowledge of repairing small power tools, mechanical equipment, and some school furniture.

This is a unionized position which offers $28.02 per hour (40 hours a week) including an attractive benefit package which includes, Extended Health, Dental, MSP and Pension Plan (MPP).

Please apply at https://bit.ly/3CqexwF by Apr 27, 2022 11:30 PM PDT.


Once you have completed your profile you will have access to the job postings




Applications will be reviewed as they are received




All applicants are advised that they must sign a release to permit a criminal record check prior to confirmation of hiring. We appreciate your interest but regret that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

.


Value

What impact will you have?
 You will become an essential member of a growing, hardworking, fun-loving, and determined team. If you hold yourself to high standards, your impact will be significant, and it will be immediate. You’ll fit right in.






Culture:
 We learn and improve every day.


Service:
 We serve our customers and each other


Growth: 
We believe individual growth will support the growth of our business.






Key Requirements



Effectively manage all residential and commercial customers and map out customers

Responsible for being organized, checking all emails frequently, updating the QuickBooks database/word database, sending all invoices promptly, booking services, and collecting all payments on time

Ability to communicate with all customers assertively and respectfully on the phone and technicians for instructions on their routes and pay attention to detail when inputting customer information

Must know how to type proficiently, use Intuit QuickBooks Online, Microsoft Office and send out emails. Ability to manage company independently and sell lighting products to expand the company



General requirements



Must know Intuit QuickBooks Online, Microsoft Office (Excel, Word), Google Doc -Issue PO’s & invoices -Typing quickly with accuracy

Responsible for showing up on time to work, notifying the company ahead of time or as soon as possible if you are late, miss work, or are sick

Excellent oral and written communication skills



Skills required



Managing -Working calm under pressure

Multi-tasking -Communicating with customers -Answering phone calls, sending invoices, collecting payments promptly

Attention to detail and accuracy

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Ability to work well independently and as part of a team

Must be health and safety conscious

Prioritization and time management skills

Hourly wage: Starting $15/hr and salary based available as well

Shift: Monday – Friday (Hours vary)

Position: Seasonal

job_title: Remote Administrative Assistant Work From Home
industries: Market Research
description:
Position:
 Administrative Assistant Work From Home - Part-Time Focus Group Participants

Our company is looking for individuals to take part in National & Local Paid Focus Groups, Clinical Trials, and Phone Interviews.

With most of our paid focus group studies, you have the choice to participate remotely online or in person. This is a great way to earn additional income from the comfort of your home.

You have to apply on our site and see if you qualify



Compensation




$75-$150 (per 1 hour session)

$300-$850 (multi-session studies)




Job Requirements




Show up at least 10 minutes prior to discussion start time.

Participate by completing written and/or oral instructions.

Complete written survey provided for each panel.

MUST actually use products and/or services, if provided. Then be ready to discuss BEFORE the meeting date.




Qualifications




Must have either a smartphone with a working camera or webcam on desktop/laptop.

Must have access to high-speed internet

Ability to read, understand, and follow oral and written instructions.

Administrative assistant admin experience is not necessary

Canada residents only




Job Benefits




Flexibility to take part in discussions online or in person.

No commute is needed if you choose to work from home remotely.

No minimum hours. You can do this part-time or full-time

Enjoy free samples from our sponsors and partners in exchange for your honest feedback on their products.

You get to review and use new products or services before they are launched to the public.


This position is perfect for anyone looking for temporary, part-time, or full-time work. The hours are flexible and no previous experience is needed. If you are an administrative assistant or someone just looking for a flexible admin part-time remote work at home job, this is a great way to supplement your income.

Apply on our website now and see if you qualify

description:
The Manitoba government recognizes the importance of building an exemplary public service reflective of the citizens it serves, where diverse abilities, backgrounds, cultures, identities, languages and perspectives drives a high standard of service and innovation. The Manitoba government supports equitable employment practices and promotes representation of designated groups (women, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, visible minorities).

Employment Equity is a factor in selection for this competition. Consideration will be given to Indigenous people and persons with disabilities.

An Eligability list may be established to fill future term and regular vacancies.

The department of Mental Health, Wellness and Recovery is looking for a term Administrative Officer to support the office of the Assistant Deputy Minister and division management team.



Conditions Of Employment




Must be legally entitled to work in Canada




Qualifications




Essential
:


Extensive experience providing administrative coordination and support to senior and executive level management.

Experience coordinating and managing correspondence, authority seeking documents and other highly sensitive materials on behalf of leadership.

Experience maintaining document tracking systems such as Activities and Issues Management System (AIMS) or Shared Information Management System (SIMS) to manage incoming and outgoing requests and correspondence.

Experience in calendar management with accountability for: scheduling meetings, coordinating appointments, making travel arrangements and preparing necessary meeting materials.

Strong verbal communication skills to clearly and professionally communicate with internal and external stakeholders in person and over the phone.

Excellent written communication skills to draft, format, edit and proof read correspondence on behalf of the Assistant Deputy Minister's office.

Strong customer services skills to represent the ADM's office with courtesy and professionalism

Strong political acumen to manage conflicting priorities of various stakeholders with diplomacy and tact

Excellent interpersonal skills to work in an efficient and effective manner with all levels of government

Ability to maintain organization in a high pressure environment with competing priorities and tight deadlines.

Strong ability to independently problem solve complex issues with limited direction.

Demonstrated ability to proactively influence work processes and implement methods to accomplish tasks more effectively

Ability to maintain confidentiality.




Desired




Administrative Assistant certificate/diploma or post-secondary education in office management/business or equivalent secretarial experience.




Duties



Reporting to the Assistant Deputy Minister, this position is responsible for providing professional and confidential administrative support to the Assistant Deputy Minister and supports coordination of the Assistant Deputy Minister’s office. Working independently, the incumbent will be responsible for:


Coordinating program and financial management activities of the ADM's Office

Coordinate and process Ministerial and departmental requests and authority seeking documents

Liaising with internal and external stakeholders on behalf of the Assistant Deputy Minister,

Assist with coordination of meetings, events, announcement and travel

Maintaining FIPPA responses and Records

Service Centre 2

Human Resource Services

360-1395 Ellice Avenue

Winnipeg, MB , R3G 3P2

Fax: ********

Email: ********

description:
Why work for Lafarge? 


As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a 
 greener 
 , 
 smarter 
 and 
 healthier 
 world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., 
 safety 
 comes first, 
 collaboration 
 matters and 
 diversity 
 is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually 
 make our materials better. 


Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?



Overview



Coast Aggregates, A Division of Lafarge Canada Inc. is looking for an 
Administrative Assistant
 for our Squamish location. Coast Aggregates sell top quality construction aggregates, sand, decorative rock and organic top soil throughout the Sea to Sky Corridor. We work in a fast paced office environment with a busy Landscape Depot. This role will primarily involve ticketing and processing payments for our Landscape Depot pickup customers, booking delivery orders and answering any general inquiries. You must thrive in a busy environment, enjoy dealing with customers and helping out the rest of the team when needed.


To apply, please send your resume to Marika at marika.maki@lafarge.com . Include the job title in your subject line.




Responsibilities




 Assist all Landscape Depot pick-up customers (both on the phone and in person) in a professional and courteous manner 

 Remotely ticket aggregate products 

 Book Landscape Depot delivery orders for customers 

 Communicate with Landscape Depot yard staff (via company radio) 

 Answer telephones and respond to, or direct inquiries 

 Receive and distribute packages 

 Check in/out Visitors 

 Scan, file & save documents 

 Data entry 




Training And Experience




 Qualifications 


Previous reception, administrative, or Customer Service experience required (minimum 6 months)



Skills




 Excellent computer skills. With good working knowledge of Word, Excel 

 Experience with G-Suite products is an asset (Gmail, Google Sheets etc) 

 Must have excellent telephone manner 

 Good organizational and time management skills 

 Ability to maintain a professional demeanour at all times 

 Professional attitude and willingness to assist customers and coworkers 


This position is a full time hourly position with hours of 8am to 4pm Monday to Friday. Pay is dependent on experience.


 As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required. 



 LafargeHolcim 


As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are 
 passionate 
 , driven by 
 curiosity 
 and keen to 
 grow 
 , 
 learn, develop 
 and 
 thrive 
 in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers .

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

Start date: As soon as possible
Compensation: $18 - $23 / hr
Language(s) of work: Both official languages. English and French
Hours of Work & Contract Timeline: Monday to Thursday 9:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

OBJECTIVE
Fulfil the reception duties of the Activity Centre, the secretarial duties of the Executive and support the satellite offices.

RESPONSIBILITIES
● Perform clerical and administrative support duties including answering the telephone, greeting visitors, checking info email, and responding to and/or redirecting inquiries/communications.
● Engage in building community by practicing active listening to community members (walk-ins or on the phone) while escalating their needs as appropriate.
● Provide administrative support to the Executive Director, including mail correspondence, document
processing, note-taking, proofreading, research of relevant documents.
● Provide general administrative support, including liaising for services with housekeeping, IT, technical services, and mail and courier services.
● Oversee the funder and volunteer data reports and administration of the programs and make sure that they are upkept in a timely manner.
● Update resources on a continuous basis and feed the information to the website coordinator.
● Organize and coordinate various team meetings, and events. Prepare the agenda, action lists, and minute taking.
● Order office supplies and equipment as needed and approved by the Executive Director.
● Support the organization with orienting/training new staff employees on day-to-day office systems.
● Participate actively in the planning and execution of special events and engage actively in the organization and success of all new and ongoing projects.
● Contribute to the continuous improvement of workflow and provide input with the team by helping them adhere to administrative procedures.
● Help maintain a safe and secure working environment.
● Other administrative and clerical duties as assigned by the Executive and/or Assistant Director.

QUALIFICATIONS
● High school diploma or equivalent and relevant years of experience in administrative services, special care counseling, social services, human resources or customer service, or a bachelor’s degree.
● IT – Computer literacy
● Strong customer service orientation

ESSENTIAL SKILLS (mandatory) Essential Skills (mandatory)
● High capacity to learn and use software applications (i.e., Office 365)
● Ability to learn new skills, techniques or work structure quickly as needed.
● Ability to correspond in both official languages (French and English) and write in a professional manner.
● Familiarity with web conferencing tools such as ZOOM; familiarity with Google Drive.
● Ability to independently organize, plan and determine work priorities in order to meet strict deadlines, in an environment with multiple and competing priorities.
● Excellent organizational and analytical skills, with keen attention to detail.
● Ability to maintain confidentiality.

OTHER KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS
● Demonstrated knowledge of implementing administrative procedures and clerical practices.
● Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritise work.
● Strong organizational planning, with rigorous attention to detail and accuracy.
● Good interpersonal skills with an ability to work as part of a small interdependent team as well as to manage own workload and work independently.
● Experience in health and social service and/or community, an asset
● Experience working in the non-profit sector would be an asset including all aspects of fund-raising strategy, memberships, volunteer management, reporting to funders.
Location: 26 hours per week at our Activity Centre in Deux-Montagnes
4Korners provides its employees with a Health Insurance program, Retirement Savings Plan, and extra paid vacation during the December holiday season.

HOW TO APPLY
Please email your CV and cover letter stating your experience and outlining how your profile suits this position to: ed@4korners.org
We appreciate the time and energy candidates put into this process, however only those chosen for interview will be contacted. 

WHO WE ARE
4Korners is a registered Canadian charitable organization founded in 2005. We connect individuals of the Laurentians with programs and services to meet their identified needs in a secure and inclusive environment. We work collectively to serve and enrich the lives of communities in the Laurentian region.
During the past three years, 4Korners has undergone an organizational restructure and growth that brought new programs throughout the Laurentian Region. Along with our Head Office in Deux-Montagnes, we run an Activity Centre in Deux-Montagnes and have four satellite offices in the Laurentians with multiple services in many small towns.
With this expansion of mandate, 4Korners is looking for a well-organized, resourceful Office Administrator to handle the day-to-day operations. The applicant must be reliable, able to work cooperatively as a team member, and independently with confidence. We are looking for someone to take initiative and help ensure that tasks and the overall administration of 4Korners is managed professionally and efficiently.

industries: Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Who we are:

Six years ago we launched our imaging platform focused entirely on wound care - a heart-wrenching global challenge. And today, our product has been adopted by over 4,000 health care facilities, operating in every state in the US to monitor over 450,000 patients. We count the largest health care providers, EMRs, and payors as our partners. As the world leader in digital wound care management, Swift Medical delivers advanced wound care visualization and touchless 3D measurement through our smartphone-ready Swift Skin and Wound software.

Other than the impact we’re making in the healthcare industry and on the lives of patients, which is huge, the very best thing about Swift Medical is our exceptional people and strong carefully nurtured culture. Certified as a Great Place to Work®, what we do is not only inspiring, we are a close-knit team working in an empathetic, energetic, collaborative, and positive environment.

Our values:

Our values guided our founders and they continue to guide all Swifties in pursuing our mission and ultimately achieving our vision.

Impact through Empathy

In Metrics We Trust

Pride and Perspective

Choose to Do (there is no try)

For more information, visit us at: https://swiftmedical.com/

Who you are:


You are energetic, self-motivated, take initiative, and simply make things happen

You are confident, mature and have experience successfully supporting busy executives 

You are a strategic thinker and problem solver, you are focused on finding solutions and creating results 

You flow between tasks with ease and are unflappable under pressure

Your keen eye for detail, commitment to quality, and positive outlook set you apart 

You are comfortable and trustworthy in handling confidential information and complex situations with poise 

You know how to communicate clearly and effectively with all types of people and thrive in a team setting, while taking charge of your own results 



What you will do in more detail:


Provide direct administrative support to our CEO and executive team

Maintain work schedule and calendars of the CEO, meeting rooms etc 

Proactively manage, assess, and predict the needs of the CEO to ensure they are prepared and organized for all internal and external meetings 

Supports executive leadership by prioritizing, assisting and executing action items, follow-ups and tasks with minimal supervision

Prepare draft reports, background documentation, and research 

Proofread and ensure clarity as well as grammatical and typographical accuracy for all written documentation

Assist in project managing the executive team’s weekly, monthly and quarterly deliverables in alignment with the business strategy 

Review or compose, edit and ensure consistent branding on all communication, correspondence, reports and presentation decks (including Quarterly Board Reports, Conference/Speaking Engagement Presentations and Team Meetings) 

Gather data to create presentations that includes charts and graphs and distributes to appropriate parties 

Prepare travel schedules, book travel arrangements, and make reservations 

Coordinate logistics of meetings, seminars, presentations, special projects, and speaking events 

Receive and screen inbound telephone calls, e-mails, and visitors for the CEO 

Complete expense reports on behalf of the CEO, and other related duties. 

Prepare, transcribe, compose, type, edit and distribute agendas and minutes of meetings

Maintain structure in a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment 

Present a positive and professional image of the CEO’’s office to all visitors, suppliers, inquiries, and other folks 

Occasional international travel may be required 



Some of the things we offer to Swifties:

Unlimited Vacation Program

Participation in our Educational Reimbursement Program

Competitive Compensation with Employee Stock Options

Health, Vision, and Dental benefits

Healthcare Spending Account

Work from Home Reimbursements

Mentoring and development opportunities

Extensive training from seasoned, engaged professionals

Flexible, remote working options

The opportunity to make a difference in the lives of our patients!

We are a diverse and equitable employer, committed to creating an inclusive workplace. Swift provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Swift Medical recognizes that challenges remain in achieving the full participation of equity-seeking groups (including women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority/racialized groups, and members of LGBTQ2+) in tech careers and is committed to identifying and eliminating barriers that may exist within its own hiring process, programs, and practices.

Swift Medical is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please let us know how we can best meet your needs and advise us of any accommodations required to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process.

We thank and appreciate all applicants for their interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please no agency calls.

job_title: I&L Administrative and Records Management Clerk
industries: Information Services
description:
Under the supervision of the Parking and Licensing Supervisor, this position performs computerized records management and administrative duties for the Inspections & Licensing Department.



Job Requirements



In addition to the 9 Core Competencies *(Ethics & Values, Service Focus, Thinking, Planning & Organizing, Leadership, Development, Communication & Interaction, Adaptability & Change Management, Understanding the Municipal Political Environment) identified for all employees of the City of Red Deer – the following are specific to this position:


Possess a two year Records Management Diploma. An Office Administration Certificate with two years experience performing records management duties in a computerized records management environment may be considered as an equivalent. Other equivalencies with administrative work in an office environment may be considered.

Knowledge of office procedures, including a computerized records management system that enables scanning, profiling, and retrieving of documents. Proficiency is required in the use of a variety of computer software programs and related equipment. Work will involve long periods of visual contact on visual display terminals.

Ability to obtain Designation of Powers from Alberta Safety Codes for issuing trades permits.

Ability to accurately type, proofread and edit technical and general information.

Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing, with staff and the public.

Knowledge of Municipal and Building & Development terminology and operations considered an asset.

Ability to acquire and retain knowledge of The City and Inspections & Licensing Department policies and procedures.

Respond courteously and constructively to public complaints and requests, and to respond to inquiries by providing appropriate information and/or directing to appropriate person.

Ability to use initiative in implementing new procedures regarding records management and plan storage.

Employ good judgement, organizational and time management techniques to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Ability to be a self-motivated, retain concentration, and work independently with frequent interruptions in order to process a considerable workload within established timeframes.

Ability to lift boxes of medium weight (approximately 25 lbs).



Affiliation:
 CUPE, Local 417


 Hours of Work: 
75 hours biweekly, Monday to Friday.

Please Note: The City of Red Deer has implemented a COVID-19 Immunization Policy, seeking to have employees fully vaccinated. For more information, please refer to The City’s COVID-19 Immunization Policy 222-CA https://secure.reddeer.ca/media/the-bridge/city-departments/legislative-services/policies-and-procedures/corporate-policies/2000/2224-CA_COVID-19_Immunization.pdf

description:
Company:


Finning Canada


Number of Openings:


1


Worker Type:


Permanent


Position Overview:


Reporting to the Vice President of Mining for Finning Canada, the Administrative Assistant will play a key role in providing a variety of administrative support services to the Executive team.

Our ideal candidate is organized, innovative, and forward-thinking when it comes to ensuring smooth operations. The individual in this role must understand business priorities, demonstrate the ability to proactively anticipate needs and drive improvements to build capacity for the leadership team. A high level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information as well as professionalism in dealing with senior executives inside and outside of the company is critical.

You possess the ability to complete complex tasks quickly with little guidance, react with appropriate urgency to situations that require a quick turnaround, and take effective action accordingly.

We are seeking an organized, responsible, and adaptable Administrative Assistant that will provide key support to our Executive team If this sounds like a role in line with what you are looking for in your next career opportunity, then we want to hear from you!


Job Description:



Travel Management – Handles travel arrangements and reservations as required

Expense reporting – Completes, reconciles, and ensures timely submission of expense reports through concur

Managing complex calendars

Coordinate meetings for Sr. Management including scheduling, booking resources, compiling required materials, and ordering catering

Maintain and update various contact and distribution lists for the department

Acts as a liaison between CAT, FII, FINCA, FINUK and FINSA, and Customers in scheduling calls

Collaborate with other Executive Assistants to address issues, optimize processes, share knowledge and working as one team

Other administrative duties as required




Qualifications: 



Minimum 5+ years of experience in a related Administrative Assistant role from a large complex organization

Completion of post-secondary course and previous experience in a similar role

Proficient in MS Office applications including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, OneDrive, SharePoint

Solid keyboarding skills with the attention to detail

Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks and set priorities

Capable of understanding and following written procedures

Understanding complex travel arrangements meet the Executives’ preferences

Strong planning and organizing skills, ability to work under tight timeframes on multiple initiatives, while maintaining accuracy, efficiency, and effectiveness

Strong professionalism, ability to maintain confidentiality and communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels, both inside and outside the organization 

Demonstrate integrity and trust by keeping commitments and communicating transparently



We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

industries: Non-profit Organizations, Individual and Family Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Senior Administrative Assistant-Full Time-Toronto, ON

Would you like to work for a not-for-profit organization that is dedicated to maximizing the independence and community participation of people with disabilities across Canada? Would you like to play a role in advocating for inclusion and equity for all people living with disabilities?

March of Dimes Canada (MODC) is a federally registered national charity that offers a wide variety of programs and services to Canadians living with disabilities.Since 1951, starting with the polio epidemic, March of Dimes Canada has been on the forefront of the disability movement. We are focused on a bold vision of enhancing services, financing the vision, building partnerships, and creating an appropriate and sustainable infrastructure. Through our Culture Code we live the values of: 
We Are One Team, We Are Accountable To Ourselves and Each Other, and We Adapt and Grow Together. 
To help realize this vision we are adding a Senior Administrative Assistant Accountant toan exemplary and committed Finance Team.



Profile



The
 Senior Administrative Assistant
 is responsible for the coordination and provision of a high level of administrative support within the Finance and IT departments. The Senior Administrative Assistant will serve as the primary administrative support to the Vice President, Chief Financial Officer as well as, to Director of Finance and departmental Financial Services Managers. She/he will assist with the secretarial support for three board committees, Finance, Risk and Audit and Investment. Consequently, the individual will have access to privileged information and or resources that must treated with confidentiality and or be safeguarded.



Responsibilities



The Senior Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing a wide range of administrative support activities:


Serving as the recording secretary, coordinating, various board committee meetings; including assistance with preparing and packaging any required materials, taking and transcribing minutes; assuring appropriate distribution of minutes including safekeeping of historical documents; and tracking agenda items.

Assistance with formatting/or reviewing memoranda, correspondence, reports, agreements, presentations, forms, and other documents ensuring compliance with the appropriate MODC standard templates and procedures.

Establishing, organizing, and maintaining confidential documents electronically. Distribute incoming correspondence, invoices, etc. within the departments on a timely basis.

Must be able to facilitate submitting invoices for Finance and IT departments ensuring the correct coding, approvals are in place and receiving against the purchase orders in the Financial system etc.

Providing support with time sheet recording and updating employee status forms in HR systems. Performing special project assignments as directed, assisting, and providing backup to other administrative staff in the organization.

Being a vital part of the Administrative Support Group in National Office, which meets to share ideas and identify issues and training needs for support staff.




Qualifications And Experience




University degree and/or college diploma in a related field

Minimum 5 years related administrative support experience in a high-volume, large company environment preferably in a Finance department setting

Experience supporting the senior management level, and board meetings including taking minutes and maintaining highly effective working relationships

Skilled in executive-level verbal and written correspondence

Proven project management skills with the ability to prioritize multiple needs and competing demands to meet deadlines

Experience/aptitude for designing documents in a creative and technically sound manner

Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and Adobe Pro

Highly aptitude for learning, retaining, and using computer software

High degree of accuracy, thoroughness, and attention to detail

Ability to take verbal and written direction and follow through to complete assigned tasks

Flexibility to changing demands

Accommodation of board committee meeting timings outside of regular work hours


If you are interested intransforming the quality of life for people with disabilities, please submit your cover letter and resume in confidence to: Human Resources at
 click apply
by 
March 18, 2022. 




Please Note The Following




This position will be a member of the national team, reporting to our Toronto office.

Work will initially be performed remotely from a home office until the Toronto office fully re-opens.

Please indicate where you saw this posting in your cover letter, for our tracking purposes.


Please note that March of Dimes Canada has a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy.All employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by receiving all required doses of avaccineapproved by Health Canada at least 14 days prior to the commencement of their employment, or as otherwise recommended by public health authorities. We will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who are unable tobe vaccinated for medical reasons or on the basis of any other protected ground,as required under applicable human rights legislation
.


March of Dimes Canada is committed to a workforce that is reflective of the diverse populations that we serve. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and accessibility standards across Canada, March of Dimes Canada will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require any accommodations, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. We are committed to a selection process and work environment that is inclusive, equitable and accessible.

description:
The Executive Assistant provides a high level of administrative support to the Country Vice President, Vice President of Talent Experience. The Executive Assistant also serves as a liaison to leadership and senior management teams at the Corporate Headquarters in Canada. The Executive Assistant must be creative and enjoy working in an environment that is mission driven, results driven and community oriented. The ideal individual will have the ability to anticipate needs, think critically and offer solutions to problems with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.


Provide high-level administrative support to 2 Vice Presidents; including managing an extremely active calendar of appointments; scheduling meetings and conference calls; prepare expense reports; arrange complex and detailed travel and accommodation plans, itineraries, and agendas

Act as the liaison between the Executive team and all departments as well as outside partners on all matters pertaining to the executive operation of the organization 

Prepare Word, Excel, PowerPoint presentations, agendas, reports, meeting minutes, special projects, and other documents in support of objectives for the organization 

Maintain financial reports for the DFO and finance team

Manage sensitive matters with a high level of confidentiality and discretion especially decisions directly impacting the operations of the company

Plan meetings and events of varying sizes and scope; Tasks include, budgeting, content development, registration management, attendee communications, agenda management, travel and hotel accommodations, menu selection, AV requirements, preparation and distribution of program materials and onsite coordination 

Act as lead project manager for internal meetings and events to ensure deliverables are met in a timely manner 

Partner closely with the senior leaders in support of company objectives

Office management of Canadian Corporate Headquarters. Tasks include manage executive team payroll, building maintenance, ordering office supplies, managing boardrooms and meeting space.

Associate degree or its equivalent

3-5 years of related experience required 

Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

Event and project management experience required 

Strong organizational skills and excellent attention to detail

Exceptional interpersonal, written, and oral communications skills 

Demonstrates proactive approaches to problem-solving with strong decision-making capability 

Strong business acumen and understanding of operational issues 

High degree of professionalism, integrity, and discretion

Ability to react with appropriate levels of urgency to situations and events that require quick response or turnaround

description: Mandat Le titulaire de ce poste a comme principale responsabilité d'effectuer l'enregistrement des bâtiments résidentiels neufs tout en respectant les critères de qualité en vigueur. Il doit procéder à la facturation et le suivi des paiements quant à l'enregistrement, en plus de préparer les confirmations à acheminer aux parties prenantes. Le cas échéant, il répond également aux questions des entrepreneurs à cet effet. Responsabilités principales Générer et effectuer l'enregistrement des demandes reçues;  Assurer le suivi quant à l'obtention des documents requis pour compléter un dossier d'enregistrement;  Préparer les envois de documents de confirmation aux parties prenantes;   Numériser la documentation pertinente dans le système informatique;  Répondre aux demandes de renseignements avec tact et entregent;  S'assurer de la conformité des documents reçus et de la saisie exacte des renseignements;  Effectuer les tâches administratives nécessaires au bon fonctionnement du service;  Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les membres des différents services;  Accomplir toute autre tâche connexe. Profil recherché Posséder un diplôme d'études secondaires (DES);  Cumuler de trois à cinq années d'expérience de travail pertinentes;  Faire preuve de maturité et démontrer un sens des responsabilités;  Posséder une bonne connaissance de l'informatique (Word, Excel et différentes bases de données);  Être orienté sur le service à la clientèle externe et interne;  Avoir un bon esprit d'équipe;  Posséder d'excellentes habiletés relationnelles;  Être capable de travailler de façon autonome et rigoureuse;  Porter une attention particulière aux détails lors de l'exécution des tâches;   Faire preuve de jugement et être capable de gérer les priorités;  Avoir une bonne capacité à gérer les situations stressantes;  Démontrer une très bonne connaissance du français parlé et écrit;  Posséder une bonne connaissance de l'anglais afin de communiquer de façon adéquate avec les requérants. À propos de GCR Garantie de construction résidentielle (GCR) est un organisme à but non lucratif qui a pour mandat d'administrer le plan de garantie des bâtiments résidentiels neufs pour l'ensemble du territoire québécois. Sa mission est de protéger les intérêts des acheteurs d'une habitation neuve et d'agir concrètement pour l'amélioration de la qualité de la construction résidentielle au Québec. Type d'emploi : Poste temporaire (1 an) à temps plein Emplacement principal : 4101 rue Molson, Montréal Pour postuler : Les personnes intéressées par ce poste sont invitées à postuler dès que possible en faisant parvenir leur CV à rh@garantiegcr.com. Nous vous remercions de votre intérêt. Nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidats retenus pour les autres étapes du processus de sélection. NOTE : Le masculin est utilisé afin d'alléger le texte et la recherche, mais inclue la forme féminine.

Come work as an Administrative Assistant I with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)! 


Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for an Administrative Assistant I to join the Professional Image team and the Richmond Professional Practice team. Apply today to join our team!


As an Administrative Assistant I with Vancouver Coastal Health you will



Provide confidential administrative assistance and secretarial support to the designated Director and programs/services throughout the applicable Community of Care (CoC) or Corporate Department of Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH).

Triage information of a sensitive and confidential nature, coordinates the flow of information, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of administrative services, and keeps the Director apprised of issues and activities.

Interact primarily with director/managers and their administrative support staff throughout the CoC and across VCH to professionally represent the Director’s interests, share information, clarify details and answer questions.

Work independently and communicate with internal and external stakeholders/customers in a manner that promotes positive and respectful relationships.



Qualifications



Education & Experience



Graduation from a recognized administrative assistant/secretarial post-secondary program plus three (3) years of senior administrative support experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Must have advanced word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, desktop publishing, and database software skills and the ability to type a minimum of 60 w.p.m.



Knowledge & Abilities



Exercises considerable judgment, tact and discretion in preparing, disclosing and handling information of a confidential and/or sensitive nature.

Liaises in a professional and courteous manner with managers/directors, staff and the public to gather and disseminate information.

Communicates in a compelling, clear and understandable manner (both verbally and in writing) in order to represent the Director’s interests.

Applies excellent time management skills to prioritize and complete assignments in a manner that optimizes departmental effectiveness and contributes to organizational success.

Practices care and thoroughness when maintaining, monitoring, calculating and summarizing data, records and budget information.

Collaborates with peers to ensure administrative systems and processes are consistently followed and monitored for effectiveness and that gaps are addressed and resolved when identified.

Employs expertise in the use of desktop computer applications to create a variety of documents and presentations.

Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.



As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.



WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?


VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.


Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan

Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities

Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families

Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers

Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff


Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Please note that a resume is required to apply to this posting.

Hours of Work may vary due to project requirements.


Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.


***Employees of VCH must apply via the 
Internal Application Process
. Refer to the 
https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings
 site for 
How to Apply
 instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Ensuring effective creation and maintenance of routine and confidential departmental databases, documents and tools including drafting, revising and versioning of these documents in alignment with the AHS retention schedule. Performing other duties as required.

job_title: Adjoint administratif – Promotion de la santé
company: Canadian Forces Morale and Welfare Services
industries: Armed Forces
description:
QUI NOUS SOMMES


Les Services de bien-être et moral des Forces canadiennes (SBMFC) appuient les membres des Forces armées canadiennes et leurs familles partout où ils se trouvent dans le monde grâce à des programmes de conditionnement physique, des activités de loisirs, du soutien aux familles et aux activités de bienfaisance, des services de vente au détail et des services financiers personnels. Nous offrons à nos employés l’occasion de travailler au quotidien vers un but, dans un milieu inclusif, sain, respectueux et enrichissant.


LE RÔLE


Sous la supervision du gestionnaire de la promotion de la santé, l’adjoint administratif s’assure de la collecte de la documentation nécessaire et organise des séances d’information sur les sujets en préparation des conférences, des réunions et des rendez-vous. Ils fournissent un soutien administratif au gestionnaire/superviseur de la promotion de la santé (HP), y compris la saisie de données, le traitement de texte, la télécopie, la photocopie, la correspondance, la distribution et les mesures de suivi.Ils organisent des réunions, conseillent les participants, rédigent et distribuent les ordres du jour et les procès-verbaux. Ils organisent également le calendrier des événements et aident à la réservation d’événements tels que l’inscription, la réservation d’équipement technique, la mise en place du lieu de l’événement, au besoin.Ils planifient et organisent des rendez-vous, des réunions et des horaires de voyage. Ils fournissent un soutien administratif pour les tâches et les campagnes.


QUALIFICATION REQUISE



Études, certificats et permis



 Diplôme ou certificat collégial en administration des affaires, en comptabilité, en administration de bureau ou dans un domaine connexe ET quelques années d’expérience en administration ou dans un domaine connexe




Expérience



 administration de bureau et gestion des dossiers

 organisation de réunions et d’horaires

 rédaction et distribution de correspondance

 préparation de rapports

 connaissance des procédures de bureau, de l’équipement de bureau de base, de la gestion des ressources et de l’administration budgétaire

 utilisation d’applications logicielles pour le traitement de texte, les feuilles de calcul, les présentations, les bases de données, le courrier électronique et la navigation sur Internet




Compétences, aptitudes et capacités


Orientation client, connaissance de l’organisation, communication, innovation, travail d’équipe et leadership


EXIGENCE LINGUISTIQUE


Anglais essentiel/ Bilinguisme un atout

Compréhension de l’écrit : Fonctionnel

Expression écrite : Fonctionnel

Interaction orale : Fonctionnel


AVANTAGES OFFERTS



Santé :
 Remboursement des médicaments sur ordonnance, assurance voyage, régimes de soins dentaires et de la vue, assurance vie, assurance invalidité de longue durée et assurance en cas de décès ou de mutilation par accident.


Équilibre travail/vie personnelle :
 Vaste gamme de congés payés et non payés, dont des congés annuels, personnels et pour obligations familiales payés.


Planification de la retraite
 
:
 Régime de retraite à prestations déterminées et régimes d’épargne collectifs.


Apprentissage et perfectionnement :
 Programme d’aide pour frais de scolarité et programme d’apprentissage avancé, paiement des cotisations d’associations professionnelles, cours en ligne et formation linguistique.


Autres avantages : 
 Rabais offerts par Reconnaissance FC.


AUTRES RENSEIGNEMENTS


Ce poste syndiqué est ouvert à toutes les parties intéressées. La préférence sera accordée conformément à la convention collective.


DATE D’ENTRÉE EN FONCTION


13 avril 2022


INCLUSION ET MESURES D’ADAPTATION


Les SBMFC ont à cœur d’offrir un environnement inclusif, équitable et accessible, où tous les employés se sentent valorisés, respectés et appuyés. Nous acceptons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées qui peuvent nous aider à constituer un effectif à l’image de la diversité de nos communautés. Des mesures d’adaptation sont offertes à tous ceux et celles qui en font la demande, à n’importe quelle étape du processus de sélection.

BCMEA represents 49 waterfront employers and by extension, over 9,400 men and women working within the west coast port terminal facilities. BCMEA member companies are an essential part of the economy in B.C. and Canada, operating 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. Moving over $180 billion worth of cargo annually and 16% of Canada’s traded goods, our members serve as Canada’s vital trade link to the world. Together with our members, we proudly make sure that B.C. ports are competitive on a global level.

 

As much of our industry is built around metal and machines, the shipping business has always relied on people to keep the supply chain moving, and it’s this human side of the shipping business that we do best. We help optimize our members’ operations by adding our expertise in labour relations, safety & training and recruiting.

 

The BCMEA Labour Relations department provides support to our members through the administration and interpretation of the collective agreements; the administration of grievances and discipline; arbitration; negotiating company specific agreements and assisting with industry collective agreement negotiations.




The BCMEA is recruiting for a Labour Relations Assistant who will be a member of our Labour Relations team. Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Labour Relations, you will be responsible for a variety of administrative tasks which support the Labour Relations Department.

 


Position Requirements:


Perform a variety of administrative duties specific to the Labour Relations department, including:


Drafting correspondence (sending discipline letters and grievances)

Supporting the Labour Relations Officers and Managers with administrative tasks

Scheduling meetings

Photocopying and filing documents

Responding to telephone inquiries as part of the primary reception team for the organization


 


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:



5 years’ experience in an office or administrative setting

Hands on labour relations experience an asset

High school diploma or equivalent; Administrative Assistant Diploma would be an asset

Self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills

Capable of working independently and collaboratively as a member of a team

Proficiency with Microsoft Office, primarily Word and Excel is required

Superior organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines



 



The BCMEA is committed to employment equity and welcomes applications from everyone. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Position: Executive Assistant and Office Coordinator

Full Time / Remote

If you are seeking an exciting and well–rounded hybrid role that brings a positive attitude to our team, then wait no longer! The 
Canadian Science Policy Centre
 (CSPC) is on the look-out for a dynamic and ambitious self-starter who can fill the role of Executive Assistant and Office Coordinator.


About CSPC


The Canadian Science Policy Centre (CSPC) is a non-profit, non-partisan, and non-advocate organization established in 2009.

CSPC’s guiding vision is for a strong, inclusive, and effective science policy community that contributes to the well-being of Canadians. CSPC’s mission is to operate as an inclusive hub for connectivity, convening, capacity building, and catalyzing research in support of an effective science policy community.


About the Position


The position reports to the CEO and is responsible for providing office coordinator, c-level support and event and volunteer coordination services to the Canadian Science Policy Centre. The role will encompass various functions including liaising with other agencies, organizations, high profile stakeholders of the science innovation community, event planning, volunteer coordination and writing/drafting proposals and letters.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Administrative & Office Coordination



Maintains office services by organizing procedures, controlling correspondence and contact lists

Responsible for general office operation including: email inquiries, book travel and meeting arrangements, filing system and more

Act as the EA to CEO of the organization, tasks including:

Maintains the CEO’s schedule, travel arrangements and itineraries

Ensures all background materials, briefing notes prepared in advance of meetings

Draft correspondence

Act as the point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, responding to requests

Delegate and following up with other members of the team on tasks and projects

Finalize contracts and organizing the paperwork

Bookkeeping and maintain financial records including:

Producing invoices and tracking incoming payments

Making Payments, maintaining expense reports, processing and organizing invoices and reimbursement records

Organize staff and board meetings, taking meeting notes and preparing meeting reports

Organize various contact lists and drafting and sending mass emails

Support project managers, program manager, and contractors with coordination and delivery

Maintain organizational standards of satisfaction, quality, and performance

Draft and edit letters, proposals, and documents



Event & Volunteer Coordination



Coordination of and technical operation of virtual events via zoom

Coordinate volunteer recruitment and committee organization and volunteer engagement programs

Keep track of committee meetings and their tasks


REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS


Experience



5 years proven experience as an Executive Assistant and Office Coordinator

Knowledge of office management systems and procedures

Exemplary planning and time management skills

Excellent proficiency in the following applications:

Microsoft Office, i.e. (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and outlook) and

Google applications, Drive, Calendar, Gmail, and

Mass email systems (Mailchimp and Mailmerge)

Excellent proficiency and knowledge of zoom products and ability to coordinate the technical aspect of zoom sessions (webinar and meeting)

Must be a self-starter; work well independently and within a team environment

Experience in volunteer and event coordination is an asset



Skills



Must have outstanding command of written English and excellent verbal communication

Flexible and adaptive to a frequently changing environment

Exceptional time management skills and the ability to prioritize work

Superb organizational skills with the ability to multi-task is crucial

Exceptional attention to detail is a must

Ability to implement procedures in a fast-paced and evolving environment

Able to solve issues at a snap of a finger onsite or in-office

Social media savvy, writing engaging captions for Twitter and LinkedIn posts

Strong communication skills in order to clearly convey the message both verbally and in written format

Must work well independently and within a team environment

Ability to communicate and operate within a team while working remotely

French language communication is a significant asset



Education



Post-secondary education (degree or diploma) in relevant field


CONTRACT


Full-time

Salary range depending on experience $45,000-$50,000

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, this position will be working remotely for the time being.


APPLY

Submit a resume and cover letter outlining qualifications and interest in the position through our website by 5 pm EST on March 16th. To ensure fairness, we will only review candidates that have submitted through our on-line application process. Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis. We will contact you with next steps if you are selected for an interview.





Please note that applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada.



CSPC invites applications from all qualified candidates. We are committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society and especially welcome applications from racialized persons / persons of colour, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons and others who may contribute to the diversification of ideas. If you require any accommodation to participate in any aspect of the hiring process, please contact us at 


info@sciencepolicy.ca


.



We thank everyone for their expression of interest and are truly appreciative of the time individuals put into applying. However, with the limitations on time, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

industries: Software Development, Internet Publishing, and Computer Games
description:
In the last year, Mistplay has been ranked as the 4th fastest growing company in Canada, and 16th in all of North America. We’re known best for creating the #1 Loyalty Program on mobile where players discover new games and earn awesome rewards. With over 16 million users worldwide and partnerships with 150+ of the top gaming studios, we’re just getting started.

Our passion to innovate drives our growth across the industry with the constant development of new powerful ad tech tools, apps, and the recent launch of a publishing division for mobile games. Mistplay embraces strategic, creative, and data-driven collaboration to fuel our imagination of what can be achieved.

As part of our team, you will have the chance to make a direct impact on our products and bring in your own experience to help shape our growth. Join us as we pioneer the mobile industry together!

Mistplay is looking for an Executive and Personal Assistant to be the first point of contact for the C-Level team!

Working directly for the CEO, you will be proactive and organized in assisting in streamlining his day-to-day tasks. In this role, you will provide sophisticated calendar management for the CEO, act as a liaison, provide support and be responsible for a broad variety of administrative tasks that facilitate the CEO’s ability to effectively lead the organization. Your time will be divided between tasks that remove any roadblocks or to-do lists for the CEO. Your schedule will be flexible and ensure that the CEO can remain focused.

As someone that possesses a professional demeanor (but still has a good sense of humor), you will use a high level of initiative, good judgment, integrity, flexibility, and problem-solving skills in this role. You will work alongside the P&C coordinator to ensure the executive team's satisfaction and focus.

As a growing start-up, this role will play a key part in ensuring that our team can properly manage their time, calendars, and continue to make Mistplay an amazing company to be a part of!



You Will Be Responsible For




Assisting the COO on a daily basis

Managing email inboxes and responding on their behalf when necessary

Organize and manage both calendars end-to-end, making sure that there are no double bookings and leaving time to ensure proper work/life balance (i.e making sure they have time to eat lunch)

Coordinate both virtual and in-person meetings. Preparing the meeting room or ensuring that they have the correct Hangouts/Zoom link.

Travel planning, out of office meetings and reservations

Personal tasks and projects as needed

Answering phone calls and emails and taking messages

Taking accurate and comprehensive notes at meetings

Being the extension of the COO; predicting and planning what will be needed, managing his day-to-day, and being his eyes and ears

Keeping the COO on scheduling and monitoring timing for meetings

Managing meals for the executive team




You Will Be




Someone with 5+ years of experience as an EA to C-Level executives

Strong written and verbal communication- English is a must, French is a plus

Detail-oriented and good time management

Located in or near Montreal 

Positive attitude 

Ability to manage multiple calendars

Ability to manage highly confidential information; discretion is essential in this position; 

Ability to manage LinkedIn Accounts

Ability to travel independently around the city (preferably with a car)

Flexible with working 9-5 hours, occasionally working on the weekends as needed 

Bonus if you're coming from a similar industry in Tech and/or Data

Strong writing and communication skills 


We work hard to make our work atmosphere as inviting and fun as possible! Working at Mistplay is coupled with a whole array of perks that we've adopted virtually and in-person: Team Lunches, game nights, company-wide events, and so much more.

Our culture is deeply rooted in growth and upheld by a team of smart, dynamic, and enthusiastic people. We utilize data to constantly learn, improve, and adapt. We foster an environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas, push boundaries, take calculated risks, and witness their visions come to life.

Think you have what it takes? We'd love to meet you!

Salary range: $70,000-$125,000 depending on experience
