job_title: Support administratif gestion et planification centralisée/ Administrative support centralized hiring
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Defense and Space Manufacturing, and Software Development
description:
Role And Responsibilities





 English will follow 



Vous êtes un passionné dans votre domaine? Vous recherchez un milieu travail où vous pourrez relever des défis, innover, utiliser des outils à la fine pointe de la technologie et collaborer avec des experts provenant de secteurs variés? Vous aimeriez vous joindre à une entreprise d’envergure internationale qui est un leader dans son secteur et dont vous seriez fier de contribuer aux projets? CAE est l’employeur qu’il vous faut! Venez faire partie de notre équipe et partagez votre passion avec nous!



Le Rôle Que Nous Vous Proposons



À CAE, nos équipes ont à cœur de toujours être innovatrices et de rester à l’avant-garde. En vous joignant à notre équipe centralisée de planification et contrôle pour l’ingénierie logicielle, vous aurez l'occasion de collaborer à l’exécution des processus d’embauche, de formation, de démonstrations de simulateurs, de suivis budgétaires, et plus! C’est pourquoi nous avons besoin de votre expertise et de votre passion pour compléter notre équipe!

Voici des tâches spécifiques à ce rôle, en support aux activités de l’ingénierie:


 Participation à l’embauche 

Suivi du processus entourant les entrevues (lien avec les RHs, convocations, résultats d’entrevues, mise à jour des rapports)

Suivi de la logistique entourant l’accueil des employés (notices de visites, ordinateurs, cartes d’accès, niveaux de sécurité)

 Démonstrations sur les simulateurs dans l’usine 

Réception et analyse des demandes, validation des requis et des plateformes disponibles, planification et sécurisation des ressources, rétroaction après la démonstration

 Budgets 

Suivi et rapports des charges et des dépenses

 Gestion des factures d’achats d’équipement 

 Autres tâches administratives au besoin. 




Le Passionné Que Nous Recherchons Possède




 Parfaitement bilingue (français et anglais) 

 Diplôme d'études collégiales ou professionnel en secrétariat, ou combinaison équivalente de formation et d'expérience connexes 

 1 à 3 ans d'expérience en tant qu'assistant administratif est un atout 

 Esprit d'équipe, flexible, capacité à travailler dans un environnement en évolution rapide 

 Capacité à gérer efficacement la pression et le stress imposés par les délais 

 Gestion efficace du temps et planification, tenant compte de tâches multiples en parallèle 

 Capacité à créer des relations positives avec les collègues et clients internes de tous niveaux 

 Connaissance approfondie de la suite Microsoft et volonté d’apprendre de nouveaux outils logiciels 




CAE Vous Propose




Avantages sociaux : Entièrement flexibles pour que vous puissiez choisir ce qui est important pour vous 

 Retraite : Régime de retraite à prestations déterminées et régime enregistré d’épargne-retraite (REER) collectif 

Programmes personnels et familiaux : Programme de bien-être physique et programme d’indemnité supplémentaire de maternité 

Équilibre entre le travail et la vie personnelle : Horaires flexibles et « vendredis californiens » toute l’année 

Plaisir au travail : Activités sociales et communautaires toute l’année! 


Avec plus de 10 000 employés présents à travers 35 pays, CAE est un chef de file mondial en formation dans les domaines de l’aviation civile, de la défense et sécurité, et de la santé. Pour en apprendre plus : www.cae.com

Passionate about your field? Looking for a work environment where you can innovate, reach greater heights and collaborate with experts from a wide range of sectors? Want to join a world class company and industry leader with projects to which you would be proud to contribute? Then CAE is the right employer for you! Come share your passion with us!



The Role We Are Offering You



At CAE, our teams are committed to staying innovative and on the leading edge. By joining our centralized planning and control team for global software engineering, you will have the opportunity to participate actively in the following processes execution: hiring, training, simulators demos, budgets follow-up and more! That’s why we need your expertise and passion to complete our team!

Here are some tasks specific to this role, in support to the Engineering activities:


 Participation in recruitment 

Follow-up on the process around the interviews (link with HR, scheduling, results, reports updates)

New employee’s onboarding : (notices of visits, computers, identifications cards, security levels)

 Simulators demos 

Reception and analysis of the requests, requirements and devices availability validation, plan and scheduling of resources, feedback after the demo

 Budgets 

Follow-up and reports on charges and expenses

 Equipment purchase management 

 Other administrative tasks as required 




Our Ideal Candidate Has




 Perfectly bilingual (French and English). 

 College or professional degree in secretarial studies, or equivalent combination of related training and experience. 

 1 to 3 years previous experience as an Administrative Assistant is an asset. 

 Team spirit, flexible, ability to work in a fast-paced environment. 

 Ability to effectively manage the pressure and stress imposed by deadlines. 

 Effective time management and planification; taking into account multiple tasks in parallel. 

 Ability to create positive relationships with colleagues and internal customers at all levels. 

 In-depth knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite and willingness to learn new software tools. 




CAE Offers




Benefits: fully flexible for you to choose what is important

Retirement: Defined Benefits Retirement Plan & Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)

Personal and Family Programs: Physical Wellness Plan & Supplementary Maternity Plan

Work-Life Balance: Flextime & California Fridays all year

Fun at work: social and community events all-year round


With over 10,000 employees located in 35 countries, CAE is a global leader in training for the civil aviation, defence and security, and healthcare markets. To learn more: www.cae.com


Position Type


Regular

CAE thanks all applicants for their interest. However, only those whose background and experience match the requirements of the role will be contacted.


Equal Employment Opportunity


At CAE, everyone is welcome to contribute to our success. With no exception.

As captured in our overarching value "One CAE", we’re proud to work as one passionate, boundaryless and inclusive team.

At CAE, all employees are welcome regardless of race, nationality, colour, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability or age.

The masculine form may be used in this job description solely for ease of reading, but refers to men, women and the gender diverse.

industries: Accounting
description:
Inspirational, innovative and entrepreneurial - this is how we describe our empowered teams. Combine your passion with purpose and join a culture that is thriving in the face of change.

Make an impact with our Accounting Services team as Accounting Administrative Clerk. This diverse team of professionals performs a variety of bookkeeping and accounting duties in support of our firm’s business operations. As a trusted advisor, you’ll identify challenges, problem solve and drive efficiencies while contributing to the success of our firm and our clients.

MNP is proudly Canadian. Providing business strategies and solutions, we are a leading national accounting, tax and business advisory firm in Canada. Entrepreneurial to our core, our talented team members transcend obstacles into opportunities and are successfully transforming mid-market business practices.


Responsibilities



Create and provide administration of projects in a proprietary time billing system, ensuring that correct project attributes and approvals are in place

Liaise with project managers ensuring timely billing of projects

Prepare and distribute AR invoices from Accpac reviewing coding and sales tax treatment

Reconcile payment data from various customer portals to AR aging

Communicate with customers on billing enquiries

Review accounts receivable and assist with collections

Maintain employee & contractor profiles

Provide oversight and follow up ensuring the integrity of the time billing process

Record deposits and follow up on remittance details

Assist with month end and year end finance processes

Complete other ad hoc duties and reports as required

Maintain relationships in good standing with Partners and Office Administrators

Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes




Skills And Experience



Minimum of two years of related accounting or administrative experience

Diploma or degree in accounting or business or equivalent experience is an asset

Experience working in a Professional Services environment is considered an asset

Strong computer literacy including intermediate level Microsoft Excel and effective working skills of Microsoft Word

Experience with Accpac or Agresso is considered an asset

Excellent interpersonal skills 

Proven mathematical and analytical skills

Excellent organization and time management skills




MyRewards@MNP 


More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration.

Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!

industries: Leasing Non-residential Real Estate and Leasing Real Estate
description:
Working as part of the Winnipeg Real Estate Services Team, the Property Administrator will report to the Property Manager and will provide day-to-day operations support related to the Winnipeg Portfolio.






Responsibilities




Data Management:


This position will be responsible for the integrity of data relating to building components. The data is of utmost importance as all processes rely on its integrity.


Populate and update building equipment specs and details into the company’s data management system, Angus.

Create work orders in Angus for preventative maintenance on HVAC and fire life safety equipment, only closing work orders once the repair has been completed and once all documentation on the repair has been filed.

Locate and file reports for items such as asbestos assessments, HVAC and fire life safety systems.

Manage and maintain the electronic filing systems relating to the operation of the properties.

Create and update building fact sheets based on building condition assessment reports and data provided by the Operations Manager.






Coordination/Communication:


This position will involve coordination and organization between many different parties. Strong communication and analytical skills are essential. 


Ensure that all vendors are approved in our vendor management system, Avetta, by bridging the discussion between the vendor and Avetta.

Ensure field staff are completing vacant unit inspections and quarterly building inspections. File.

Serve as liaison with City of Winnipeg’s Planning, Property & Development Department regarding permits.

Assist vendors with permits by providing the necessary floor plans and filling out City of Winnipeg documentation.

Annually, request work orders/preventative maintenance reports from tenants who manage their own systems such as HVAC and fire life safety.

Coordinate annual visits with each tenant and track via spreadsheet.

Coordinate with government jurisdictions such as the Fire Commission to close off notices and violations.

Coordinate annual asbestos and environmental inspections with tenants.

Serve as bridge with Leasing to answer questions regarding building equipment and provide specs when a unit becomes vacant.

Create and close off impairment notices required when the fire life safety system is disabled for repairs.

Coordinate internal inspections such as the quarterly meter reading inspections.

Initiate conversations with tenants to ensure that they are satisfied with the help they received for their recent service call.






General:



Serve as administrative support to our field staff.

Serve as vacation back-up to our Administrative Assistant and Property Administrator.

Gain a complete understanding and adherence to the Environmental Policy, the Code of Conduct and other policies and procedures relevant to the position as prescribed from time to time.

Other duties as assigned.






Qualifications:




Experience 
- 2+ years of data management experience. Property management experience is an asset.


Relationship Skills 
- Superior oral and written communication and presentation skills; ability to develop and sustain cooperative working relationships, ability to exercise confidentiality. Professional phone manner.


Organizational/Multi-Task Skills
 - A highly organized individual who has an eye for detail and accuracy. Ability to allocate one's time effectively and independently, work under pressure and manage tight deadlines; ability to handle multiple demands and competing priorities and adapt to new ideas and constant changes.


Computer Skills
 - Advanced skills in Microsoft Office. Database and information management experience.





QuadReal Property Group will provide reasonable accommodation at any time throughout the hiring process for applicants with disabilities or for those needing job postings in an alternate format. If you require accommodation, please advise the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with and include the following: Job posting #, your name and your preferred method of contact.




QuadReal has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy that requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for everyone working in our offices or sites. Accordingly, a successful candidate offered employment at QuadReal will need to provide proof of full vaccination prior to commencing employment, subject exemptions permitted under applicable employment and human rights legislation.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Staffing and Recruiting, and Human Resources Services
description:
Location: Saskatoon, SK, Canada Job Type: Permanent Date: 3/6/2022 Job ID: 9C89523736 Category: Office Professionals

David Aplin Group, one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, has partnered with our well-established client in Saskatoon in their search for an Office Manager / Bookkeeper. If you are looking for the next step in your career, then this is the job for you!


Benefits & Features



A unique position within a growing company that is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce

A company that invests in its culture and their employees

Competitive compensation and a health spending account


Responsibilities


As the Office Manager / Bookkeeper, you will report to the Controller and ensure that the office operates smoothly and efficiently.


You will handle payroll for a small team and also be responsible for Accounts Receivable and Payable

In addition, you’ll enter daily financial transactions into Sage 100 and prepare bank deposits

You will keep the office running smoothly by ensuring all equipment is serviced and relevant materials stocked

The Office Manager will act as a champion of the culture, organization, and team.


Qualifications



Minimum 5+ years of office administration/bookkeeping

Strong organizational and planning skills

Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment

Strong attention to detail to maintain organizational systems

A creative mind with an ability to suggest procedural improvements



If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted. (Job ID 9C89523736)


David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: 

www.aplin.com

industries: Business Consulting and Services
description:
Qualifications




University degree preferred 

Must have Government of Canada SECRET Security Clearance

Bilingual (English + French) an asset

Excellent administrative and organizational skills

Track record of demonstrated ownership through responsibility and accountability for end products

Highly professional telephone presence and strong customer service mindset and style

Strong email and calendaring skills (Outlook proficiency preferred); proficiency in PowerPoint, Word and Excel

Ability to work expertly and effectively in a dynamic, deadline-driven environment

Inventive in problem solving and high tolerance for ambiguity

Excellent professional standards, discernment and discretion when taking care of sensitive information

Ability to establish relationships with both local colleagues and those working in other offices

Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written




What You'll Do



You will work with your assigned consultants and managers as an Executive Assistant to organize and leverage their time effectively. You will also manage their complex schedules and coordinate their travel logistics.

You will coordinate government security screening for our public sector practice. This involves serving as Company Security Officer (CSO) contact for government contracts alongside our public sector client development leader.

In this role, you will assume responsibility for planning, organizing and executing major projects (e.g. calls and meetings entailing coordination of schedules of senior leadership participants). You will also be responsible for planning client and internal meetings, conference calls, conferences/events and lunches/dinners.

You will collaborate with clients, client administrative contacts and with department members in creating smooth workflow including soliciting assistance from others as needed and helping others, as appropriate, and maintaining follow-through. You will have flexibility to ensure appropriate, timely actions and that deadlines are met. You will also act as liaison for assigned individuals to ensure that various departments provide requested support in an efficient, timely manner.

You will coordinate new security screening applications for consultants and McKinsey people. You will serve as Company Security Officer (CSO) for PSPC Contract Security, and maintain Designated Organization Screening (DOS) and Facility Security Clearance (FSC) status. You will organize and maintain calendar(s) for assigned partner and/or associate partner. You will manage all communications including responding to correspondence that does not require personal attention of client service professionals. You will handle all telephone calls in a professional and efficient manner. You will develop strong ongoing rapport with assistants supporting client executives.

You will produce accurate, properly formatted documents and reports, frequently under tight time constraints. You will provide range of administrative support (e.g., travel scheduling, file organization, expense report submission, accounting administration) to effectively provide leverage to client service professionals. When needed, you will support the planning and execution of major projects, conferences and other off-site meetings. You will work collaboratively with other executive assistants to ensure backup coverage.



Who You'll Work With



You’ll work in Toronto or Ottawa as part of our Canadian office.

Our Canadian locations include more than 700 consulting and non-consulting colleagues. You’ll be part of our Canadian EA team, comprising of 4 offices across Canada Calgary, Montreal, Toronto and Vancouver. You will support 1-2 partners or associate partners in our Toronto Office and report to the manager of executive assistants for Canada.

Your role will be a dual hat of executive assistant and security coordinator.

description:
The Front Desk Attendant is responsible for welcoming all members, guest and prospects into the club. The primary role of all FFC employees is to gain and retain members. The primary role of all FFC employees is to gain and retain members. True to our company core value of Safety, all FFC employees wear face masks while working.



Benefit Highlights




Medical (FT), Dental, Vision and voluntary 

Company paid life 

401k

Paid Time Off

Complimentary Club Membership

Discounts on spa, fitness, and retail




Essential Job Functions




Greet members by name and create a great first impression of the club

Check in members and guests to the club

Act as liaison between current and prospective members and Membership Department

Answer incoming calls professionally 

Field all member questions, concerns and complaint; Provide additional support to the Membership Experience Manager as needed

Perform opening and closing functions regarding the front desk

Take payment as needed and ensure cash drawer is balanced at the start and end of shift

Attend all required department and club staff meetings

Provide a clean, safe and healthy environment for members, guests and co-workers




Qualifications




Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with energy and enthusiasm 

Passionate about the health and fitness industry

Ability to multi-task, demonstrate initiative and strong work ethic

Physical requirements include: walking and standing during the entire shift (often 4-8 hours), climbing stairs, kneeling to clean floors, pushing, and pulling objects, lifting and moving objects (up to 50 lbs.), and cleaning with or without reasonable accommodation. 




Our Purpose



"To enhance the lives of our members and guests by improving their overall health and well-being."

Our members, guests, and staff are as diverse as the city we call home. We are "Chicago from Day One," and we are committed to building a respectful and inclusive community.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
Un de nos clients, une organisation dans le domaine de la santé, est à la recherche d'un(e) Assistant(e) en comptabilité et administration. Sous l'autorité de l'adjointe exécutive et du département des finances, vous serez responsable des tâches comptables, de contrôle en documentation et de diverses tâches administratives.

De façon plus précise, vos fonctions seront les suivantes :


Tâches comptables



Réconciliations bancaires

Comptabilisation et suivi des factures payables

Facturation - comptabilisation et suivi des recevables

Préparation des paiements, encaissements et dépôts bancaires

Réconciliation fin-de-mois des comptes payables et recevables

Maintien des dossiers sur Sharepoint, classement et archivage selon procédures internes

Suivi et résolutions des différences dans les comptes-fournisseurs

Autres tâches comptables et administratives connexes selon besoin



Tâches relatives au contrôle documentaire



Traiter les courriels (envoi, réception, distribution aux différents directeurs)

Distribuer les correspondances entrantes, sortantes et internes à l’aide de Outlook et/ou Aconex; tout en s’assurant que l’information entrée est précise et à jour en tout temps

Réviser et mettre en page les correspondances sortantes

Effectuer les correspondances requises dans le respect des règles établies

Classer des documents relatifs aux projets dans le système informatique

Maintenir des registres de correspondances, faire le suivi et la relance des actions



Tâches administratives



Maintien et approvisionnement des fournitures de bureau

Coordination avec le service TI pour les demandes internes

Triage et distribution du courrier

Préparations pour réunions du comité de gestion

Autres tâches administratives selon besoin



Horaire du lundi au vendredi de 8h30 à 17h30 (flexible)



Poste en télétravail jusqu'en mai



À compter du mois de mai (nouveaux locaux), poste en présentiel (à proximité du Métro Champs-de-Mars)



Avantages Sociaux




Assurances collectives

Bonus après 1 an

Contribution pour régime d'épargne retraite

Diplôme d’études professionnelles ou diplôme d’études collégiales en comptabilité/administration

Expérience avec la facturation, comptes payables, et autres tâches comptables et administratives

Maîtrise de MS Office (Outlook, Word et Excel) et d’Acrobat Adobe Pro

Expérience avec logiciel comptable (requise) – expérience avec logiciel Acomba - un atout

Expérience en gestion de documents avec la plateforme Aconex - un atout

Bonne maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit

Grande autonomie et discrétion

Goût d’apprendre diverses tâches et flexibilité

Aime le travail de bureau

Sens de l’initiative, de l’organisation, de gestion de priorités et d’échéanciers

Favorise l’esprit d’équipe et l’entraide ; honnêteté, ponctualité

industries: Staffing and Recruiting
description:
Le domaine administratif et de la santé vous intéressent ? Notre client est l’un des établissements les plus importants en santé et service sociaux au Québec. À ce jour, il compte plus de 19000 employés, dont 3000 dans leur secteur administratif.

Il a pour principale mission de contribuer activement à améliorer la santé globale de la population. Axé sur la qualité et la sécurité, il met l’usager au centre de ses décisions et de ses actions.

Notre client est donc à la recherche de personnes comme vous, qui partagent ses valeurs, pour occuper des postes à titre de secrétaire médicale.

Des postes à temps plein sont donc à combler, vous avez la possibilité d’occuper un poste de jour, de soir ou de nuit.


TalentWorld 
recrute des 
secrétaires médicales 
pour l’un de ses clients dans le domaine de la santé à 
Québec.



Les responsabilités du poste de secrétaire médicale : 



Assiste les médecins et les professionnels dans leurs tâches administratives

Prépare et saisie des données médicales, des rapports, des demandes d’analyse, des protocoles opératoires à partir de textes écrits, manuscrits ou dictés

Accueille les usagers, fixe les rendez-vous, reçoit et transmet les messages destinés au personnel concerné et aux usagers

Traite le courrier et rédige la correspondance

Tient à jour le classement des dossiers

Effectue diverses tâches connexes



Les exigences au poste de secrétaire médicale : 



AEC en transcription médicale

Expérience en lien avec l’emploi (un atout important)

Excellente maîtrise de la langue française parlée et écrite

Très bonne connaissance de la suite Office (Word, Excel)

Connaissance de la terminologie médicale

Bonne gestion des priorités et du stress

Organisation, rigueur, autonomie, polyvalence et professionnalisme



 Les Conditions D’emploi 



Type d’emploi : Temporaire à temps plein (durée indéterminée)

Quart de travail : Jour, soir ou nuit selon les besoins 

Salaire : 21,60 $ de l’heure 

Lieu : Québec

Entrée en poste dès maintenant 



Intéressé par l’emploi de secrétaire à Québec ? 


Adressez-nous votre candidature dès maintenant. Vous pourriez débuter l’emploi dans de courts délais !

Si vous avez des questions, vous pouvez me joindre :

Courriel : [email protected]


À propos de TalentWorld


Des adaptations sont disponibles sur demande pour soutenir votre participation à toutes les étapes du processus de recrutement.

industries: Construction and Leasing Real Estate
description:
All companies under the Great Gulf umbrella are united by one simple goal: the pursuit of greatness. It’s achieved daily with the passion and dedication of every person who works tirelessly to make us great. If you have what it takes to make great things happen, apply today to join our team.





SUMMARY





Reporting to the Vice President, Strategic Initiatives & Operations (VP), the Administrative Coordinator – PMO, will be responsible for managing the administrative requirements of the VP, as well as serving as a key laison within the various stakeholder of the PMO group. The Coordinator will also be responsible for a variety of PMO-related initiatives and projects.





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES






Providing administrative support to VP, Strategic Initiatives & Operations, including: coordination of meetings, events, travel and other executive assistant duties

Coordinating the VPs priorities with various stakeholders, partners and service providers

Taking meeting minutes and compiling summary reports, when required.

 Providing administrative support to senior PMO staff on an as-needed basis

Occasionally attending to site-specific issues and providing Property administrative support, as required

Providing timely coverage when VP is unavailable

Occasionally assisting with creation and distribution of Purchase Orders and other minor accounting-related tasks

Organizing PMO employee engagement events, including: town halls, socials and collaborative exercises.

Managing existing and on-going PMO programs/initiatives, including: procurement, software deployment, uniforms, and vehicles.

Collaborating with senior PMO staff to create and manage structure, policies and procedures for the Department, with input from the Executive Team and HR.

Leading new administrative efficiency optimization projects for PMO

Managing PMO’s archives and electronic record keeping systems

Liaising between the PMO group and other departments

Creating and updating PMO Directories and other information

Preparing, updating and distributing PMO Onboarding Package for new staff

Working closely with VP, on various initiatives, including site specific and portfolio-wide projects of various complexities while maintaining strict confidentiality.

Preparing presentations, hand-outs, research briefing and other materials relating to potential and existing markets, assets and opportunities.

Assisting with current and prospective stakeholder engagement initiatives

Reviewing and summarizing key items from Building Condition Assessments

Assisting with the review and prompt delivery of due diligence materials on acquisitions and dispositions

Preparing various proposals, expenses and reports, as well as general documentation for various projects and initiatives.

Issuing Purchase Orders (PO’s) and Change Orders (CO’s), when required.

Coordinating the issuance of invoices to owners and following up to ensure payments are received.

Ensuring pre-construction and project close out documentation is received, when required.

Filing all received documents accordingly, in company shared drive.

Issuing notices to Tenants as required, per Lease obligations.

Completing site checks for ongoing Tenant projects, when requested.

Assisting with development, implementation and monitoring of environmental programs and policies

Researching and advising management about evolving environmental matters related to the real estate industry

Assisting with staff and tenant training in accordance with programs and policies

Promoting stakeholder environmental awareness and education

Assisting with environmental audits, and identifying areas for improvement

Keeping records to ensure PMO compliance with environmental laws

Assisting with preparations and keep track of budgets for environmental programs









EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND QUALIFICATIONS






Undergraduate university degree or an equivalent acceptable combination of education and experience

Dynamic, outgoing and positive personality that is complimented by an approachable and collaborative disposition.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Keen attention to detail, deadlines and other project/task requirements

Strong follow-through skills and an ability to bring tasks and projects to conclusion

Ability to multi-task, to be adaptive and flexible in a fast-paced and changing environment

Ability to prepare marketing materials, communications and presentations

Fluid Microsoft Office knowledge with emphasis on Excel, Word, Power Point and Visio

Ability to gather data, compile information and prepare reports

Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision, while remaining productive and motivated

Desire to learn grow and evolve with a rapidly changing real estate organization

Experience with property management and/or project management is an asset









The Great Gulf Group (“GGG”) is committed to protecting the health and safety of our employees, our tradespeople and suppliers, and our customers and visitors. Employment with GGG is conditional upon you having received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine series approved by Health Canada at least 14 days prior to your start date. You must provide a copy of your Ministry of Health COVID-19 Vaccine Dose. If you have a medical reason, or any other reason pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, for not being fully vaccinated now or in the future, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the ground and/or any supporting documentation to assist in the determination of exemption from this condition.

industries: Non-profit Organizations, Wellness and Fitness Services, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Job Description



In accordance with the Vision, Purpose, and Values, and strategic direction of the Vancouver Island Health Authority (Island Health) patient and staff safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone; as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position.

Reporting to the Manager, Short Term Intervention Services, the Central Team Clerk supports the site's centralized interdisciplinary teams including the Quick Response Team (QRT), Community Liaison Nurses and Central Intake/Central Booking. The Team Clerk provides records management, word processing, admitting, data entry, communications and other administrative support services according to regional standards.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Education, Training And Experience


High school graduation, including courses in word processing, databases, spreadsheets and office administration; plus a Certificate in Medical Terminology. Two years general office experience in an administrative support including experience with database systems and with the use of medical terminology, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Knowledge of office practices and filing systems. Knowledge of businessEnglish, spelling, punctuation, current office methods and procedures and equipment.



Skills And Abilities




Ability to type 50 wpm.

Ability to operate a computer including word processing, database and spreadsheet software.

An aptitude for mathematics.

Ability to communicate orally and in writing.

Ability to compose routine letters and memoranda.

Ability to work within deadlines.

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with professionals, other team members and the general public.




Link To Full Job Description



https://jd.viha.ca/JD17.pdf

We are hiring an Organizational Guru for Real Estate





We’re hiring a motivated real estate administrative assistant to join our high volume fast-paced growing real estate team. Our ideal candidate will have superb organizational skills, a knack for customer service and have as much passion for helping people as we do. You will be responsible for servicing clients with the highest level of service.

Responsibilities include administrative duties such as keeping track of all transaction documents in the client database / CRM, monitoring and notifying clients of important deadlines- updating calendars, complying with legal procedures, and planning appointments, listing photos, staging appointments and final walkthroughs, preparing contracts, transaction maintenance, writing property descriptions, monthly newsletters and blog posts. You’ll also support the team by marketing the company on social media.

The ideal candidate should be a great communicator who is driven, well written and highly detail-oriented. If this position interests you, start your application today!



Responsibilities




Produce all marketing materials including brochures, flyers, online marketing, social media posts, etc. to continuously build our brand

Take part in employee development programs to strengthen existing skill sets in real estate administration

Help organize community outreach events to improve our standing in the local area

Fulfill client requests for information or other relevant transaction services in a quick and friendly manner

Fill out all appropriate paperwork and file in the customer database to assist the real estate team in closing deals

Notify transaction participants when a deadline is approaching

Update and maintain CRM

Writing Listing Descriptions and loading information onto MLS database

Writing blog posts

Updates to website - similar to Wordpress for backend

Researching Property Titles and Registered Documents

Assisting with condo document packages for clients

Scheduling vendor appointments for inspections, measuring, photos, ordering sign up/ down, condo document review, and home staging.




Qualifications




Either already has or is working towards real estate license

Weekend and evening availability

High school diploma or equivalent required

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Possesses a basic understanding of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and customer database systems

Prior experience in the real estate industry or as an office manager

Be knowledgable with social media platforms

Comfortable reading and understanding contracts







About CalgaryListings Group



Are you passionate about real estate as we are? We have been selling homes since 1997 in Calgary. In 2021 we assisted 135 clients buy or sell their home in all price ranges in and around the Calgary area.

Technology plays an important role in how we communicate with each other as well as our clients. We offer a competitive salary, flexibility in your work schedule, bonuses and advancement opportunities.

description:
Under the direction of the Front of House Management Team, Server Assistants provide support to Servers by inspecting all tables for the proper mise en place, cleanliness and completeness. They practice a high level of floor awareness and have exceptional knowledge of all food and beverage items.



PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES



•Answer questions about food, beverages, wine and other restaurant functions and services when necessary



•Assist with food running, ensuring that plates arrive to the proper guest (no auctioning off)



•Communicate with Servers and Hosts to maximize seating



•Practice a high level of floor awareness and clear/clean as required



•Follow all food safety standards and systems



•Empty garbage, change linen bags and dispose of garbage and recycling



•Communicate to all Servers any comments or information provided by guests to ensure a positive, memorable experience



•Other duties as assigned or required





Qualifications



•A Degree/ Diploma in Hospitality or equivalent considered an asset



•Smart Serve Certification a requirement



•High attention to detail



•Ability to remain calm under pressure while working in a fast-paced environment



•Organizational skills



•Ability to take direction and prioritize



•Strong oral communication skills



•High level of product knowledge

job_title: Part-Time Medical Office Administrator (HCP Echo Valley)
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
The Company

HealthCare Plus Medical Centre is a subsidiary of Think Research.

Hours


Wednesday & Friday

Availability between 9am – 1pm.



Why Us?


It's not every day that you have the chance to change the way your friends and family are cared for - Make an impact!

Be a part of the digital disruption happening in healthcare and do challenging, meaningful work 

We’re growing, and so will you with leaders who will support your development through mentorship and other opportunities

Collaborative, creative, dynamic and flexible work environment, with a start-up spirit



The Role

HealthCare Plus is looking for an experienced Medical Office Administrator for our Parkdale location. This is a part-time permanent position.

You Will Have The Opportunity To:


Daily patient intake and registration.

Answer and respond to regular and frequent phone calls for patient bookings and follow-up questions.

Monitor, track and follow up with patients to schedule incomplete and outstanding treatment.

Collect payment from patients for non-OHIP visit fees.

Manage patient bookings / referral processes.

 Daily clerical tasks such as, but not limited to: scanning and faxing medical records, collecting mail, managing petty cash, filing, archiving files, and maintaining inventory.

Gather, record and update medical, personal and insurance information from patients.

Maintain consultation rooms and waiting areas by keeping rooms tidy, sanitizing surface areas and stocking supplies as needed.



What You Will Bring


At least one year previous administrative experience in a medical practice/clinic/hospital/healthcare facility

Experience with Telus PS Suite or other electronic medical record software

 Medical Office Assistant certificate considered an asset.

Experience with OHIP billing, handling submissions of claims and remittance reports is an asset.

 Exceptional organizational skills with strong attention to details

Excellent interpersonal skills and team player

 Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment

Strong written and verbal communication skills



HCP and Think Research welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. HCP is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. Should you require an accommodation, we would like to work with you to meet your needs.

industries: Construction
description:
We are Chandos





Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.



These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. 
They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture.
 And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!



We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 



Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.



Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.



 



The Office Manager is responsible for planning and overseeing all administrative support and office services for the company. This includes coordinating and communicating office activities, reception duties, contract management, supplies and stationery, and general troubleshooting. The office manager is also responsible for assisting the Safety Department in ensuring the safety of the organization’s facilities and assets.





Qualifications



-        Post-secondary diploma in business administration or relevant discipline.



-        Five or more years' experience in an administrative role is preferred.



-        Strong knowledge of office procedures and practices.



-        Keen attention to details.



-        Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint.



-        Resourceful and flexible.



-        Proven organizational and time-management skills.



 





Additional Information



Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 



We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.





We are 100% employee owned
. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only 
one class
 of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be 
treated equal
. We talk about being an 
entrepreneurial-minded
 organization and you can be sure we mean it!


Competitive wages



Well rounded employer paid benefits program 
including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program


RRSP matching program
 to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security


Educational assistance 
for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education


Recognition and annual salary reviews program



Leadership conferences 
that allow employees to connect and collaborate


Regular company-wide engagement
 opportunities



The health and safety of our employees, families, industry partners, clients, and communities remains of the utmost importance.  That’s why we’re taking several steps to reduce the spread of COVID-19.





As of November 15, 2021, Chandos Construction requires all employees across the country to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. This is in line with our values and commitment to all stakeholders.

industries: Travel Arrangements
description:
Earls Kitchen + Bar


Some 36 years ago, Leroy “Bus” Earl Fuller and his son Stanley Earl Fuller had a simple idea: to create a laid-back burger and beer joint filled with warm, friendly people. The first Earls restaurant opened in Edmonton, Alberta in 1984, and it quickly took off — and Earls has never looked back, opening locations across Canada and all over the US. While much has changed since Bus and Stan opened the first Earls restaurant all those years ago, many things are the same — Earls is still a family-owned business, run by great people who are passionate about serving delicious food and drinks in an inviting environment.

Today, Earls is based in Vancouver, British Columbia and has 67 locations across North America. Earls remains committed to offering guests premium globally-inspired food, with exceptional service in an authentic atmosphere.


 The Server Assistant


Server Assistants at Earls love hospitality. They are the ones the team turns to for support, and the people our leaders turn to for real, honest feedback on how we can do things better. This role requires a passion for being around people, and also for going above and beyond to create an incredible experience for our loyal guests.

If you’re looking for an opportunity to gain service experience in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, this is the role for you!

Joining Earls also comes with perks to support you in your personal and professional journey. We’re committed to teamwork, community, and your learning and development. Our ultimate goal is that you leave here with tools in your pocket to live a life you’re on fire for; whether you stay with the company for 5 weeks or 5 (or more!) years.



As a Server Assistant, You’ll




 Assist our servers in creating an exceptional guest experience by delivering drinks, staging tables for food service, and maintaining the server station and passthrough

 Be the foundation behind impeccable service, creating the Earls Experience for each and every guest

 Optimize section turnovers and table maintenance by achieving flawless operations

 Create an environment of connected, committed teamwork through non-stop communication and the willingness to help others win

 Be the life of the party, keeping fun the focus of every interaction




What You Bring To The Floor




 The belief that people are the source of extraordinary experiences, and the desire to deliver exemplary guest experiences, every day

 Ninja-status time and task organization/prioritization skills, a willingness to learn and an openness to feedback, coaching and mentorship

 Communication skills that foster seamless teamwork and smooth-sailing-shifts

 Required certifications to responsibly serve alcohol (specific to your province)

 The ability to legally work in Canada (as a citizen, resident or holding other current and valid work permit)



 Apply Now!


Due to loads of keen and skilled applicants ready to take their career to the next level with us, we will only be responding to candidates who we would like to move forward to the interview stage with.

We can’t wait to hear from you!

industries: Movies and Sound Recording
description:
Company Description


TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR REMOTE WORK YOU MUST RESIDE IN MONTREAL


This job application remains open even when we don’t have roles available. If you would like to be considered, please apply and we will contact you as soon as we have an opening


At Technicolor, we unite artistry and creativity with technology and innovation to create extraordinary experiences for audiences everywhere. Our award-winning visual effects studios, MPC Film, and MR. X our new Montreal studio MPC Episodic, work with the world’s most imaginative storytellers, to help create out of this world experiences. Film and Episodic Visual Effects (FEV) is the group which combines these brands to help leverage our knowledge and experience across the globe.


Job Description


The Central Production Executive Assistant will provide support to the senior management teams at Technicolor Creative Studios. The successful candidate will have strong organizational skills, communication skills, and enjoy customer service and support. Regular tasks include:


Senior Management Team Support



Support with Systems assistance, raising tickets

Ad hoc administrative tasks: Printing, scanning, etc

Optimal calendar management: cross-site meetings, time-zone conscientiousness

Preparing expense reports using Concur platform

Coordinate travel arrangements using Concur platform, upon request.

Ad-hoc requests from SMT

Work with operations team to support with event organization and restaurant bookings

Minutes for regular meeting, as requested

Onboarding support for supervisors, producers, and managers

Coordinating and execution of plans with necessary departments and Heads for internal visitors: main contact for internal visitors – coordinate with Executive Assistants at other sites to coordinate internal visits. Communicate action items required by WFP, systems, and operations teams

Coordinating and execution of plans with necessary departments and Heads for Client Visits: communicate action items required by WFP, systems, and operations teams

 Attendance tracking, upon request

Attaining visas and travel documents



Operations Support



Filter SMT requests accordingly to specific operations support

Minutes for facilities and operations meetings

Assist in Health and Safety Committee management and organization

Holiday Report / Kronos tracking

Feedback on Systems Support and 'fact-checking' information, at times in onboarding Post-Mortems

Ongoing documentation of existing and new processes: Concur, DASH, Onboarding, Accesses, Processes Teams Chat

OT Weekend Projection


__________________________________________________________


Les Taches Régulières Comprennent


L’assistant exécutif pour la production centrale apportera son soutien aux équipes de direction de Technicolor Creative Studios. Le candidat retenu aura de solides compétences organisationnelles, des compétences en communication et appréciera le service et le soutien à la clientèle.


Soutien 

à

 l’équipe de direction senior



Support avec l’assistance des Systèmes, la collecte de tickets

Tâches administratives : impression, numérisation, etc.

Gestion optimale du calendrier ; réunions inter-sites, respect des fuseaux horaires

Préparation des rapports financiers à l’aide de la plateforme Concur

Coordonner les préparatifs de voyage a l’aide de la plateforme Concur, sur demande

Demandes par l’équipe de direction

Travailler avec l’équipe des opérations pour soutenir l’organisation d’évènements et les réservations de restaurants

Prises des notes de réunion, sur demande

Support d’intégration pour les superviseurs, les producteurs et les gestionnaires

Coordination et exécution des plans avec les départements nécessaires et les chefs pour les visiteurs internes – coordonner avec les assistants exécutifs sur d’autres sites pour coordonner les visites internes. Communiquer les actions requises par le PAM, les systèmes et les équipes opérationnelles

Coordination et exécution des plans avec les départements nécessaires et les chefs des visites des clients : communiquer les éléments d’action requis par le PAM, les systèmes et les équipes opérationnelles

Suivi des présences, sur demande

Obtenir des visas et des documents de voyage



Soutien aux opérations



Filtrer les demandes de l’équipe de direction en fonction de la prise en charge d’opérations spécifiques

Prises des notes des réunions sur les installations et les opérations

Aider à la gestion et à l’organisation du comité de santé et sécurité

Rapport de vacances / Suivi Kronos

Commentaires sur l’assistance des systèmes et les informations de « vérification des faits », parfois lors de l’intégration des post-mortem

Documentation continue des processus existants et nouveaux : Concur, DASH, Onboarding, Accès, Processus Teams Chat

Projections du temps supplémentaire leur de week-end



Qualifications



Qualifications:



Exceptional commitment to customer service and support

Ability to anticipate needs and action tasks proactively

Organized and efficient

Strong communication skills, oral and written

Strong problem-solving skills

Ability to work efficiently under tight deadlines and prioritize tasks

Strong attention to detail

Team player

Personable and calm nature

Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

Bilingual (English and French), oral and written


__________________________________________________________


Les Attributs Désirent



Engagement exceptionnel envers le service client et l’assistance

Capacité à anticiper les besoins et les taches de manière proactive

Organisé et efficace

Solides compétences en communication, orale et écrit

Solides compétences en résolution de problèmes

Capacité à travailler efficacement dans des délais serrés et à hiérarchiser les taches

Grande attention aux détails

Esprit de collaboration

Agréable et calme

Solide connaissance de Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel et PowerPoint)

Bilingue (anglais et français), oral et écrit



Additional Information


Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to tcstalent@technicolor.com and we'll be happy to assist.


TECHNICOLOR IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER


Technicolor complies and prohibits against discrimination on the basis of race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, medical condition (including genetic characteristics), mental and/or physical disability or handicap, marital status, sex, age, veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity, political party preference, political belief, socioeconomic status, familial status, registered domestic partner status, military service, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions and any other characteristic or activity protected by federal, state/provincial or local law.

description:
Real Estate Executive Assistant (Chinese speaking preferred)




We’re in search of an organized, professional real estate executive assistant to serve as the main point of contact for the principal broker. Your responsibilities include relaying important messages to the broker, scheduling the broker’s meetings and trips, and systematizing information in the client databases. Experience in the real estate industry preferred

High school diploma or G.E.D. required

Familiar with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Multiple Listing Service

industries: Retail Groceries, Manufacturing, and Retail
description:
Position Summary...
The Pharmacy Assistant assists the Pharmacist in the technical aspects of prescription filling and administrative duties in order to increase the Pharmacist's opportunity to provide patient care. The Pharmacy Assistant is expected to participate in all aspects of Pharmacy Operations required of a team player. They are a key member in the delivery of superior customer service.



What You'll Do...




 Receiving prescriptions from patients, following provincial legal/regulatory conditions and assessing the prescription for completeness i.e. Name; Address; DOB; Allergies; 3rd Party Information; Any Special Requests; Prescriber; Generic/Brand; Prioritizing Prescriptions with 21st Century Guidelines.

 Performing Computer Functions as directed by the Pharmacist i.e. Data Entry; Price Check; Patient Information Entry/Update; Competent interpretation and processing of written prescriptions including Latin abbreviations, drug name recognition, dosage calculations; Refills; Report Generation; Patient Profile checks.

 Filling prescriptions (always under the Pharmacist’s supervision), selecting appropriate products, performing the accuracy program, including 7 point, Visual and DIN checks, selecting and counting/ measuring & preparing appropriate products, labeling and organizing for pharmacist checking, gaining necessary approvals for verbal refills where authorized, employing 'STOP' forms if applicable and facilitating all aspects of Cognitive Services.

 Maintaining Inventory Control, assisting Pharmacist in maintaining appropriate stock levels of drugs and supplies, checking for and pulling expired medications at least monthly, cleaning up Will Call Bin of 'stale' prescriptions on a regular basis, writing up returns, ordering of drugs and supplies, using preferred wholesaler for Pharmacy purchases as much as possible i.e. Kohl and Frisch, operating of the Telxon gun, checking off, pricing and putting away pharmacy orders, zoning the pharmacy shelves, 'X- ing' bottles when opened and interchangeable drug knowledge and appropriate maintenance/selection of key brands/preferred generics.

 General Housekeeping, stocking Prescription filling supplies (Vials, labels, bags), keeping the dispensary clean, organized and neat, maintaining clean/safe work environment as part of the team approach (i.e. dishes, garbage) and maintaining & cleaning packaging & dispensing equipment, computer, fax machine, etc.

 Clerical Organization, filing prescriptions, invoices, reports, correspondence and memos and completing any administrative support functions assigned (i.e. journals, accounts receivable, Aged Trial Balance).

 Assisting with OTC Operations and ordering, stocking, cashier duties as assigned by OTC Manager and/or Pharmacist.




Minimum Qualifications...





Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. 



Age - 16 or older



Preferred Qualifications...





Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. 



Walmart will accommodate the disability-related needs of applicants and associates as required by law.


Primary Location…


800 15 ST E, PRINCE ALBERT, SK S6V 8E3, Canada

Seiden Health is looking for a Senior Legal Assistant or Paralegal. This is a full-time, salaried position. 




The ideal candidate will work with our Executive, Medical, Quality Assurance, and Administrative teams. Tasks will vary as necessary, but include performing administrative functions for our company president/medical director, case research, writing letters & memos, administrative management of complex cases, organizing complex briefs and other case specific responsibilities. Depending on the interest of the candidate, they can also work on other legal issues including compliance, privacy, human resources, and health & safety.




This position communicates frequently with clients, so strong communication skills, both written and verbal are essential.

 


Responsibilities



Provide administrative support to lawyer, medical director

Handle communication with clients

Locate and develop case relevant information


 


Qualifications



Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience

Experience in legal assistance

Familiarity with law, legal procedures, and protocols

Experience with SABS, Insurance and privacy law


 

This is a full time job in Toronto that requires your being in office 5 days a week (when it becomes safe to do so). Our office is located at 1 Concorde Gate, Toronto, M3C 3N6.




Salary: $55,000+, commensurate with experience, negotiable…

 

 

Seiden Health

Canada’s foremost doctor-led disability and injury-management claims evaluator

 

Serving Canadian motor vehicle insurers, plaintiff and defense lawyers, corporations, unions, and government agencies, plus the injured and disabled whose claims we’re engaged to assess, Seiden Health is the number-one medical assessor of choice for those seeking independent, legally reliable evaluations, especially in catastrophic impairment, difficult-to-resolve and potentially litigious cases.





We thank all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.  Seiden Health is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodation will be provided upon request.







Covid-19




Seiden Health requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date and may require proof of vaccination.



New employees at Seiden Health may be required to train in office and may then work from home until such time as our employees are asked to return to in-office work. Flexible work arrangements may be available on an ongoing basis depending upon business need.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Transportation, Logistics and Storage, and Software Development
description:
Generix Group
 est un expert en Supply Chain Collaborative présent dans 60 pays, grâce à ses filiales et son réseau de partenaires. Plus de 6 000 entreprises dans le monde utilisent ses solutions SaaS. 

Sa plateforme collaborative, 
Generix Supply Chain Hub
, aide les entreprises à tenir les promesses qu'elles font à leurs clients. Elle combine les capacités d'exécution des flux physiques, de digitalisation des flux d'information, de gestion des processus collaboratifs et de connexion des entreprises à tous leurs partenaires, en temps réel. 

Nous proposons des systèmes d'entrepôt et de distribution (WMS), de gestion des transports et de la cour (TMS & YMS), de réapprovisionnement collaboratif, d'intégration B2B, de gestion des commandes distribuées et des solutions d'exécution de la fabrication (MES) utilisées par les fabricants, les détaillants, les distributeurs et les fournisseurs de logistique tiers dans le monde entier.




Vous désirez vous joindre à une équipe dynamique dans une compagnie sympathique à Montréal? Nous recherchons une personne dynamique et chaleureuse pour être le point de contact de nos employés au bureau.




Le/la gestionnaire de bureau sera responsable de la bonne gestion de l’édifice. Si vous êtes prêt pour cette opportunité et faire un impact positif, Groupe Generix Nord Amérique vous attend.





Tâches et responsabilités






Réception et gestion de l’immeuble



Assurer l'accueil des visiteurs, tenir le registre des visiteurs externes

Répondre au téléphone et relayer les appels

Gérer les locaux et la relation avec le gestionnaire de l'immeuble

Supporter l'organisation des événements qui se tiennent au bureau

Assurer un environnement sécuritaire des locaux

Gérer les trousses de premiers soins, respect de la loi SST, notamment pour les secouristes, et pour les procédures d'évacuation, les affichages, le respect du nombre maximal, etc.

Gérer les extincteurs, système d'alarme feu, les sprinklers (à voir avec la compagnie de gestion de l'immeuble).

Gérer l’inventaire matériel bureautique (chaises, tables, etc.)

Gérer le service d'arrosage des plantes

Gérer et entretenir le coin café, la machine à eau, la cuisine, etc.

Faire les commandes de papeterie, café, vaisselle

Gérer les places de stationnements

Gérer la plateforme de réservation RonSpot

Assurer la propreté des lieux et gérer la compagnie d'entretien des locaux

Tenir des registres des clés, des cartes d'accès, des manettes de stationnement

Assurer la gestion du chauffage et de la climatisation, offrir des conditions saines et confortables aux employés






Finance et administration



Gérer les envois et réceptions des colis, gestion des comptes FedEx, Globex Courrier, UPS

Gérer le dédouanement

Gérer la boîte postale, rediriger le courrier aux bonnes personnes numérisé

Préparer les dépôts des chèques

Classement et archivage des documents papiers et numériques

Supporter l'équipe de direction

Gérer le processus d'achat par PO

Contrôle des comptes de dépenses (gérer boîte courriel ndf)

Gérer la boîte courriel administrative

Gestion des formulaires internes

Gestion de la plateforme Egencia et approbation des demandes de réservation d'avion, de location de voitures, etc.

Participer à la diffusion de l'information de nature admin via l’intranet






Savoir-être



Service à la clientèle hors pair

Autonomie et initiative

Organisation du travail et débrouillardise

Excellentes habiletés en gestion du temps et des priorités






Exigences



DEP ou DEC en bureautique ou tout autre domaine connexe

Au moins 3 ans d’expérience dans un rôle similaire

Avoir une bonnes connaissances des outils informatiques

Savoir bien communiquer en français et anglais






* Le masculin est utilisé pour alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine. 






­­­­
 _________________________________________________________________________________________________





Generix Group
 is a Collaborative Supply Chain expert present in 60 countries, thanks to its subsidiaries and network of partners. More than 6,000 companies around the world use its SaaS solutions. 

Its collaborative platform, 
Generix Supply Chain Hub
, helps companies to keep the promises they make to their customers. It combines the capabilities to execute physical flows, digitalize information flows, manage collaborative processes and connect companies to all their partners, in real time. 

We offer warehouse and distribution systems (WMS), transportation & yard management (TMS & YMS), collaborative replenishment, B2B integration, distributed order management, and manufacturing execution (MES) solutions used by Manufacturers, Retailers, Distributors, and Third Party Logistics Providers around the globe.




You want to join a dynamic team in a friendly company in Montreal? We are looking for a dynamic and friendly person to be the point of contact for our employees in the office.




The Office Manager will be responsible for the smooth running of the building. If you are ready for this opportunity and want to make a positive impact, Generix Group North America is waiting for you.





Tasks and Responsibilities







Reception and building management


Ensure the reception of visitors, maintain the register of external visitors

Answer the phone and relay calls

Manage the premises and the relationship with the building manager

Support the organization of events held at the office

Ensure a safe and secure environment for the office

Manage first aid kits, compliance with the OHS Act, including first aiders, evacuation procedures, postings, respect of maximum number, etc.

Manage fire extinguishers, fire alarm system, sprinklers (to be arranged with the building management company).

Manage office equipment inventory (chairs, tables, etc.)

Manage the watering service for the plants

Manage and maintain the coffee corner, water machine, kitchen, etc.

Place orders for stationery, coffee, dishes

Manage parking spaces

Manage the RonSpot reservation platform

Ensure the cleanliness of the premises and manage the maintenance company

Maintain records of keys, access cards, parking levers

Manage heating and air conditioning, provide healthy and comfortable conditions for employees






Finance and Administration



Manage shipments and receipts of parcels, management of FedEx, Globex Courier, UPS accounts

Manage customs clearance

Manage the PO Box, redirect mail to the right people

Prepare check deposits

Filing and archiving of paper and digital documents

Support the management team

Manage the purchasing process by PO

Control expense accounts (manage email box)

Manage the administrative mailbox

Management of internal forms

Manage the Egencia platform and approve requests for airline reservations, car rentals, etc.

Participate in the dissemination of information of an administrative nature via the intranet






Skills



Outstanding customer service

Autonomy and initiative

Work organization and resourcefulness

Excellent time and priority management skills

Conditions of employment






Requirements



DEC or DEP in office automation or another related field

At least 3 years experience in a similar role

Have a good knowledge of computer tools

Be able to communicate well in French and English

industries: Wellness and Fitness Services, Medical Practices, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
Our Dental Office is looking for someone friendly, reliable Full-Time Dental Receptionist/Assistant.



Duties/Responsibilities




Handling front desk responsibilities including but not limited to scheduling, billing, and answering phone calls/inquiries from patients.

Assisting the dentist with various dental procedures including but not limited to restorative, endodontic, periodontics, and oral surgery. 

Sterilization of instruments.

Level I or Level II Dental Assistant.

Minimum 2 years of experience preferred.

HARP Certified.




Schedule




Willing to work in the evenings and weekends.

industries: Animation and Post-production
description:
At 
Mainframe Studios
, we’re creators first. We eat creative and technical challenges for breakfast and come back for more. We’ve been doing this for 25+ years, and we’re still going strong. We’re lucky enough to have the best team in the business. From our artists to our technical and production folks, everyone is passionate about collaborating on some kickass projects. We’ve partnered with the biggest names in the business to create a huge library of content. With partners like Mattel, Netflix, DreamWorks, Sony, Silvergate, and Nickelodeon, it's no wonder we’ve established ourselves as a creative force to be reckoned with.


WE WANT YOU
 (and your mad skills)!

Reporting to the Facility Manager, the Facility Coordinator is responsible for supporting the Facility Manager and the facility production assistant team. Responsibilities include: Front desk duties and Facility administration duties.


Responsibilities And Duties



Managing phone system, redirecting calls, taking messages and answering enquiries.

Local and International Courier administration.

Greeting clients and visitors.

Filing and data entry.

Reception training of all new Facility Production Assistants.

Facilities purchasing as needed.

Security system management.

Fire warden program coordination.

Training and mentorship of FPAs - Working with HR to support mentorship program.

Handling petty cash, company credit card, etc.

Task managing FPA group at lower level.

Supports ongoing Renovation Efforts.

Working with RT ticket system to resolve company facility tickets.

Communicate with IT regarding any equipment issues.

Managing studio equipment and furniture needs from employees.

Interacting with building maintenance to make sure studio needs are being met.

Support Facility Manager directly as needed.

Ability to work onsite at the Vancouver studio location full time, Monday to Friday.

Supports and integrates the values of Mainframe: that being a commitment to innovation, creativity, professionalism, and inspiration.

Interacts respectfully and professionally with colleagues, other staff members, partners, and clients.

Additional duties as requested.




Qualifications And Skills



3-5+ years of office experience as a Receptionist, Administrative Assistant, or similar role.

Excellent English - both spoken and written.

First Aid Level 1, Level 2 Preferred.

Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills.

Proven ability to multi-task.

Ability to handle high volume needs.

Strong organizational and prioritization skills.

Excellent customer service.

Highly trustworthy and tactful with confidential and sensitive information.

Knowledge of Excel, Word, PDF editing and Google Suite.

Phone switchboard experience.

Solid work ethic and positive attitude.

Efficient and detail oriented.

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively.

Ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely.

Ability to deliver work on time and meet set performance objectives.

Ability to perform the physical requirements of the job (light to moderate lifting, prolonged sitting and standing, repetitive stress).

Class 5 Driver's Licence.



--


Mainframe Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer, which means we will not discriminate against any individual based on race, colour, sex, national origin, age, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, disability, or any factors prohibited by applicable law. This policy applies to every aspect of employment at Mainframe Studios, including recruitment, hiring, training, advancement, and termination. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and partners. Should you require accommodation throughout the recruitment process, please let us know your requirements when contacted.
